programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition starts at the Poacher Inn in South Warnborough, Hampshire, where landlady Nadia Schicchi hopes her Italian directness and business approach will win the day.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to The Forest Country House in Powys, Wales, where owner Paul Martin, joined by best friend and neighbour, Jayne Kirk, hopes his luxury B&B will impress.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week takes place at the Langside Bed and Breakfast in Fenwick, Scotland, where super-clean hosts Debbie and Jim McCalliog hope to wow their guests.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to The Tushielaw Inn in Selkirk, owned by Rab and Gail Forbes, who opened their historic inn just six months previously.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: As the B&B owners meet for the final time, Paul Martin and Jayne Kirk from The Forest Country House want to get to the bottom of Nadia's low scores.(n)

programme.title: Guy Martin: Last Flight of the Vulcan Bomber
programme.desc: The mechanic joins a select crew of engineers working to prepare the last Vulcan bomber that is capable of flight for a farewell tour of the UK. The programme features contributions from former crew members, who recall its service in conflicts from the 1950s to the Falklands, as well as serving as Britain's nuclear deterrent.(n)

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It
programme.desc: Barbara and Stephen have had 20 happy years in their Victorian riverside cottage in Surrey, but with retirement looming, they are undecided what to do next. Stephen loves their home, while Barbara dreams of starting afresh in a new home - where she would need a separate room for her drum kit. Phil Spencer comes up with a few options should they decide to up sticks, while Kirstie Allsopp is full of ideas allowing Barbara to get out her sticks. Will they decide to stay or sell?.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Boat enthusiast James Strangeways invites Kevin McCloud to survey progress on the construction of his new home, which his architect nephew Ben Hebblethwaite has designed to be as `un-houselike' as possible. James has spent the past 35 years travelling the canals and waterways of Britain, and despite never liking houses, has decided now is the time to put down roots on dry land. Ben hoped a home standing on stilts above a marsh, and incorporating ship-like qualities such as a keel-shaped roof, will be enough to satisfy his boat-mad uncle. However, Ben's contractor goes into liquidation a few months into the project, taking £87,000 of the £300,000 budget, and when James decides to make a few tweaks to the design, alarm-bells begin to ring for the young architect.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay is in New Jersey to help Rose Leone, who spent two years in a coma and came out of hospital to learn her son Michael had run her once-thriving Italian restaurant into the ground. With a menu of more than 126 dishes, the quality of the food is suffering, and even the chefs refuse to eat their own creations.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: First of a two-part special in which Gordon Ramsay heads to the Burger Kitchen in Los Angeles, where tensions are running high because owner Alan Saffron has spent his son's entire inheritance on the struggling restaurant. To make matters worse, the kitchen is run by a chef called David Blaine who shares nothing of his famous namesake's magic when it comes to cooking - and whose threatening behaviour regularly gets him into trouble.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Part two of two. The chef continues his quest to transform the fortunes of the Burger Kitchen in Los Angeles, where tensions were running high because owner Alan Saffron had spent his son's entire inheritance on the struggling restaurant. Alan gets a wake-up call from internet critics, who he believes are trying to shut him down.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Chef Gordon Ramsay visits family-run Luigi's in Orange County, California, where lazy shortcuts following the retirement of the owner's father have led the business to suffer. Ramsay faces the daunting task of reuniting a feuding family, before turning around the struggling restaurant, which currently has 126 dishes on the menu.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Chef Gordon Ramsay uses his wealth of experience in the restaurant business to help struggling hotels, motels and B&Bs across America. He visits Meson de Mesilla, a Tuscan-style hotel in Las Cruces, New Mexico. Owner and former child-star Cali Szczawinski purchased the hotel so she could perform Cher songs every night to a captive audience, but Gordon investigates whether she may be falling flat when it comes to the needs of her guests because she's too busy trying to hit the high notes on stage.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Pioneering veterinarian Dr Noel Fitzpatrick uses his talents to treat a puppy called Poppy, which has difficulties with walking, and a lurcher called Dylan needs help with a collapsed joint. The programme also features a one-year-old cat that was hit by a car on its first venture outside the house, leaving it requiring emergency treatment.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the words-and-numbers game, with Jon Richardson and Jonathan Ross taking on guest captain Lee Mack and Victoria Coren Mitchell. Jessie Cave joins Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner and Rachel Riley looks after the numbers and letters.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: An 18-year-old is rushed in after breaking his leg while playing football, and doctors worry it may have long-term implications. Meanwhile, David, who is 29, is airlifted to St George's following a head-on collision at speed, and 94-year-old Mary arrives after falling backwards down 14 steps and losing consciousness.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Doctors treat a young woman who has been thrown from a horse, which then trampled on her, and also a woman who was hit by a car while riding her motorbike on a dual carriageway. Plus, an 11-year-old boy is brought into hospital after running into a wall at school and hurting his wrist.(n)

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: Exploring life at Liverpool Women's Hospital through the eyes of male midwife Chris, a former navy trauma medic. Cameras also follow 22-year-old Kiefer, the birthing partner for his girlfriend Sophie. Following life-threatening complications during the birth of their first child, can he hold it together this time?.(n)

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: Dating show hosted by Anna Richardson in which two singletons choose a date from a selection of naked people, who will be revealed to them one body part at a time. First into the studio is 21-year-old Dom from Hampshire, who has been nominated for the show by his mum, in a desperate attempt to break his dismal dating record. Dom wants to find a girl who shares his love of adventure and isn't bothered by his posh boy charm. There's also 22-year-old pansexual Izzy, who is open to dating any gender, but with so much on offer, will she make the right choice?.(n)

programme.title: The World's Weirdest Weather
programme.desc: A visit to a town in South Carolina where it's raining popcorn-like snow - actually little balls of ice called graupel that appear harmless but could trigger avalanches. Storm chaser Geoff Mackley films a dangerous concoction of volcanic ash, rocks, debris and water called lahar, and a man in Newfoundland records footage of a strange, rolling bank of fog that looks like a tsunami. In Canberra, there's a giant tornado born not from a thundercloud but from a colossal firestorm, while in the Peak District, strong winds defy gravity - blowing a waterfall upwards.(n)

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: `Deadly' (aka David) found fame with his UK garage crew, and though he may be confident on stage, he's shy and retiring with the ladies. Can he bring his A-game when he meet teaching assistant Helen? Other diners include rock fan Anthony, who meets retired nurse and fellow northerner Barbara. She's an amateur magician with a few dating tricks up her sleeve.(n)

programme.title: The Last Leg
programme.desc: Adam Hills, Josh Widdicombe and Alex Brooker are joined by celebrity guests for a comic review of the significant moments of the past seven days. The trio offer their own unique insight into some of the most difficult and delicate issues in modern Britain, and answer that most important of questions: Is it OK?.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Tracey and Gareth Sadd love the northern part of Tenerife and are keen to find a bolt-hole that they can escape to regularly. Presenter Jasmine Harman searches the local market to find properties to match the couple's £110,000 budget in the hope that they'll like one of them enough to make an offer.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Liverpool couple John and Pauline McDonough both have demanding jobs in the pharmaceutical industry and want to find a relaxing bolt-hole to escape to in Spain's Granada province. Laura Hamilton shows them five properties starting at just under £86,000 in the hope that they will make an offer.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman helps married couple Ali and Ben Brown from Kent find their ideal property abroad, as she shows them five places on the Spanish island of Gran Canaria.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: London-based couple Rena Sodhi and Donna Carty want a second home they can escape to in Mojacar, southern Spain. Laura Hamilton finds a townhouse with stunning views for £25,000 less than their budget, but the buyers spot something even more tempting in the presenter's line up of possible purchases.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman helps couple Jane and David Turnbull, who have a budget of £80,000, to search for a house in Lanzarote. The property must have a lot of potential, and the pressure is on as it will eventually become their retirement home.(n)

programme.title: Great Canal Journeys
programme.desc: Part two of two. Timothy West and Prunella Scales leave India's canals behind to explore the Brahmaputra river, a rarely navigated stretch of water with a remarkable history. They follow an old tea trading route, meet a community of monks and take a ride on an elephant.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The fiery chef comes to the aid of a French restaurant in the heart of Moorpark, California. The pompous, over-complicated cuisine is keeping the customers away and there is an imminent threat of bankruptcy. However, the owner is vigorously opposed to change, despite the failings of his current business model.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Chef Gordon Ramsay heads to the Park's Edge restaurant in Atlanta, Georgia, where a series of spats with the local community are hampering its success. Owners Richard and Jorge's in-fighting has alienated locals, and the duo's suggestion that customer numbers are low because of racism has heightened tensions.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay checks in at the 90-year-old Monticello Hotel in Longview, Washington, where owner Phillip Lovingfoss has an apparent liking for alcohol that some of his staff claim is threatening to destroy the business. The challenge of turning around the hotel's fortunes only increases when the chef sees shocking allegations about Phillip splashed all over the front page of the local newspaper.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The chef comes to the aid of Lela's, a California restaurant that is currently being run into the ground by its inexperienced owner. Gordon tries to turn the failing business around, but faces opposition from the chef and makes enemies when he exposes the suspect behaviour of some members of staff.(n)

programme.title: Ackley Bridge
programme.desc: Missy suffers a traumatic discovery regarding Nana Booth, and fearing that social services will take Haley into care, she keeps everything a secret until she forced to ask Emma for help with money. Meanwhile, Nas is left feeling heartbroken when her relationship with Lila starts to hit rocky ground, and Kaneez realises she has to alert Mandy about the Booth girls when she gets caught in a fight between Simone and Missy. School drama series, starring Jo Joyner, Paul Nicholls and Sunetra Sarker.(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.desc: Documentary giving an insight into cash-strapped Britain from the perspectives of debtors, creditors and those who collect the payments, including High Court enforcement bailiffs and repossession teams. The series follows each case as it unfolds, recording the thoughts and feelings on both sides, the process of repossession and the impact it has on all involved.(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.desc: Agents Stewart and Iain head to Manchester, where a landlord is owed £8,000 in rent arrears and has already called for police back-up. As tempers rise, the pair must find a way to handle a situation that is spiralling dangerously out of control. Meanwhile, Brian and Del chase £3,000 owed to a firm of letting agents, before tracking a debtor who was accidentally over-paid for a job. Plus, Stewart and Iain face an eviction that is set to test their patience.(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.desc: In this special episode, the High Court enforcement agents have to deal with a fraudulent tenant, an evasive debtor and a mother in denial. Steve and Ben are in west London to see a tenant who owes £14,000 in unpaid rent, but when they gain access to the property they discover the house has divided up like a hotel and is being sublet. In Sussex, Brian and Del chase a debt of over £10,000 owed to a van rental business for damaged vehicles, before heading to Kent to try to reclaim £6,000 of unpaid rent from a woman financially dependent on a new partner after a disastrous divorce.(n)

programme.title: Blind Date
programme.desc: Paul O'Grady seeks a would-be sweetheart for Arnold, who emigrated from Africa to Manchester, and served with the British Army in Afghanistan for nearly five years. Arnold's idea of a perfect date would involve a spin on the London Eye, and Paul gives three ladies a chance to woo the gentlemanly soldier. Meanwhile, finance director Gemma - also from Manchester - seeks an adventurous Prince Charming to settle down and start a family with. Plus, the host catches up with last week's couples, to find out whether that initial spark of attraction could develop into something more.(n)

programme.title: On Benefits
programme.sub-title: On Benefits: UK's Most Hated Woman?.
programme.desc: The documentary about people on benefits meets a whole new group - those who are living quite comfortably on little money. They include Worcester woman Susanne, who gave up work eight months ago due to a heart problem and now claims £1,600 a month. Eager to live the celebrity lifestyle, she drives a £28,000 car and hit the headlines in January after making an unsuccessful claim on a £33million National Lottery ticket. Others featured are Carl from the Isle of Sheppey, who spends most of his time and money at his local pub, and Bradford man Craig, who gave up his job two years ago to be a full-time single dad to his seven-year-old son.(n)

programme.title: On Benefits
programme.desc: Single mum Debra has a number of failed relationships behind her and now wants to buy her own home. When the chance of a part in a movie comes up, she hopes this will be the big break she is hoping for. Maidstone man Anthony thinks his epilepsy is putting off potential employers, Hull carer Anne Marie says she does not receive enough money to take her granddaughter out for day trips, while Steven from Southend spends his benefits helping to feed the homeless.(n)

programme.title: Wentworth Prison
programme.desc: Jake presses Vera to move in with him, Juice gets her comeuppance, Ferguson takes over from Kaz, and Boomer reveals an unsuspected talent.(n)

programme.title: The Frozen Ground
programme.desc: An Alaska state trooper tries to bring a serial killer who has been terrorising the Anchorage area for 13 years to justice. When a woman escapes the maniac's clutches, the lawman seeks her help in identifying him, but finds he will have a hard time earning her trust. Fact-based crime drama, with Nicolas Cage, John Cusack and Vanessa Hudgens.(n)

programme.title: The Martian
programme.desc: A lone astronaut is left behind on the hostile surface of Mars after an exploratory mission goes awry, and must use his ingenuity to create a habitat where he can survive. Meanwhile, his crewmates and a team of scientists work to rescue him, in defiance of NASA protocol(n)

programme.title: K-PAX
programme.desc: Prot (Kevin Spacey) is a mysterious patient at a mental hospital who claims to be from a far away planet called K-Pax and that Earth is too bright for his eyes. He is handed over by psychiatrist Mark Powell (Jeff Bridges) who notices that the man sounds very convincing. This new finding makes Dr. Powell wonder about his own abilities to distinguish reality from fantasy. The plot of K-Pas shares many contact points with Man Facing Southeast by Eliseo Subiela(n)

programme.title: Dumb and Dumber
programme.desc: About a couple of clowns who gain possession of a beautiful woman's briefcase. Lloyd is a limousine chauffeur who sets out to return the bag to Mary, one of his Clients.With his friend Harry, who runs a pet grooming agency, Lloyd sets off for the skiing resort of Aspen to give the bag back. The journey is fraught with hilarious complications, as the boys encounter mobsters, police and locals who are even more crazy t(n)

programme.title: Bachelor Party
programme.desc: Bawdy comic tale about a happy-go-lucky school bus driver who falls for a wealthy woman and decides to marry her, despite the disapproval of her snobbish parents. The night before the wedding, he and his friends decide to hold the stag party to end all stag parties, while his fiancee and her friends plan to spy on them. Meanwhile, her parents try to find a way of luring their daughter away from her unsuitable fiance(n)

programme.title: Wish I Was Here
programme.desc: A 35-year-old father who's never quite grown up learns about life when he's forced to homeschool his kids, since their grandpa can no longer afford their private-school tuition and their public school is a mess(n)

programme.title: Fred Claus
programme.desc: Vince Vaughn stars as Santa's loser older brother Fred, forced into helping out the elves after Saint Nick (Paul Giamatti) bails him out of trouble. Comedic violence. (2008)(118 mins)(n)

programme.title: Austin Powers: The Spy Who Shagged Me
programme.desc: The randy spy must travel back to the swinging sixties to retrieve his mojo after it is stolen by one of Dr. Evil's more revolting henchmen. Gloriously funny comedy starring Mike Myers(n)

programme.title: Enter the Dragon
programme.desc: Bruce Lee is the martial artist competing with international bruisers and cracking an opium racket in his spare time. An explosive action feast for fight fans(n)

programme.title: Constantine
programme.desc: A cop tangles with demons and angels when she probes her twin's death with a man who has literally been to hell and back. Supernatural thriller based on the "Hellblazer" graphic novels(n)

programme.title: Hereafter
programme.desc: Three people dealing with their own experience of the afterlife find their lives intertwining. Drama(n)

programme.title: Any Given Sunday
programme.desc: 'On any given Sunday you're gonna win or you're gonna lose. The point is - can you win or lose like a man?' Macho stuff from director Oliver Stone, with a cast of heavyweights from both cinema and pro sport(n)

programme.title: Dallas Buyers Club
programme.desc: The powerful true story of Texas electrician Ron Woodroof, who was diagnosed as HIV positive in 1986, and subsequently devoted his life to providing unapproved drugs and supplements to fellow HIV patients during an era when doctors were still struggling to understand the virus(n)

programme.title: The Informant!
programme.desc: This quirky thriller follows Mark Whitacre, who discovers that his company is involved in price-fixing and turns informant for the FBI. Convinced he'll be a hero, he wears a wire to gather the evidence needed to convict his bosses. Unfortunately, both the case and Whitacre's integrity are compromised when FBI agents discover that he isn't the saintly figure he made himself out to be(n)

programme.title: The Adventures of Ford Fairlane
programme.desc: Stand-up comic Andrew Dice Clay stars as Los Angeles private-eye Ford Fairlane in this outrageous comedy-adventure. A detective to the stars, Fairlane is called in to investigate the mysterious death of a heavy metal singer, soon finding himself embroiled in a dangerous plot of treachery, double-cross and murder(n)

programme.title: Semi-Pro
programme.desc: One-hit wonder Jackie Moon uses his musical earnings to buy a basketball team, but must fight to keep his side in the game(n)

programme.title: Keeping the Faith
programme.desc: Best friends, a priest and a rabbi both fall in love with the same girl. However, neither of the men can pursue the relationship due to their religious beliefs: the priest cannot break his vow of celibacy and the rabbi cannot marry her since she is not Jewish(n)

programme.title: Zoolander
programme.desc: Satire about a dim male supermodel who loses ground to a newcomer, then unwittingly becomes involved in an assassination plot(n)

programme.title: High Anxiety
programme.desc: The new head of a mental institution is accused of murder(n)

programme.title: Casanova
programme.desc: A retelling of the legend of the infamous 18th century Venetian lover. Casanova is ordered to clean up his act and marry a virtuous virgin by the Doge, but opts to pursue her tempestuous sister instead(n)

programme.title: National Treasure
programme.desc: Action drama in which a treasure hunter (Nicholas Cage) finds the map to a secret war chest hidden by America's Founding Fathers. He is close to discovering its whereabouts, but so is his colleague-turned-enemy, and the FBI are also on the case(n)

programme.title: The Road Warrior
programme.desc: "Mad Max" sequel about survival in a post-apocalyptic wasteland. Mel GIbson, Bruce Spence. Wez: Vernon Wells. Feral Kid: Emil Minty. Pappagallo: Mike Preston. Humungus: Kjell Nilsson. Warrior Woman: Virginia Hey. Curmudgeon: Syd Heylen. George Miller directed(n)

programme.title: The Take

programme.title: Domestic Disturbance
programme.desc: A divorced boat builder discovers that his young son's stepdad is masking an evil side, forcing him to desperately try to protect his ex-wife and son from the new man in their lives(n)

programme.title: Steve Jobs
programme.desc: This biographical drama explores the genius and shortcomings of computing guru Steve Jobs in backstage vignettes spanning 14 years, as he and his closest advisers prepare for three different public presentations of era-defining technologies(n)

programme.title: By the Sea
programme.desc: In this intense romantic drama set in 1970s France, a former dancer and her writer husband attempt to revive their marriage by taking a cross-country journey to a small coastal town, where they bond with its quirky inhabitants(n)

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Catch a Contractor
programme.desc: Adam Carolla hunts for a contractor who turned a home into a potential deathtrap at risk of collapsing after he inadvertently removed a load-bearing wall.(n)

programme.title: CSI: NY
programme.desc: Mac and the team investigate the death of a hotel employee who plummeted from a balcony, and are alerted to another case by the sound of gunfire. Rushing to the scene, they find a woman who has shot dead a man for attacking her husband - an incident that brings back painful memories for Stella, who once killed a boyfriend in self-defence.(n)

programme.title: CSI: NY
programme.desc: Mac, Hawkes and Lindsay investigate the death of a woman found on a subway train and discover that although her hands and face are covered in blood, she has no obvious injuries. Meanwhile, Danny and Stella visit the home of a playboy bachelor who drowned in his indoor pool - and are surprised to learn he has a wedding-cake decoration lodged in his lung. Crime drama, starring Gary Sinise.(n)

programme.title: Secrets of Eden
programme.desc: A small community is shocked when a local man murders his wife, then kills himself. A detective uncovers evidence of an affair between the dead woman and the town's pastor and begins to suspect he may be implicated in the tragedy. To learn the truth, she must gain the trust of the couple's troubled teenage daughter. Drama, starring John Stamos and Anna Gunn.(n)

programme.title: Columbo: Murder with Too Many Notes
programme.desc: Oscar-winning composer Findlay Crawford relies on his assistant Gabriel to do all the hard work, but the younger musician demands recognition. To protect his reputation, Findlay kills Gabriel with a time-delayed drug to give himself the perfect alibi - but the slovenly sleuth sees through his ruse. Detective drama, with Peter Falk and Billy Connolly.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A navy recruitment officer is murdered at a high school and the agents discover he had recently begun a relationship with a married teacher whose wife held a grudge against him. They also find out a student's father was vehemently opposed to his joining the military, and receive help from an unexpected quarter - Ducky's esteemed predecessor, Dr Magnus. Crime drama, guest starring comedian Bob Newhart.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A former serviceman who had been having an affair is beaten to death in his own back garden, and the agents are forced to consider the possibility that his wife - a US Marine and martial arts expert - is the killer. Meanwhile, McGee becomes the subject of an embarrassing mix-up when an inflatable doll apparently purchased on his credit card is delivered. Crime drama, starring Mark Harmon.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.sub-title: A Man Walks into a Bar.
programme.desc: The agents are forced to undergo psychological evaluations conducted by Dr Rachel Cranston (guest star Wendy Makkena) while investigating the death of a submarine's commanding officer. Suspicion falls on a journalist seen arguing with the man before his demise, and Tony discovers a link between the psychotherapist shadowing the agents and Ziva's predecessor Kate Todd. Crime drama, starring Mark Harmon and Michael Weatherly.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A marine dies while saving the life of a foreign defence secretary, who was the target of an assassination attempt. Gibbs and the team are given the task of protecting the politician's daughter while she studies in America, but fail to stop her being kidnapped and ransomed in a bid to prevent her father signing an important treaty. Crime drama, starring Sean Murray and Michael Weatherly.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A marine's teeth and fingertips are found in a pickpocket's stolen purse, and Ducky discovers he had been tortured on a rack before dying. The agents realise he may have been killed in error, and that the real target was his ex-girlfriend, a skilled player of computer games who unwittingly uncovered a mysterious code. Crime drama, starring Michael Weatherly and Sean Murray.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: The agents investigate the deaths of two men killed in a shoot-out, but have to rely on a former naval intelligence officer suffering from post-traumatic stress disorder to help them close the case.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: LaSalle's family life seriously affects his work, when his brother Cade begs for help having found the body of his girlfriend Wendy in the boot of his car. With Cade having no recollection of the previous night's events, and his prints found on the rope used to hang Wendy, the team have to admit that the odds are stacked against him proving his innocence.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.sub-title: How Much Pain Can You Take?.
programme.desc: The elusive Baitfish murders LaSalle's girlfriend Savannah in an effort to send a threatening message to Pride. A city-wide manhunt is triggered and the investigation threatens to push a vengeful LaSalle over the edge - as well as endanger undercover contact Sonja Perry. Scott Bakula and Lucas Black star.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: The trial of an alleged rapist is brought to an abrupt halt by the death of his accuser, who claimed he had made her pregnant - and subsequent developments suggest the accusations may have been false. Detective drama, starring Mariska Hargitay, Christopher Meloni and Dann Florek.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Benson receives an alarming call from a girl who seems to have been abducted. Mariska Hargitay stars.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Stabler investigates an assault case involving his former partner's teenage son, who assaulted a female friend during a drug-induced rage. However, the conflict between the detective's work and personal life pushes him to the verge of a breakdown and jeopardises the squad's reputation. Drama, starring Christopher Meloni.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: The detectives examine the deaths of two gay men, both of whom were labelled as `killers' by their murderer. Further investigation reveals the victims had an aggressive strain of HIV, leading the team to consider the possibility that the suspect is a vigilante operating in the interests of an Aids-awareness group. CCH Pounder (The Shield) guest stars, with BD Wong, Dann Florek and Diane Neal.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: A sniper fires into a school playground, killing one pupil and wounding others before fleeing, leaving behind a rifle that is linked to a gun shop owned by the head of a neo-Nazi organisation. Now, he wishes to cement his reputation as the greatest thief who ever lived by stealing the Earth's satellite right out of the sky. But Gru knows that his nemesis has a mean sweet tooth, and plans to destroy him by adopting three cookie-selling orphans and commissioning a new line of cookie robots from the evil Dr. Nefario. As Gru and his diminutive yellow minions prepare to carry out the biggest heist in history, something strange happens... Gru discovers that the three little girls who have come into his life are much more than simple pawns. programme.desc: One of the first projects of syndicated TV producer Steve Rotfield, the weekly half-hour Wild About Animals was hosted by actress Mariette Hartley. The series cast its spotlight on rare animals, unique to specific regions of the United States. Regular weekly features included "K9 Cops and Animal Heroes," "Celebrity Owners," and "Animal Bloopers." First telecast in the fall of 1995, Wild About Animals was still flourishing at the end of the 20th century, by which time it was being shown in tandem with two other Rotfield efforts, The Lighter Side of Sports and Awesome Adventures, in most local markets(n)

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: The Sharpshooter. Created and written by Sam Peckinpah, the premiere episode of The Rifleman stars Chuck Connors and Johnny Crawford as Lucas and Mark McCain, father and 10-year-old son in search of settling down near North Fork, New Mexico. But when Lucas, a noted crack shot with a rifle, enters the local turkey shoot, he gets in the way of Jim Lewis (Leif Erickson), the local town czar, who has rigged the contest in favor of young Vernon Tippert (Dennis Hopper). All set to win the grand prize, Lucas is "persuaded" to throw the contest by Lewis, who uses little Mark as a bargaining tool. Sidney Blackmer and R.G. Armstrong also star in this fine television western, which premiered on ABC September 30, 1958(n)

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: The Home Ranch. A cattle baron pulls all the stops to run Lucas off his land. Jackford: Harold J. Stone. Lucas: Chuck Connors. Mark: Johnny Crawford. Sam: Steve Rowland(n)

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.sub-title: The End of a Young Gun
programme.desc: The End of a Young Gun. Michael Landon guest stars in this, the third episode in The Rifleman series. Injured after saving the life of little Mark McCain (Johnny Crawford), young outlaw Will Fulton (Landon) learns the benefits of straight living while recuperating with Mark and Lucas (Chuck Connors). When the gang returns to reclaim him, a defiant Will stands side-by-side with Lucas in the climactic shootout(n)

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: The Marshal. Future Virginian star James Drury and Paul Fix are among the guest players in this, the fourth installment of The Rifleman television series. This time Lucas McCain (Chuck Connors) takes on a broken-down, alcoholic lawman, Micah Torrance (Fix), who's hired to help build a corral. But the arrival of illiterate troublemakers Flory (Robert J. Wilke) and Andrew Sheltin (Warren Oates) spells trouble, both for Lucas and Mark (Johnny Crawford) and the town of North Fork, New Mexico. But who is the smooth-talking Lloyd Carpenter (Drury) and why is he traveling with the uncouth Shelton boys? This episode was the first to be directed by the series' creator and head writer, Sam Peckinpah(n)

programme.title: Wanted
programme.desc: Angelina Jolie, James McAvoy and Morgan Freeman star in this violent action adventure from Russian director Timur Bekmambetov. The life of office worker Wesley Gibson has been one of frustration, disappointment and anxiety; he has an overbearing boss, his girlfriend and his best friend are duplicitously having an affair, and he's on medication to calm his nerves. To top it all, he one day finds himself on the wrong end of an assassination attempt. Luckily, the agile, honed and lethal Fox is at hand to save his life. However, she also reveals that his recently deceased father was secretly a supremely skilled killer, and that it's her job to ensure that Wesley takes his place in the Fraternity, the mystical organisation overseen by Sloan, which exists to rid the world of evil-doers. And so begins Wesley's journey to unlock his hitherto unsuspected innate deadly abilities and use them for good. The cinematography echoes the inventiveness of Bekmambetov's earlier movies and takes a Matrix-like delight in playing with the tempo and camera angles of the fight scenes(n)

programme.title: The Young Messiah
programme.desc: Based on the novel Christ the Lord: Out of Egypt by Anne Rice, The Young Messiah is a biblical drama that imagines the life of Jesus at age seven. As his family travel from Egypt to Nazareth, the young Jesus (Adam Greaves-Neal) wishes to learn more about his identity and place in the world. Meanwhile, Herod Antipas (Jonathan Bailey) dispatches a Roman centurion (Sean Bean) to hunt down and kill the boy, whose miraculous powers might be a threat to his reign. Sara Lazzaro and Vincent Walsh also star in this film from director Cyrus Nowrasteh(n)

programme.title: The Hunted
programme.desc: An American businessman in Japan becomes the quarry of a cult of ninja assassins after he witnesses a woman's murder(n)

programme.title: Lights Out
programme.desc: A supernatural being that can only be seen when the lights go out attacks a family and one of them has to step up to protect the others(n)

programme.title: The Signal
programme.desc: Three students seek a notorious hacker in the Nevada desert, and end up imprisoned in a high-tech government-research facility in this nightmarish sci-fi thriller(n)

programme.title: Flight of the Phoenix
programme.desc: Based on a novel by Elleston Trevor, director John Moore's The Flight of the Phoenix is a remake of a 1965 film of the same name starring film icon James Stewart. The story revolves around the plight of Captain Frank Towns (Dennis Quaid), a pilot whose C-119 cargo plane full of oil workers could not withstand the violent winds of a desert sandstorm. Stranded in the harsh terrain of Mongolia's Gobi Desert (a departure from the original, in which the plane crashed in the Sahara), Frank and his navigator face an equal challenge in maintaining order among the survivors. The group of oilmen had planned on an uneventful trip to shut off a group of rigs falling below their productivity expectations -- not fending for their very lives. Before long, some men are revealed as cowards, while others exhibit a surprising show of strength, all the while hoping that the wreckage of the original plane can be salvaged before a Lord of the Flies situation occurs. Miranda Otto is featured in a supporting role, as well as Giovanni Ribisi and Tyrese Gibson(n)

programme.title: Into the Blue
programme.desc: While treasure hunting in the Bahamas, a group of young divers discover a wrecked cargo plane on the ocean's floor. Within lies millions of dollars of illegal drugs, and the divers' dream of finding sunken treasure has come true. But as they argue among themselves about what to do with their prize, the friends soon realize they're not the only ones interested in the narcotics. Dangerous criminals are also searching for the drugs, and now the treasure hunters themselves have become the hunted(n)

programme.title: Spider-Man

programme.title: The Rookie
programme.desc: Nick Pulovski is a cop, presently assigned to the auto theft division. When he discovers that a man named Strom is the brains behind a major car theft and chop shop ring, he sees this as his opportunity to do something big. After his partner is killed, the case is then transferred to homicide, so he is taken off the case. And he is assigned a new partner, a cop who would prefer to play by the rules(n)

programme.title: The Revenant

The hitcher is a brutal serial killer who decides to set up the young driver as the fall guy for a string of horrific murders as part of a macabre game of cat and mouse(n)

programme.title: Cirque du Freak: The Vampire's Assistant
programme.desc: If you thought Harry Potter was cool, just wait until you meet Darren Shan (Chris Massoglia)! After being turned into a vampire, Darren joins a traveling freak show and attempts to stop a war between the vampires and their bitter rivals, the Vampanese. John C. Reilly, Willem Dafoe, Salma Hayek(n)

programme.title: Fantastic Four
programme.desc: Brilliant scientist Reed Richards builds a device that allows users to teleport to an alternate dimension, but an experiment involving it goes wrong and leaves him and his three teammates with unusual superpowers. The quartet are then forced to work together to battle an enemy from their past. This reboot of the iconic Marvel superhero team stars Miles Teller as Richards (who becomes Mr. Fantastic, able to bend and stretch his body into impossible shapes), Michael B. Jordan as Johnny Storm (aka the Human Torch, whose body can erupt in flames), Kate Mara as Sue Storm (aka the Invisible Woman -- no explanation needed), and Jamie Bell as Ben Grimm (who is transformed into the rock monster known as The Thing). Directed by Josh Trank, who previously worked with Jordan on the superhero film Chronicle(n)

programme.title: MI-5
programme.desc: Will Holloway, a former MI-5 agent, is forced to partner with Harry Pearce, the man who decommissioned him, to apprehend a terrorist who escaped during routine prisoner transport and prevent an attack on the city of London. Based on the British television series "Spooks."(n)

programme.title: Body of Lies
programme.desc: Trust no one. Deceive everyone. When idealistic CIA agent Roger Ferris (Di Caprio -- The Departed, Blood Diamond) is stationed in Jordan after being wounded in Iraq, he dedicates his life to stopping further attacks by Al Qaeda. Following a plan that the British employed successfully against the Nazis, Ferris plants the suspicion among the terrorists that their leaders are collaborating with the Americans. But as the stakes rise and Ferris finds himself in the crosshairs, the plot he starts spirals into an outcome he could never have foreseen(n)

programme.title: Trespass

programme.title: Cursed
programme.desc: The team behind the Scream trilogy, director Wes Craven and screenwriter Kevin Williamson, present another entry in the teen-horror genre with Cursed. Starring Christina Ricci and Jesse Eisenberg, the film tells the story of two siblings who have to battle a werewolf that has been wreaking havoc on their neighbors, just as they learn that they might be marked with "the sign of the beast," and may become werewolves themselves. Along with Shannon Elizabeth and Judy Greer, Cursed also co-stars Dawson Creek alumnus Joshua Jackson, as well as R&B star Mya(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features. Including NewsWatch at 7.45.(n)

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Live
programme.desc: The Hairy Bikers Si King and Dave Myers serve as hosts this weekend, inviting guest Alex James to sample dishes prepared in the studio by chefs Tim Siadatan and Elizabeth Haigh.(n)

programme.title: Mary Berry Cooks
programme.desc: The food writer and Great British Bake Off judge demonstrates how to cater for a large gathering of guests at a special occasion. She prepares dishes for a buffet supper, including beef and mushroom stew with mustard mash, salmon en croute with salad, chocolate and orange panna cotta and a meringue tranche with berries and cream.(n)

programme.title: Tennis from Eastbourne
programme.desc: The AEGON International. John Inverdale presents coverage of the final from the Devonshire Park Lawn Tennis Club in Eastbourne, on the concluding day of the tournament. With Wimbledon set to begin on Monday, the finalists will look to go into the Grand Slam on a high by emulating the success of Dominika Cibulkova here last year, who claimed her first grass court title with a 7-5, 6-3 victory over Karolina Pliskova. With commentary by Sam Smith and Gigi Salmon.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson tries to help two sisters who dream of escaping their urban homes and moving to the Devon countryside on a budget of £490,000. Away from the property search, Jules tries his hand at one of the county's oldest trades.(n)

programme.title: Indiana Jones and the Last Crusade
programme.desc: The intrepid archaeologist sets out to find his estranged father, who has gone missing while searching for the Holy Grail. Once reunited, the duo team up to finish the task and locate the sacred relic before the Nazis get their hands on it. Action adventure sequel directed by Steven Spielberg, starring Harrison Ford, Sean Connery, Alison Doody, River Phoenix, Julian Glover and Denholm Elliott.(n)

programme.title: Pointless Celebrities
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman present a family-themed edition of the quiz, featuring Louis Theroux and Nancy Strang, Michael Underwood and Angellica Bell, Calum and Angie Best, and Gary and Harry Lineker.(n)

programme.title: Doctor Who
programme.desc: Peter Capaldi's tenure as the Doctor draws close to its conclusion, as the Mondasian Cybermen rise. Not seen since the classic, pre-2005 series, the original Cybermen came from Mondas, `Earth's twin planet', and posed a fearsome threat to the Time Lord and his companions. Now, these sinister cyborgs begin a new conquest, and the Doctor makes a final stand to protect a tiny band of humans from utter destruction. Pearl Mackie and Matt Lucas also star as Bill and Nardole, Michelle Gomez reprises her role as Missy, while John Simm puts in an appearance as the Master. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Pitch Battle
programme.desc: Mel Giedroyc hosts the third heat of the choral music contest, as six more choirs and vocal groups battle for a place in the Grand Final. This time, Kings College London's All the King's Men, Polish jazz ensemble Alle Choir, the London International Gospel Choir, all-female soul act Songbird Sessions, Welsh choir Sgarmes, and the newly formed 4 Tune Tellers and Kimmy all seek to impress judges Gareth Malone, Kelis, and guest adjudicator Bebe Rexha. Plus, Pitch Battle's resident music director Deke Sharon opens the contest with a musical mash-up.(n)

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: The ED staff are surprised when Sam shows up to work in scrubs instead of his usual suit. He reveals he has stepped down as medical director, and is now joining the department as a speciality doctor. Dylan struggles to cope in the wake of Cal's death, and ends up having a panic attack while trying to treat a feisty retired nurse who admitted herself to hospital with a self-diagnosed heart attack. Luckily, David is on hand to reach out to the difficult patient, and get to the bottom of what's bothering Dylan.(n)

programme.title: Avengers Assemble
programme.desc: A mystical artefact is stolen from a top-secret military base by Thor's brother Loki, who plans to use it to bring about an alien invasion. Spymaster Nick Fury brings together a team of superheroes, including Iron Man, Thor, Captain America and the Hulk, to defend Earth from the impending attack. Action adventure uniting the Marvel comic-book characters, starring Robert Downey Jr, Chris Evans, Chris Hemsworth, Mark Ruffalo, Scarlett Johansson, Tom Hiddleston, Jeremy Renner and Samuel L Jackson.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features.(n)

programme.title: The Andrew Marr Show
programme.desc: A round-up of the week's stories, featuring interviews with key figures in politics and current affairs and a round-up of the Sunday papers. Including news and weather at 9.00.(n)

programme.title: Sunday Morning Live
programme.desc: Writer Jimmy McGovern discusses his latest series Broken, and Sean Fletcher discusses living without social media.(n)

programme.title: Sunday Politics London
programme.desc: The week's events at Westminster, presented by Andrew Neil. Including news and a regional round-up.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Antiques experts Charles Hanson and Charlie Ross guide the red and blue teams around the Ardingly Antiques and collectors fair, where presenter Tim Wonnacott spots a rare pair of silver salt cellars.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Developers Lucy Alexander and Martin Roberts explore a large semi-detached property in Rotherham, South Yorkshire, a former chapel in Fraddon, Cornwall and a small terraced house in Putney, south-west London. They then speak to the owners about their plans for the buildings and find out how much they paid for them at auction.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore prevents a post-war table, a used suitcase and an old radio from being dumped at the tip in Stockport, and sets about transforming them in the hope they can be sold.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin heads to rural Lincolnshire to help two canal boat enthusiasts find a home to suit their lives on dry land. Away from the house hunt, he helps power up one of the county's iconic windmills.(n)

programme.title: Eat Well for Less
programme.desc: Gregg Wallace and Chris Bavin help the Brook family from Nottingham lower their food bills, and show them ways to follow a healthier diet while saving money on their weekly shop. Daughters Rosie and Sophia prefer snacking on sugary treats than following a healthy, balanced diet, and their fussy eating habits mean Mum Janine is forced to cook separate meals for the family each night.(n)

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: Aled Jones visits Chatsworth House for its first ever flower show, and Pam Rhodes learns about the estate's royal history. With hymns from St John the Baptist's Church in Tideswell.(n)

programme.title: Sue Barker: Our Wimbledon
programme.desc: The presenter travels the globe meeting Wimbledon greats such as Andy Murray, Roger Federer, Pete Sampras, Billie Jean King and Martina Navratilova.(n)

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Ellie Harrison meets a family making natural cordials and presses using their own elderflowers, before visiting Worcester Cathedral to catch a glimpse of its lesser horseshoe bats, thought to be the only urban population in the country. Adam Henson heads to the Peak District and explains why he has decided to send his beef cattle to an animal sanctuary in Norfolk rather than the slaughterhouse.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce introduces a selection of unscreened items from recent shows. Among the fascinating finds are a garnet and diamond cross believed by the owner to have been gifted by Marie Antoinette en route to the guillotine, and a suitcase of unopened letters from an imprisoned First World War soldier that finally reveal their secrets. Plus, an arts-and-crafts casket once intended to be the final resting place of a woman's ashes.(n)

programme.title: Poldark
programme.desc: A grain ship is raided by starving villagers, and George arranges a harsh punishment for the desperate peasants while throwing a lavish Christmas party to impress the local gentry. Caroline hears news that the Admiralty has arranged for the release of the British officers, but Ross is not convinced, lamenting the loss of Wheal Leisure to George, and having seen miners broken by the terms of their labour. Demelza gives birth to a daughter, and warns Morwenna against a relationship with Drake.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: A to Z of TV Gardening
programme.desc: Carol Kirkwood looks at subjects beginning with the letter T, continuing her alphabetical journey through the world of horticulture. Along the way, she gets inspiration and advice from some of the BBC's most popular gardening presenters.(n)

programme.title: Carnival Story
programme.desc: A pickpocket joins a circus travelling through Germany and is seduced by a cruel barker. She gets a job as assistant to a devoted high dive jumper, who proposes to her, but is unable to forget her feelings for her heartless old lover, leading to a fatal conflict between the two men. Drama, with Anne Baxter, Steve Cochran and Lyle Bettger.(n)

programme.title: The Maggie
programme.desc: A brash American businessman hires a small Scottish company to move a set of valuable furniture to his new home on a remote island. However, he soon learns that his belongings are to be transported on a dilapidated boat in desperate need of repair - and sets out in hot pursuit of them. Ealing comedy, with Paul Douglas, Alex Mackenzie, James Copeland and Tommy Kearins.(n)

programme.title: Monty Halls' Great Irish Escape
programme.desc: Monty tries to track dolphins off the west coast of Ireland using sonar technology, recording the whistles and clicks they use to communicate with each other. He also visits Inishturk, one of the country's most remote inhabited islands, where he recruits the school's seven pupils as whale and dolphin watchers, enjoys a magical underwater encounter with seals and throws a party for the locals.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts surveys a Derbyshire mill worker's cottage, Lucy Alexander visits a father and daughter buying a Kent house, and Dion Dublin assesses a Suffolk investment property.(n)

programme.title: Food & Drink
programme.desc: Chef and The Incredible Spice Men co-presenter Tony Singh joins Michel Roux Jr to prove that even in winter it's possible to eat well using seasonally available ingredients. Tony prepares a feast of venison with haggis ravioli, while Kate Goodman has a guide to matching whisky with food. Plus, author and broadcaster Stefan Gates joins in for a debate on food miles and their environmental impact.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Two teams select antiques for auction in Newark, Nottinghamshire. Expert Catherine Southon has her patience tested to the limit with the tactical red team, while Richard Madley manages to lose his animal-loving blue team. Presented by Tim Wonnacott.(n)

programme.title: Talking Pictures
programme.desc: Sylvia Syms narrates a retrospective look at the life of actor Peter O'Toole, using material from the BBC archive to reveal the highlights and milestones of his distinguished career.(n)

programme.title: Kidnapped
programme.desc: A boy who is the heir to a fortune is abducted and sent off to sea by his scheming uncle, who stands to get his hands on the family riches. However, the lad teams up with a Jacobite fugitive, and the pair embark on a perilous journey across Scotland to see justice done. Historical adventure, based on Robert Louis Stevenson's novel, starring Peter Finch and James MacArthur.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore faces a daunting tasks as she enlists furniture expert Jay Blades and dress designer Chinelo to help her turn a profit on seven rusty chairs and an old leather sofa.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: Paul Martin and the team value items at Blackpool Tower Circus. James Lewis examines an assortment of watches that have been in the back of a wardrobe for years and David Fletcher gets his hands on a pistol dating back to the Battle of Waterloo, however a collection of military medals could outshine them both. Paul looks around Lancashire's oldest family home and its antiques amassed by 14 generations.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Rachel de Thame joins Monty Don at Longmeadow to add more medicinal planting to the herb garden - especially those that bees love. She also investigates how gardeners can aid honey bee conservation and protect the nation's favourite pollinators. Monty visits a garden in Herefordshire to see a collection of Siberian Iris, which inspires him to create a new Iris patch, adding warmth and splash of colour into his dry garden. The green-fingered experts also discover a garden containing a stunning collection of clematis Montana. Plus, Nick Bailey reveals how to plan, design and build a border fit for any garden, while in Somerset, Carol Klein visits the home of Margery Fish, the writer who exercised a strong influence on the informal style of the cottage garden, before her death in 1969.(n)

programme.title: The Day the Dinosaurs Died
programme.desc: Documentary examining whether an asteroid strike 66 million years ago triggered a worldwide catastrophe, killing off the dinosaurs and wiping out 75 per cent of all life on Earth. Evolutionary biologist Ben Garrod joins a multimillion pound drilling expedition into the exact spot in the Gulf of Mexico that was the point of impact, while palaeopathologist Alice Roberts meets leading scientists to find if the effects could have wiped out dinosaurs across the world almost immediately.(n)

programme.title: Natural World
programme.sub-title: Nature's Wildest Weapons: Horns, Tusks and Antlers: Natural World.
programme.desc: Professor Doug Emlen examines how animals use their bodies as weapons in epic battles to gore, stab, crush and batter their adversaries to death, from elephants to rhinoceros beetles, assessing whether they are more than just instruments of blunt force. For the professor this has been a lifetime's ambition to discover the secrets of nature's arms races, what triggers them and what they can teach us about the most formidable weapons on Earth - our own.(n)

programme.title: Manchester International Festival: Everyone Welcome
programme.desc: Lemn Sissay tours Manchester's biennial international arts festival, which takes on a more poignant tone in the wake of the terror attack at Manchester Arena in May. Featuring more than 60 new works by local and international artists, this year's festival looks set to maintain a tradition of offering daring and provocative perspectives on modern life, while also aiming to raise the city's spirits and provide fresh hope to its residents. Lemn previews the works on display, and gains access to rehearsals by New Order, Shunt Collective and Susan Hefuna.(n)

programme.title: Dad's Army
programme.desc: Frazer is asked to look after the platoon's Lewis gun, but finds himself in hot water when he misplaces the spring - and fears it is has been left inside a coffin. Second World War comedy first shown in 1969, starring John Laurie, Arthur Lowe and John Le Mesurier.(n)

programme.title: Melvyn Bragg on TV: The Box that Changed the World
programme.desc: Ken Loach, Joan Bakewell, Trevor Phillips, Michael Grace, Martha Kearney, Ed Balls, Lyse Doucet and Alex Crawford join Melvyn Bragg as he explores the extraordinary impact British television has made on the nation's culture since its first great unifying moment - the coronation of Queen Elizabeth II in 1953. Filmed at Bafta, Bragg and his interviewees highlight the way television has reflected and influenced Great Britain as a whole, challenging authority, redefining celebrity, and evolving the concept of democracy.(n)

programme.title: Sex & Drugs & Rock & Roll
programme.desc: Biopic of highly influential punk singer Ian Dury, examining his lifelong struggle with the disability caused by contracting polio as a child, and the impact his rise to fame in the late 1970s and volatile personality had on those closest to him, particularly his son Baxter. Starring Andy Serkis, Bill Milner, Naomie Harris and Olivia Williams.(n)

programme.title: The Deep
programme.desc: A fishing trawler in the North Atlantic capsizes, leading to the deaths of the entire crew except one, who manages against all odds to swim back to shore. The extraordinary feat makes him a national hero on his return home, but he remains tormented by the memory of the friends who did not survive. Fact-based drama, starring Olafur Darri Olafsson and Johann G Johannsson. In Icelandic.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: The Instant Gardener
programme.desc: Helen Skelton and Danny Clarke head to Croydon to create exotic, Jamaican-style garden for owner Carmen, who needs a tranquil space to remember her lost daughter. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Rachel de Thame joins Monty Don at Longmeadow to add more medicinal planting to the herb garden - especially those that bees love. She also investigates how gardeners can aid honey bee conservation and protect the nation's favourite pollinators. Monty visits a garden in Herefordshire to see a collection of Siberian Iris, which inspires him to create a new Iris patch, adding warmth and splash of colour into his dry garden. The green-fingered experts also discover a garden containing a stunning collection of clematis Montana. Plus, Nick Bailey reveals how to plan, design and build a border fit for any garden, while in Somerset, Carol Klein visits the home of Margery Fish, the writer who exercised a strong influence on the informal style of the cottage garden, before her death in 1969.(n)

programme.title: The Beechgrove Garden
programme.desc: Jim McColl investigates the mysterious death of a hedge and suspects foul play, and meets a couple who have created a high-up hidden gem of a garden in Ballinluig. Carole Baxter pays a second visit to Ardersier to see how Mari Reid and friends are getting on Vegetable Gardening on a Budget.(n)

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher reports from Carmarthenshire, where he meets an expert on birds of prey in Carmarthenshire who uses drones designed to look like birds to train falcons to hunt. He takes a look behind the scenes in the workshop where they are built and visits a breeding unit for peregrine falcon chicks. Plus, a selection of reports from the series featuring working animals.(n)

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Best Bites
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt revisits highlights from throughout the series, offering viewers a chance to revisit some of their favourite moments from previous years in the kitchen.(n)

programme.title: Wimbledon 2017
programme.desc: A look back at last year's tournament at the All England Club, which saw Andy Murray and Serena Williams crowned as men's and ladies' singles champions.(n)

programme.title: Athletics
programme.sub-title: Athletics: Diamond League Highlights: 2017 Meeting de Paris.
programme.desc: The Meeting de Paris. Gabby Logan introduces action from the seventh meeting of the season, which took place at Stade de France.(n)

programme.title: Live Athletics
programme.desc: Gabby Logan presents live coverage of day two from Alexander Stadium in Birmingham, where Britain's best athletes will try to qualify for the IAAF World Championships in Athletics, which is due to take place at The Olympic Stadium in London next Month. With commentary by Steve Cram, Steve Backley, Paula Radcliffe and Andrew Cotter, and analysis from Colin Jackson, Denise Lewis and Toni Minichiello.(n)

programme.title: Inside the Factory
programme.sub-title: Inside the Factory: How Our Favourite Foods Are Made: Milk.
programme.desc: Gregg Wallace visits a milk-processing plant to see how they get the liquid from cow to carton in less than 24 hours, and Cherry Healey finds out how milk is used to make cheese and ice-cream on an epic scale. She also reveals why many people in the world actually can't drink the white stuff, and historian Ruth Goodman explores the tough life of a dairy maid.(n)

programme.title: The Fifteen Billion Pound Railway
programme.sub-title: The Fifteen Billion Pound Railway: The Final Countdown..
programme.desc: Part one of two. Return of the documentary about the construction of the Crossrail train line linking east and west London, following those racing to complete the work in time for the first trains to run in May. Engineer Linda Miller and her team must battle ancient fault lines that threaten the Farringdon station site with flooding, while construction workers build innovative floating rail tracks directly under the Barbican Concert Hall. Julian Barratt narrates.(n)

programme.title: Dragons' Den
programme.desc: Even Davis presents the business ideas contest, with Peter Jones, Deborah Meaden, Touker Suleyman, Sarah Willingham and Nick Jenkins casting an eye over more money-spinning ideas. Projects up for investment this week include an unusual coffee lid, a range of coconut-based products, and a safety device for hairstyling gadgets.(n)

programme.title: The Life Swap Adventure
programme.desc: Daredevil Tennessee cowboy Blane and fun-loving Welsh office worker William trade places in an effort to find a new perspective on their lives. Both men are in their 20s and find themselves in a very similar predicament - they are about to take over the reins of their lucrative family businesses and must decide whether they want to commit to a path worked out for them, or follow their hearts and forge their own careers.(n)

programme.title: George Best: All By Himself
programme.desc: Documentary telling the story of the reserved young football prodigy from Belfast who became a global superstar, but whose career was blighted by his battle with the pressures of fame. The film reveals how the player dubbed El Beatle helped Manchester United to win two league titles and the European Cup, but his extravagant lifestyle led to various problems, most notably alcoholism.(n)

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Dara O Briain and regular panellist Hugh Dennis look back on another eventful week in news and politics, with the help of fellow comedians Angela Barnes, Ed Byrne, Milton Jones, Nish Kumar and Romesh Ranganathan. Stand-up and improvisation are the name of the game as the contestants try to get one up on each other.(n)

programme.title: White Gold
programme.desc: Vincent's life takes a turn for the worse as he finds himself kicked out of his family home and in debt to the Inland Revenue to the tune of £50,000. Meanwhile, Lavender, having his own career crisis, is drawn back to the world of rock and roll, and invites Sam along to a gig.(n)

programme.title: Burke & Hare
programme.desc: Two Irishmen in 19th-century Edinburgh have to dispose of a dead lodger, and learn a doctor pays well for cadavers to use in his anatomy lectures. Seeing a chance to get rich, they soon progress from grave robbing to murder in a bid to keep their benefactor in fresh corpses. Comedy horror, starring Simon Pegg, Andy Serkis, Tom Wilkinson and Jessica Hynes.(n)

programme.title: Britain and the Sea
programme.desc: David Dimbleby investigates the importance of the sea to trade and to the individual livelihoods of coastal communities. He sails along the west coast of Scotland, starting at Craobh Haven and along the Crinan Canal, a waterway designed by East Lothian engineer John Rennie to take 120 miles off the journey from the west coast to Glasgow and safely avoid the turbulent waters around the Mull of Kintyre. He also climbs aboard the last working sea-going Clyde puffer, where he earns his keep shovelling coal in the steam room, and reflects on the role played by the river in both trade and shipbuilding.(n)

programme.title: Nature's Great Events
programme.desc: The migration of elephant herds across Botswana's Kalahari Desert during the annual flooding of the Okavango Delta, which turns 4,000 square miles of arid plains into a maze of wetlands, setting the scene for great clashes between animals in search of water. Resourceful elephants make the most of stagnant pools and waterholes guarded by lions, while hippos converge on prime territories to do battle. David Attenborough narrates.(n)

programme.title: Kon-Tiki
programme.desc: Premiere. An anthropologist forms a theory that Polynesia was settled by explorers from South America prior to Christopher Columbus' expedition. To prove his claims are possible, he and a small crew sail a wooden raft across the Pacific using no modern technology. Fact-based drama, starring Pal Sverre Hagen and Anders Baasmo Christiansen. In Norwegian, English, French and Swedish.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Pops: 1984
programme.desc: John Peel and David Jensen present the February 2 show, featuring Musical Youth, Queen, Matthew Wilder, Fiction Factory, Thomas Dolby, Thompson Twins, Juan Martin and Duran Duran.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Pops: 1984
programme.desc: Simon Bates and Peter Powell introduce performances by Slade, Thompson Twins, Style Council, Shannon, Queen and Nena.(n)

programme.title: The Old Grey Whistle Test
programme.desc: Performances from the 1970s music series, including appearances by Elton John, David Bowie, Curtis Mayfield, Roxy Music, Steppenwolf, Iggy Pop, Blondie, Patti Smith and the Jam.(n)

programme.title: The Who at the Electric Proms
programme.desc: The legendary group perform classic tracks including My Generation, Baba O'Riley and Pinball Wizard for the BBC's 2006 Electric Proms finale at the famous Roundhouse in north London. Including material from the band's mini-opera Wire and Glass.(n)

programme.title: Totally British: 70s Rock 'n' Roll
programme.desc: Part one of two. A collection of archive performances by artists including David Bowie, Free, Status Quo, Mott the Hoople, the Faces, Humble Pie, Babe Ruth and Thin Lizzy from TV shows such as The Old Grey Whistle Test and Top of the Pops.(n)

programme.title: Handmade in Japan
programme.desc: Documentary about traditional Japanese craftspeople, beginning by following Shiro Kunimitsu and his family as they craft a katana of exceptional sharpness and durability, continuing a tradition begun by their ancestors nearly three centuries ago.(n)

programme.title: Handmade in Japan
programme.desc: The production of the traditional garment, following the painstaking process of the silk being bound, hand-dyed, woven and finally turned into a kimono by a seamstress.(n)

programme.title: Handmade in Japan
programme.desc: A look at the work of the Hamadas, one of Japan's most famous families of potters, following Tomoo as he creates and fires pots in a wood-fuelled kiln.(n)

programme.title: Schonbrunn Summer Night Concert from Vienna
programme.desc: Katie Derham introduces the open-air concert from the gardens of the Schoenbrunn Palace in Vienna, given by the Vienna Philharmonic Orchestra, conducted by Christoph Eschenbach.(n)

programme.title: Storyville
programme.desc: Documentary exploring humans' relationship with pigs, looking at such things as the xenotransplantation of organs and wild hogs being hunted with machine guns from a helicopter.(n)

programme.title: Climate Change by Numbers
programme.desc: The debate surrounding climate change, as the public appears to be less sure it understands exactly what is going on, despite there being more information on the issue than ever. Mathematicians Dr Hannah Fry, Professor Norman Fenton and Professor David Spiegelhalter discuss the three key numbers that clarify the important questions around climate change, as scientists use them to help explain what is happening to the Earth.(n)

programme.title: Gillette World Sport
programme.desc: On this week's show, skateboard legends Tony Hawk and Andy Macdonald discuss the evolution of skate, and Olympic swimming star Mack Horton demonstrates his freestyling finesse.(n)

programme.title: World Rally Championship
programme.desc: Highlights from day one of Rally Poland, round eight of the year. The day's action featured two loops of four tests to the north-east and a repeat of the super special stage duels.(n)

programme.title: Live World Rally Championship
programme.desc: Rally Poland, round eight of the season, continues with SS11 as drivers tackle a 15.55km route through Baranowo. Andreas Mikkelsen was the victor here last year.(n)

programme.title: World Rally Championship
programme.desc: This documentary offers a fascinating behind the scenes look at the return of Toyota to the FIA World Rally Championship after an 18-year absence.(n)

programme.title: BT Sport Films
programme.sub-title: BT Sport Films: O Arise, All You Sons.
programme.desc: The tale of how cricket united one of the most dangerous, disparate and poverty stricken countries on Earth and gave the people of Papua New Guinea purpose and identity.(n)

programme.title: Live AFL
programme.sub-title: Live AFL: GWS Giants v Geelong.
programme.desc: GWS Giants and Geelong, two of 2017's highest scoring teams, clash in round 15 of the Australian Football League. The Cats have won five of the past six meetings between the sides.(n)

programme.title: Live Rowing: Henley Royal Regatta
programme.desc: Day four of the historic Henley Royal Regatta, one of the most famed sporting and social occasions in the world. James Cracknell and Katherine Grainger provide expert analysis.(n)

programme.title: Mobil 1: The Grid
programme.desc: This week's show goes behind-the-scenes at the Le Mans 24 Hours, previews Formula One's Austrian Grand Prix and looks at the iconic Colin's Crest at Rally Sweden.(n)

programme.title: Formula E: Street Racers
programme.desc: This week Street Racers stays in Berlin to meet the stars of tomorrow, learns about how German technology is raising the stakes and Lucas di Grassi reflects on living the dream.(n)

programme.title: World Rally Championship
programme.desc: Highlights from day two of Rally Poland, round eight of the year. Drivers headed north towards the border for four stages driven twice and a pass over the Mikolajki super special.(n)

programme.title: WTA Tennis
programme.desc: The biggest WTA stars glam up and step out for the WTA Pre-Wimbledon Party in London.(n)

programme.title: 30 for 30 Shorts

programme.desc: A Navy captain wearing a colourful costume underneath his uniform is shot and killed in a flower shop, and further investigation reveals he was leading a double life as a masked vigilante. Guest starring Perrey Reeves (Entourage).(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A Navy reservist is found dead in his home with marks around his neck, and Gibbs and the team discover he was working on a highly classified case for the department of defence. The circumstances surrounding the man's demise lead the investigators to suspect someone was secretly trying to drive him insane, bringing them into contact with Samantha Ryan, the director of a division specialising in psychological warfare. Guest starring Jamie Lee Curtis.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Chief petty officer Leland Wiley dies of a heart attack just as he is about to reveal information on elusive arms dealer Agah Bayar. The team discovers the cardiac arrest was caused by someone hacking into a computer monitoring Wiley's pacemaker and increasing his heart rate to 400bpm. Meanwhile, a probationary agent tries to impress Gibbs and win a place on his team. Crime drama, starring Mark Harmon, with Tamer Hassan and Matt L Jones.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Confidential files are leaked by an anonymous hacker, who threatens to release more unless the Navy agrees to renew a contract with a struggling shipbuilding firm. Meanwhile, Gibbs' colleagues begin to notice his attraction to his opposite number Samantha Ryan. Guest starring Jamie Lee Curtis.(n)

programme.title: The Profit

programme.title: The Profit

programme.title: The Profit

programme.title: The Profit

programme.title: The Profit

programme.title: The Profit

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 422. The Sharks are presented with a fishing bobber made from a real shotgun shell; a cupcakes-in-a-jar business; an idea for turning each step a person takes into usable electricity; and a belt with no holes. Also: an update on Billy Blanks Jr. and his Dance With Me fitness program, which Mark and Daymond invested in during Season 3(n)

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 522. An 11-year-old fashion designer from Memphis is excited to show Daymond John his line of handcrafted bow ties; and two men from Boston look for an investment in their "epic" obstacle-course business. Also: a hot beverage made from roasted cocoa beans and packed with antioxidants; a blend of nutritional supplements to help brain health; and an update on Marz Sprays, invested in by Lori during Season 4(n)

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 610. The Sharks celebrate 100 episodes with a look back at their favorite memories, plus they reveal why they participate on the show, as well as take part in a cake-cutting ceremony and a champagne toast. Also: a mother and son who are concerned with healthy bowels; a plywood alternative for storm protection; organic mini-popcorn created by siblings from Brooklyn; a dairy-free line of plant-based cheeses; and an update on the Living Christmas Company invested in by Mark Cuban during Season 5(n)

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 722. A former business analyst presents the Sharks with an idea for an adults-only sleepaway camp, with the promise of s'more fun; and a 15-year-old entrepreneur claims to have created better equipment for her favorite sport(n)

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 713. Entrepreneurs pitch their ideas for a heavy-equipment adventure company; and a protein-filled pancake mix. Also: A Secret Service agent from Woodbridge, Va., has a solution for men who want to keep their ties looking sharp; and there's an update on Cousins Maine Lobster, which Barbara invested in during Season 4(n)

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 611. Three sisters make a pitch for their dating app; an entrepreneur claims to have a solution to a common problem for online shoppers; a former publisher shares her design for a shirt that makes people look skinny; and a pair of Wall Street brokers demonstrate a compact way to eat a bagel. Also: an update on Hamboards, which Robert invested in during Season 5(n)

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 501. Billionaire businessman and philanthropist John Paul DeJoria appears as a guest Shark; and Daymond John declares one pitch the worst of all time. Included: a line of safe, natural cleaning products; a party cup with a hidden shot glass inside; an electric, lightweight bodyboard; and a tented root cover for newly planted trees. Also: an update on a product from Season 4 that helps to safely clean stuffed animals(n)
