In the rooms, Donna Taylor from Jasmine House in Leicestershire makes a hair-raising discovery, while mother-and-daughter team Lesley and Chloe Priestly take a dislike to one of their competitors at dinner.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Jasmine House in Lutterworth, Leicestershire managed by Donna Taylor who believes in a no frills approach. But it doesn't take long for Martin and Sara to realise all the added extras in the room don't add up. During the afternoon Leslie and Chloe show their fighting spirit during a kickboxing lesson and all the B&Bers square up to their host.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants travel to the luxury Halliwell House in Cheshire for the third day of the contest, where owners Martin Hulme and Sara Williams charge nearly £500 per night. Donna is astonished at the room rates, while David and Ewa are expecting nothing but perfection, but the self-service approach at breakfast confuses the guests, leaving Martin and Sara defiant in the face of their feedback.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final two days see the contestants staying the night at Soar Chapel Guest House in Wales, the family home of mum and daughter Lesley and Chloe Priestly. Expectations are high for this duo and one guest in particular is not disappointed. Things get going in the afternoon during a beatboxing contest, although old tensions resurface at dinner and the hosts are left to calm things down. A massive spread is laid on at breakfast, but when one guest takes issue with the cooked items, Lesley and Chloe worry what impact it will have come payment day.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners meet for the last time to find out what they've been paid and to settle some scores. David and Ewa Woodward want to challenge Martin's criticism over the way they run their business. Next, Donna Taylor wants to find out more about the issue that caused Martin and Sara to lose sleep. Needless to say, there is tension in the air and axes to grind, before the winner is revealed.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Laura Hamilton helps Farzana Kausar from Stockport to find a home in Torrevieja on Spain's Costa Blanca that will be accessible for her daughter Aisha's wheelchair.(n)

programme.title: Big House, Little House
programme.desc: Aidan Keane meets two couples seeking to breathe new life into their distinctive period properties. Iain and Frankie have a budget of £190,000 to renovate their Victorian villa in Edinburgh, while retirees John and Vanessa home have just £40,000 to apply a similar treatment to their dilapidated barn in Matlock, Derbyshire.(n)

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It
programme.desc: The duo meet Karyn and Duncan, who have been arguing for more than two years about their three-bed semi in Stirlingshire. She wants to move on to somewhere bigger and better, while he loves the rural views afforded by their current home - not to mention the river at the bottom of the drive. Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer try to bring them together again by helping them decide, once and for all, whether they should sell up or stay put.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: The Autistic Gardener
programme.desc: Alan Gardner comes to the aid of two families in London that are seeking to transform their adjoining back gardens into one big playground for their children. Claire and Tim, and their neighbours Jess and Karl have four boys between them, and while they all agree the space should provide the kids with a safe space to play, Claire and Tim seek a romantic plot, while Jess and Karl would like to bring a touch of the Mediterranean to their home. Plus, Alan heads to Austin, Texas, where he finds an unusual source of inspiration for this project - in the form of a jumbo jet engine. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Life of Pi
programme.desc: A writer interviews a man about the extraordinary events of his life. He describes his childhood in India, living in the zoo run by his father, and how the family and their animals were forced to relocate to Canada when he was a teenager. However, during the sea voyage, the ship sank and he was left adrift in a small boat with a ferocious tiger. Ang Lee's adventure based on Yann Martel's novel, starring Suraj Sharma and Irrfan Khan.(n)

programme.title: Last Vegas
programme.desc: A sixtysomething confirmed bachelor finally decides to settle down with his much younger girlfriend. He and three friends decide to mark the occasion by reliving their wild youth with a trip to Las Vegas - but they find that both the city and each other have changed since their glory days. Comedy, starring Michael Douglas, Robert De Niro, Morgan Freeman and Kevin Kline.(n)

School drama series, starring Jo Joyner, Paul Nicholls and Sunetra Sarker.(n)

programme.desc: Robert contemplates leaving the police force to take up a job selling security systems, but the proposal receives a mixed reaction, leading to tense celebrations at his birthday party. Comedy, starring Ray Romano, Brad Garrett and Patricia Heaton.(n)

programme.desc: Ray is delighted to be awarded an honorary doctorate, but hurts Debra's feelings by thanking everyone except her in his acceptance speech. He claims it was an accident, though she takes the opportunity to remind him of past snubs that were obviously deliberate.(n)

programme.title: Dante's Peak

Disaster movie, starring Pierce Brosnan, Linda Hamilton, Elizabeth Hoffman and Charles Hallahan.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud follows software executive Andy and garden designer Nicki, who are planning to build a `floating' house on the Thames, which would be the first of its kind in the UK. Their architect has come up with an ambitious, experimental design that would see the whole property magically rise up with the flood waters. However, no one knows whether it will work, and the project soon becomes bogged down in the logistical challenges of bringing to fruition such a complex structure on a small island that is only accessible by a narrow footbridge.(n)

programme.title: Dunkirk: The New Evidence
programme.desc: Documentary examining the famous Second World War evacuation of Allied soldiers - codenamed Operation Dynamo - from the beaches of Dunkirk, France, between May 26 and June 4, 1940. Recently released Ministry of Defence files reveal that, far from being absent as many historians have believed, the RAF was suffering massive losses supporting the evacuation. Operating at high altitude and deep inside France, RAF planes were halting the bulk of Luftwaffe bombers before they could reach the beaches. The files also reveal that the famous Spitfire took flight for the first time during the mission, and the agile fighter was a spectacular success.(n)

programme.title: The Handmaid's Tale
programme.desc: When a trade delegation from Mexico comes to Gilead, Offred discovers several shocking secrets. Serena Joy reflects on her marriage and the role she played in Gilead's inception. Drama based on the novel by Margaret Atwood and set in the dystopia of Gilead, a totalitarian society in what was formerly part of the United States. Starring Elisabeth Moss and Yvonne Strahovski.(n)

programme.title: Trance

Danny Boyle's non-linear crime thriller, starring James McAvoy and Rosario Dawson.(n)

programme.desc: A fantasy fire-breathing dragon comes to life, and it will not let Ryder and the pups into the lookout.(n)

programme.desc: Grandpa Pig visits Peppa and George and brings seeds for them to plant, while Daddy Pig acts as a scarecrow.(n)

programme.sub-title: Dogs Make You Laugh Out Loud 2.
programme.desc: Comedians Matt Richardson and Katy Brand present another selection of the most popular videos featuring dogs, while pet behaviourist Professor Peter Neville provides the scientific background. Featuring Bizkit's sleepwalking antics, which have notched up almost 33 million hits on YouTube, and footage of Norman the French sheepdog riding scooters, skateboards and bikes.(n)

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Gordon Morris leads a raid on the house of a suspected drug user, but the door won't budge. Meanwhile, Rich Woodward is in pursuit of a souped-up hot hatch, a late-night reveller kicks off in Nantwich town centre, and police dog Bonnie is used in the hunt for two runaways.(n)

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Officers come under attack from a gang of violent armed robbers, while Jon and Chris have their work cut out catching up with a dangerous speeder. Plus, the `Big Blue Van' respond to reports of bottles raining down on the streets and a routine stop on a delivery driver leads one of the interceptors to discover more than he bargained for.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Benefits Handout
programme.desc: Cameras continue to observe three families who were given £26,000 in return for coming off benefits. In Hull, Tony and son Michael start buying stock for their secondhand business, including two large slot machines. In Liverpool, Scott and Leanne go through their business plan, and elsewhere in the city, single mum Rachel talks to her friend Mary about how to look for a job when you have never had one.(n)

programme.title: The Nightmare Neighbour Next Door
programme.desc: An Egyptian family who moved to a cul-de-sac in Hampshire - only to suffer racial abuse from their neighbour after complaining about his noisy TV. The documentary also features the story of a man who had not long moved into his Merseyside bungalow when his neighbour started banging on his wall and complaining about his loud music - which came as a surprise as he never played music. Plus, a woman who saw red after a battle to keep her Belsize Park home painted pink.(n)

programme.title: The Nightmare Neighbour Next Door
programme.desc: Documentary following the plight of Warren and Sheree Smith and the problems they face with next door neighbour Harry Street. Single dad Steve Foster, and Rachel Ayre are among the residents who also reveal their issues with locals.(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.desc: Stewart and Vic become party to a fractured family's school fee woes in Staffordshire and Del and Dael need to reclaim £3,500 after a rental van was returned badly damaged. Stewart and Elmor are in Warwickshire, where the members of a household blame their predicament on a scheming landlord whose subsequent arrival sparks a fierce reaction, while Iain helps Stewart remove a young mother from her Lancashire home.(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.desc: Sheriff Paul Bohill tackles the case of a small debt owed by ex-footballer Neil `Razor' Ruddock to a kennel owner, before being forced to evict a school dinner lady in south London. Meanwhile, in the north of England enforcement agent Stewart MacCracken heads out with trainee Iain Taylor to confront a Yorkshire builder they need to get payment from at his home, while a reptile shop owner hit by online competitors urgently needs to pay a debt for the feed company he relies on to keep his animals alive.(n)

programme.title: 5 News Weekend
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world.(n)

programme.title: Funniest Dogs Behaving Badly
programme.desc: Iain Lee narrates this compilation of comic canine clips, featuring disobedient hounds, dogs who are just plain dumb, and all-singing, all-dancing pooches - with comments from comedians Matt Richardson, Des Clarke, Marek Larwood and Ellie Taylor.(n)

programme.title: Blind Date
programme.desc: Paul O'Grady seeks a would-be sweetheart for Arnold, who emigrated from Africa to Manchester, and served with the British Army in Afghanistan for nearly five years. Arnold's idea of a perfect date would involve a spin on the London Eye, and Paul gives three ladies a chance to woo the gentlemanly soldier. Meanwhile, finance director Gemma - also from Manchester - seeks an adventurous Prince Charming to settle down and start a family with. Plus, the host catches up with last week's couples, to find out whether that initial spark of attraction could develop into something more.(n)

programme.title: Greatest Celebrity Wind-Ups Ever
programme.desc: Joe Pasquale revisits some of the most hilarious celebrity pranks committed to film, with first-hand accounts from the people responsible for staging the tricks, and the unfortunate stars on the receiving end. Among the shenanigans highlighted are Ant and Dec giving James Corden his `worst day ever', Noel Edmonds springing a trap for an unsuspecting Lionel Blair, and magician prankster Ben Hanlin tricking boy band Blue into thinking they had killed one of their bandmates. Plus, Dom Joly relives the best of Trigger Happy TV, and Balls of Steel duo Olivia Lee and Mark Dolan recall the time they provoked the ire of Hollywood A-lister Tom Cruise.(n)

programme.title: Big Brother
programme.desc: Daily round-up of highlights, revealing how the housemates are getting on under the all-seeing eye of Big Brother, featuring the latest tasks, games, arguments, laughs, diary room visits and bedroom chit-chat. Narrated by Marcus Bentley.(n)

programme.title: 20 Moments
programme.desc: A journey through the instances that rocked the genre and the fall-out that followed. Included is the occasion Will Young triumphed over Simon Cowell's favourite Gareth Gates on Pop Idol and the discovery of Cheryl Fernandez-Versini via Pop Stars: The Rivals. Plus, the memorable time Susan Boyle stepped out to sing I Dreamed a Dream on Britain's Got Talent and the tragic tale of Lena Zavaroni, the former child star winner of Opportunity Knocks. Contributors include Louis Walsh, Pete Waterman and Nina Myskow.(n)

programme.title: Lip Sync Battle UK
programme.sub-title: Lip Sync Battle UK: Rufus Hound v Jorgie Porter.
programme.desc: The musical game show sees comedian Rufus Hound and actress Jorgie Porter go head to head lip-synching to a hit song, complete with dance moves, facial expressions and costumes. Presented by former Spice Girl Melanie Brown and her co-host, rapper Professor Green.(n)

programme.title: Access
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip.(n)

programme.title: SuperCasino
programme.desc: Viewers get the chance to take part in live interactive gaming, with an entertaining mix of roulette-wheel spins and lively chat from the presenting team. Featuring a variety of prizes and promotions.(n)

programme.title: Vampire Academy
programme.desc: Premiere. Vampire princess Lissa and her half-human protector Rose are forced to attend a secret school for their race. As Lucy strives to reclaim her birthright, Rose hones her fighting skills to guard her friend against an impending conflict with a deadly rival breed of the undead. Fantasy based on Richelle Mead's novel, starring Zoey Deutch, Lucy Fry, Gabriel Byrne and Olga Kurylenko.(n)

programme.title: Great Artists
programme.desc: Tim Marlow profiles scientist, engineer, inventor and painter Leonardo da Vinci, whose extraordinary artistic genius gave rise to masterpieces including the Mona Lisa, the Annunciation and the Last Supper. Breaking new ground in portraiture and historical imagery, this giant of the Italian Renaissance used his wide-ranging skills to make a unique contribution to the development of European art.(n)

programme.title: Wildlife SOS
programme.desc: The work of dedicated volunteers treating sick, injured and orphaned animals at a wildlife sanctuary.(n)

programme.title: Angels of Jarm
programme.desc: Ellie sets out to prove Aaron wrong when he thinks he is no good at anything, unlike his best friend Virgil.(n)

programme.title: Roary the Racing Car
programme.desc: Rusty the caravan needs his friends to cheer him up.(n)

programme.title: Pip Ahoy
programme.desc: Pip is intrigued by a picture of a distinguished crab named Old Pincher, and tries to track down the mysterious storyteller with Alba - and a little help from Hopper and Pasty.(n)

programme.title: Milkshake! Monkey
programme.desc: The monkey finds there is a lot to do when he helps Danny the stationmaster get the steam train ready for the day.(n)

programme.title: Milkshake! Bop Box
programme.desc: Jen Pringle and Derek Moran welcome viewers on board Bop Box Airlines for some perfect pop-inspired in-flight entertainment.(n)

programme.title: Mr Men
programme.desc: The Dillydale friends go camping.(n)

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Dr Hamster struggles to cope on a busy day when everyone seems to require treatment.(n)

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa shows Kylie Kangaroo how to jump in muddy puddles, and the two find out who can spring higher.(n)

programme.title: Wissper
programme.desc: Hattie the hippo seeks the little girl's help as the leaves she would like are too high for her to reach. Wissper asks treeclimbing Panda Dan to help, but the solution comes from a different and unlikely source.(n)

programme.title: Paw Patrol
programme.sub-title: Pups Save the Three Little Pigs.
programme.desc: The Patrol helps three little pigs to build new houses. Animated action adventure following a squad of six heroic puppies and their tech-savvy 10-year-old leader.(n)

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: When Bob and his team build a ski lift on Observatory Hill, Scoop takes to the slopes.(n)

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Station Officer Steele joins Trevor and the gang for a picnic at Crabscuttle cove, but when their satnav goes wrong and leads them into wet sand, Elvis must try to save the day.(n)

programme.title: Olly the Little White Van
programme.desc: Olly helps to clean up after Miss Florette's birthday party, and realises how many different ways rubbish can be re-used.(n)

programme.title: Olly the Little White Van
programme.desc: Jethro takes Olly and Royston bird watching, but they have problems blending into the woods.(n)

programme.title: Paw Patrol
programme.desc: Animated adventure following a pack of six puppies led by 10-year-old Ryder. Cap'n Turbot's boat runs aground and the gang must save it before it sinks.(n)

programme.title: Blaze and the Monster Machines
programme.desc: Zeg loses his ticket to ride on a rollercoaster, and needs Blaze's help to find it.(n)

programme.title: Noddy: Toyland Detective
programme.sub-title: Noddy and the Case of the Rules of the Game.
programme.desc: Pat-Pat and the pirates have fallen out over who has won a board game because they have lost the rules, so Noddy needs to find them so that everyone can be friends again.(n)

programme.title: Wissper
programme.desc: Herbert the shire horse visits the meerkat colony to give everyone a ride, but ends up getting his head stuck fast in a tunnel entrance.(n)

programme.title: Ben and Holly's Little Kingdom
programme.desc: Nanny Plum takes the children for a lesson in the woods and uses magic to transform herself into a frog.(n)

programme.title: Shimmer and Shine
programme.desc: Zac struggles to get the hang of performing magic tricks, so Leah summons Shimmer and Shine to help him.(n)

programme.title: Little Princess
programme.desc: The discovery of a slimy worm upsets the young princess.(n)

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Mummy and Danny Dog are excited as Captain Daddy Dog returns from the sea.(n)

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: The children take a trip to a Dinosaur Park to celebrate Freddy Fox's birthday.(n)

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Daddy Pig reads Peppa and George a bedtime story, but it is not long before the pair are awake again.(n)

programme.title: Ben and Holly's Little Kingdom
programme.desc: The friends fix a broken toy robot, only for it to start cleaning out the castle.(n)

programme.title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles
programme.desc: Shredder is mutated to become more powerful than ever and challenges Splinter to face him in a final battle.(n)

programme.title: The Gadget Show
programme.desc: Craig Charles appraises the best gadgets for this summer's music festivals, with highlights including a new type of tepee that accommodates nine people and takes just three minutes to erect, a camping stove that generates electricity while cooking dinner, a camera that combines the retro style of instant prints with modern photo editing, and a Mini Countryman car with a brand new type of roof-mounted tent. Plus, Georgie Barrat meets sailor Ben Ainslie in Bermuda, where he is planning to triumph in the America's Cup boat race having created one of the most technologically advanced boats ever. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Jim leads a raid on a suspected drug dealer, Dan and Gordy respond to reports of an attack in an alleyway, and Jon goes on the hunt for a serial drug driver. Elsewhere, the interceptors combine forces when they fear that a gun-toting brawler may be on the loose.(n)

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Tim and Tom team up with Merseyside police to carry out a raid on a house in Liverpool, Jim wrestles with an aggressive driver, and officers armed with Tasers respond to an alleged assault with a meat cleaver. Plus, Dicko is called upon when a young man is stabbed in a street brawl.(n)

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Dog handler Bob hunts down a suspected knifeman, while interceptors Jon and Chris are on the trail of some suspected armed robbers. Meanwhile, Sergeant John wrestles with a drunken reveller, and a tattoo provides a clue that leads Jim to a major drugs bust.(n)

programme.title: Made of Honor
programme.desc: A single man realises he is in love with his best friend, but has never done anything about it out of a fear of commitment. Everything changes when she returns from a business trip to Scotland with a new fiance in tow, leaving him determined to make sure the wedding does not go ahead. Romantic comedy, starring Patrick Dempsey, Michelle Monaghan and Kevin McKidd. Edited for daytime broadcast.(n)

programme.title: 13 Going on 30
programme.desc: A 13-year-old girl wishes she could skip the misery of growing up and become an adult overnight. However, the next day she wakes up to find 17 years have mysteriously passed and she is now a successful magazine editor approaching her 30th birthday - and her new life is just as hard to cope with as her old one. Romantic comedy, starring Jennifer Garner, Mark Ruffalo, Christa B Allen and Andy Serkis. Edited for language.(n)

programme.title: 5 News Update
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines, sports news and weather.(n)

programme.title: 13 Going on 30
programme.desc: A 13-year-old girl wishes she could skip the misery of growing up and become an adult overnight. However, the next day she wakes up to find 17 years have mysteriously passed and she is now a successful magazine editor approaching her 30th birthday - and her new life is just as hard to cope with as her old one. Romantic comedy, starring Jennifer Garner, Mark Ruffalo, Christa B Allen and Andy Serkis. Edited for language.(n)

programme.title: The Flintstones
programme.desc: Blue-collar caveman Fred Flintstone is promoted to an executive position at work and unwittingly becomes embroiled in an embezzlement scheme - thanks in no small part to his seductive new assistant. Live-action version of the cartoon comedy, starring John Goodman, Rick Moranis, Rosie O'Donnell, Halle Berry and Elizabeth Taylor.(n)

programme.title: That's So
programme.desc: A look at the year that saw the Brighton hotel bombing, Torvill and Dean win gold at the Winter Olympics with their famous Bolero routine, the death of comedian Eric Morecambe and Virgin Atlantic Airways make its inaugural flight. Featuring hits by Black Lace, Cyndi Lauper, Sade and Frankie Goes to Hollywood.(n)

programme.title: 5 News Weekend
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world.(n)

programme.title: Big Brother
programme.desc: Daily round-up of highlights, revealing how the housemates are getting on under the all-seeing eye of Big Brother, featuring the latest tasks, games, arguments, laughs, diary room visits and bedroom chit-chat. Narrated by Marcus Bentley.(n)

programme.title: OMG
programme.desc: The story of a woman who has made several extreme changes to her body, including amputating a finger. Plus, a man who has had 85 body piercings and is now preparing to experiment with scarification, a competitive body builder with tattoos over 90 per cent of his body, and a woman who has plastic surgery and body art to transform herself.(n)

programme.title: The Vow
programme.desc: A newlywed couple are involved in a car accident, and the wife wakes up with no memory of her husband. While he tries to get her to fall in love with him all over again, she is reunited with her estranged parents, who never approved of the marriage and see her condition as a chance to make a fresh start. Romantic drama, with Rachel McAdams, Channing Tatum, Jessica Lange and Sam Neill.(n)

programme.title: Shattered Glass
programme.desc: Before Jayson Blair made headlines for his plagiarized New York Times reporting, Stephen Glass defamed the weekly current events magazine The New Republic with a series of eye-catching, entertaining, and completely fabricated stories. Now Glass' trail of lies gets the big-screen treatment in writer/director Billy Ray's Shattered Glass, featuring Hayden Christensen in the title role. The film chronicles Glass' time at the magazine in the late '90s, when his colorful coverage of a hedonistic Young Republican convention, superstar web hackers, and the circus surrounding the Bill Clinton/Monica Lewinsky scandal made him the toast of the publishing world, garnering attention from such national publications as George and Rolling Stone. Barely out of college, the eager Glass ingratiates himself with the office staff, including his mentor, managing editor Michael Kelly (Hank Azaria). But when Kelly is unceremoniously fired and replaced with editor Chuck Lane (Peter Sarsgaard), Glass' pieces come under a greater degree of scrutiny, until one in particular threatens to expose his tall tales to the rest of the world. Based in part on a Vanity Fair article by journalist Buzz Bissinger, Shattered Glass premiered at the Telluride and Toronto film festivals before its limited fall theatrical release(n)

programme.title: Daredevil
programme.desc: Blinded by toxic waste as a child, Matt Murdock develops superhuman awareness and balance which enable him to tackle New York's worst villains(n)

programme.title: Halloween: Resurrection
programme.desc: A group of teens win a contest to spend a night in Michael Myers' childhood home which will be broadcast live on the internet. They believe they are in for a little fun and some free publicity but things go terribly wrong and turn into a game of life and death(n)

programme.title: Robin Hood: Prince of Thieves
programme.desc: On his return from the Crusades, the rebel learns that his father has been murdered by the tyrannical Sheriff of Nottingham and embarks on a campaign of guerrilla warfare to protect the King's throne. The outlaw counts upon the support of his band of followers, including his Moorish companion, a drunken priest and the beautiful Maid Marian(n)

programme.title: Wyatt Earp
programme.desc: Epic biopic of western lawman Wyatt Earp from an early age to the battle with his brothers and Doc Halliday against the dreaded Clanton and McLaury gangs. After the death of his wife from typhoid, the young Earp descends into drinking and petty crime until his father sobers him up and sets him on the road to becoming a respected sheriff in Dodge City and Tombstone where he faces his greatest battle(n)

programme.title: Role Models
programme.desc: A pair of fast-living buddies are given community service which entails looking after two troubled youngsters, one a geeky outcast and the other a potty-mouthed tough(n)

programme.title: Sisters
programme.desc: SNL alumni Tina Fey and Amy Poehler co-star in this Universal Studios comedy about two daffy adult sisters, one an irresponsible single mom and the other a kindhearted nurse, who decide to throw one last wild party at their childhood home before it's sold by their parents. However, their bash ends up going disastrously awry. Written by Paula Pell and directed by Jason Moore(n)

programme.title: Man on the Moon
programme.desc: Andy Kaufman's public image changed like the weather: he was loved and hated in equal measure and his innovative style of humour was often misunderstood. He acknowledged that he didn't know what was funny or not, and his material could generate laughs and tears, silence and brawls(n)

programme.title: The Box
programme.desc: Norma and Arthur Lewis are a charming, loving couple; he a research scientist at Nasa's Langley facility and she is a teacher. Early one morning a mysterious box is left at their door. Hours later, a gentleman with a badly burned face arrives to tell them that if they push the red button on top of the box they will receive one million dollars, but someone they don't know will die. They have 24 hours to choose. He will then return to collect the box(n)

programme.title: Die Hard
programme.desc: New York cop John McClane fights terrorists in an Los Angeles skyscraper in a bid to rescue his estranged wife, who happens to be one of the hostages(n)

programme.title: Die Hard With a Vengeance
programme.desc: Cop John McClane teams with a shop owner to outwit a terrorist who is making John perform a series of dangerous tasks all around Manhattan(n)

programme.title: Live Free or Die Hard
programme.desc: When internet terrorists try to bring the US to its knees by shutting down every major computer system, NYPD detective John McClane makes a stand. All-out action sequel(n)

programme.title: Gods of Egypt
programme.desc: A common thief named Bek enlists the help of powerful god Horus in a quest to defeat Set, an evil god who has plunged a once peaceful Egypt into the darkness. The survival of mankind and the fate of his lover lies in the hands of the unlikely mortal hero(n)

programme.title: Chernobyl Diaries
programme.desc: An extreme vacation turns terrifying when a group of friends visit the Chernobyl disaster site, and learn that some nightmares never die. Conceived and produced by Paranormal Activity's Oren Peli, Chernobyl Diaries gets underway as six thrill-seeking tourists hire a fearless tour guide, and travel to the abandoned Ukrainian city of Pripyat. Back when the Chernobyl nuclear reactor was up and running, Pripyat was the place the workers called home. But 25 years after one of the worst power-plant accidents in history, the city serves as an eerily silent testament to the dangers of nuclear power. Later, after getting unexpectedly stranded in Pripyat, the tourists and their guide realize they are being hunted. Now the harder they try to flee, the faster their numbers dwindle until only a few are left standing. Only then will the unspeakable terror that stalks these deserted streets finally emerge from the shadows to launch one last relentless, terrifying attack(n)

programme.title: The French Connection
programme.desc: William Friedkin's multi-Oscar-winning gritty urban crime drama tells the real-life story of two New York narcotics cops' attempts to bring down a French drugs kingpin. Gene Hackman and Roy Scheider play detectives James 'Popeye' Doyle and Buddy Russo who, while investigating relatively minor-league drugs pushers, learn that a massive shipment of very pure heroin is about to arrive in the city. The heroin is being imported from Marseille by Alain Charnier, who is prepared to do anything, including murdering policemen, to get his narcotics out on the streets. But, although they know it's on its way, Doyle and Russo don't know how. Additionally, they make life more difficult for themselves by their warring with FBI agent Mulderig, who's also working the case. Hickman was the stunt driver pursued by Steve McQueen in Bullitt; and was also behind the wheel for the famous chase in this movie, which was shot in real traffic(n)

programme.title: Pride and Glory
programme.desc: A detective's probe into the murder of four cops points to corruption and his own brother and brother-in-law, both of whom are cops(n)

programme.title: Everest
programme.desc: In this nail-biting adventure docudrama set in 1996, several groups of climbers successfully scale Mount Everest, only to be faced with tragedy when a monster snowstorm surprises them as they attempt to make their descent(n)

programme.title: The Vanishing
programme.desc: When Jeff's girlfriend is abducted by a highly intelligent psychopath, his only hope of finding her is to put himself in the kidnapper's hands. Kiefer Sutherland and Sandra Bullock star(n)

programme.title: Into the Blue
programme.desc: While treasure hunting in the Bahamas, a group of young divers discover a wrecked cargo plane on the ocean's floor. Within lies millions of dollars of illegal drugs, and the divers' dream of finding sunken treasure has come true. But as they argue among themselves about what to do with their prize, the friends soon realize they're not the only ones interested in the narcotics. Dangerous criminals are also searching for the drugs, and now the treasure hunters themselves have become the hunted(n)

programme.title: Hardball
programme.desc: In this heartwarming sports drama, Keanu Reeves plays a ne'er-do-well gambler who learns something about the game of life when he agrees to coach an inner-city Chicago Little League team. Talented kid actors pitch in to provide solid relief. Diane Lane, John Hawkes, DeWayne Warren, Michael Jordan, Michael Perkins, Julian Griffith, Bryan C. Hearne, A. Delon Ellis Jr., Brian M. Reed(n)

programme.title: The Express
programme.desc: Finding Forrester star Rob Brown steps into the cleats of Heisman Trophy-winning gridiron giant Ernie Davis in director Gary Fleder's inspirational sports docudrama. As a young boy reared not far from the northern Pennsylvania state line, Davis dreamed of blasting through the end zone and scoring a triumphant touchdown while fans rose to their feet and cheered. When Davis later became a star running back for the Syracuse Orangemen, his dreams were finally on the way to becoming a reality. Under the wing of coach Ben Schwartzwalder (Dennis Quaid), it seemed as if there is nothing that could stop Davis from entering into the annals of sports history; even during an era in which the civil rights movement was just gaining momentum, this fledgling gridiron giant never once doubted his ability to rise to the top. When Davis was diagnosed with leukemia shortly after being drafted into the NFL, however, his will to survive soon eclipsed his dreams of success(n)

programme.title: Eddie the Eagle
programme.desc: Entertaining biopic of Michael "Eddie the Eagle" Edwards, whose participation in the 1988 Winter Olympics marked the first time a Brit had ever competed at ski jumping. Edwards trains for the sport with a former champ, and finds fame as a lovable loser who's just trying his best(n)

programme.title: Race
programme.desc: Exhilarating biopic of legendary black Olympian Jesse Owens (Stephan James) and his inspiring journey to overcome racism at home and abroad, culminating in his triumphant track and field performance at the 1936 Berlin Olympics under the tutelage of gruff Ohio State coach Larry Snyder (Jason Sudeikis) and the skeptical gaze of Adolf Hitler(n)

programme.title: Play It to the Bone
programme.desc: After covering baseball in Bull Durham, basketball in White Men Can't Jump. and golf in Tin Cup, writer, director, and obvious sports fan Ron Shelton takes on the world of boxing in this comedy. Vince Boudreau (Woody Harrelson) and Cesar Sota (Antonio Banderas) are close friends and aspiring boxers struggling on the lowest rungs of the fight game. When a major boxing promoter needs to fill out the card for a heavyweight bout in Las Vegas, Vince and Cesar both get the call to head out to Sin City. But the excitement sours when they realize that there's a small problem: the promoter's schedule has the two pals fighting each other. Play It to the Bone also features Lolita Davidovich, Lucy Liu, Tom Sizemore, and Robert Wagner(n)

programme.title: Max Payne
programme.desc: Mark Wahlberg stars as a cop with vengeance on his mind in John Moore's video game-based CGI noir. The eponymous NYPD detective's life is torn apart by the brutal murder of his wife and child. Determined to track down those responsible and wreak bloody revenge, he leaves no stone unturned. His dedication pays off when investigating a tip-off about some drugs dealers(n)

programme.title: RocknRolla
programme.desc: When a Russian mobster orchestrates a crooked land deal, millions of dollars are up for grabs, drawing in the entire London underworld into a feeding frenzy at a time when the old criminal regime is quickly losing turf to a wealthy foreign mob(n)

When Davis was diagnosed with leukemia shortly after being drafted into the NFL, however, his will to survive soon eclipsed his dreams of success(n)

In this wicked satire of network television standards and envelope-pushing programming, the people of South Park become obsessed with a television cop show in which people say the "S" word on the air. Soon, everyone in South Park is using the word regularly. This leads to an ancient curse being revived. This show made headlines because the "S" word was uttered 162 times without ever being bleeped. For those unwilling to keep track on their own, a counter is maintained on the screen that tallies the number of times the word is said. "It Hits the Fan" aired June 20, 2001, on Comedy Central. programme.title: American Justice
programme.sub-title: Body of Evidence: The Tom Capano Trial
programme.desc: Body of Evidence: The Tom Capano Trial. A&E investigates the deadly consequences of unrequited love in the one-hour American Justice: Body of Evidence -- The Tom Capano Trial. Wealthy and well-connected, Tom Capano was still subjected to the torments of the heart. When an affair with Anne Marie Fahey ended badly, he snapped. After murdering his ex-lover, Capano dumped her body in the water, a seemingly clever move. However, Capano never counted on the guilty conscience of his own brother to secure his undoing. The police kept the jealous boyfriend under surveillance until they had the sibling's confession as accomplice. Surprisingly, at trial, Capano himself admitted to removing the body. But, he held onto the claim that Fahey was killed by someone else. Capano was convicted and sentenced to death(n)

programme.desc: Tony Robinson visits Wittenham to piece together clues to one of the most extensive Iron Age landscapes discovered in Britain. programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Conclusion. After another night undercover on the streets, Mickey learns a second down-and-out has been murdered. The fears of the homeless community are underlined when Mickey's informant is badly beaten and suspicion falls on property developer Greg Simm (guest star Ralph Ineson), who has form for fraud and deception. It emerges the suspect had trouble with squatters holding up work on a development site, but evidence against him is hard to find. A bigger shock for Mickey is the news his new friend Nicola is in the frame for the murder.(n)

Jessica Raine, Jenny Agutter, Pam Ferris and Judy Parfitt star in the drama, set in the 1950s and based on the best-selling memoirs of Jennifer Worth.(n)

But he has information on the infamous massacre during which his troop was killed and wants old friend Aramis's help in uncovering the truth. The only problem is, his arrival has coincided with a visit from the king's sister and her husband, the Duke of Savoy - and the regiment have been assigned to protect the royal couple. Swashbuckling drama, with Vincent Regan and JJ Feild.(n)

programme.title: The Mrs Bradley Mysteries
programme.desc: The sleuth visits a seaside resort with chauffeur George to attend his daughter Cecily's wedding, but ends up investigating a grisly ritual murder. She suspects Satanists could be responsible, and the duo find themselves in a race against time to prevent Cecily becoming the next victim. Guest starring Isla Blair and Eddie Marsan.(n)

programme.title: Mercy Street

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Jack turns out to have a personal connection to the prime suspect in a teenage girl's murder, so he is taken off the case and replaced with another forensic scientist seconded to the Lyell Centre. But he finds himself instinctively drawn into the investigation, alienating himself from Nikki and the team as he tries to find an alibi for the supposed killer. Meanwhile, the victim's best friend is consumed with guilt, leading her to take drastic action. Crime drama, starring David Caves, Emilia Fox and Richard Lintern, with guest appearances by Haydn Gwynne and Ashley Walters.(n)

programme.title: Spooks
programme.desc: The American president makes an unscheduled trip to Britain, forcing MI5 to work with the CIA to ensure his safety throughout the visit. Tom and Christine are thrown together, and it soon appears there's more to their relationship than just work - but with each new threat turning the operation into a power struggle between the rival organisations, they need to keep their minds firmly on the job.(n)

programme.title: Dear John
programme.desc: Two weeks' military leave is all it takes for US Army Staff Sergeant John Tyree and college student Savannah Curtis to fall in love in this Lasse Hallström-directed adaptation of Nicholas Sparks' novel. Having depended on letters to keep their romance alive, their relationship falters when John unexpectedly decides to re-enlist in the army following the September 11 attacks in New York. Then it arrives - the Dear John letter informing him that Savannah is engaged to someone else. With no hope of being together, John rededicates himself to the military, surviving injury and only seeing Savannah when family events force him to return home. Months later, John receives another letter from Savannah with their sign-off of old, 'I'll see you soon, then'. Could there be hope for the couple yet? Edited for language and violence(n)

programme.title: World Rally Championship
programme.desc: Highlights from day two of Rally Poland, round eight of the year. Drivers headed north towards the border for four stages driven twice and a pass over the Mikolajki super special.(n)

programme.title: Live World Rally Championship
programme.desc: The power stage (Paprotki II) at Rally Poland, the eighth round of the FIA World Rally Championship. Sebastien Ogier won the power stage at this stage last year.(n)

programme.title: Live Euroformula Championship
programme.desc: Race two at round four of the Euroformula Open Championship at the Hungaroring in Mogyorod, Hungary. Harrison Scott is in control of the standings at the mid-point in the season.(n)

programme.title: Live International GT Open Championship
programme.desc: Race two at round four of the International GT Open Championship at the Hungaroring in Hungary. GB's Rob Bell and Shaun Balfe will be hoping to rediscover their best form.(n)

programme.title: Live Eurocup Formula Renault 2.0
programme.desc: Race three at round five of the Formula Renault Eurocup season at the Hungaroring in Hungary. With another five rounds left, Will Palmer is well-placed for a top-two finish.(n)

programme.title: Gillette World Sport
programme.desc: On this week's show, skateboard legends Tony Hawk and Andy Macdonald discuss the evolution of skate, and Olympic swimming star Mack Horton demonstrates his freestyling finesse.(n)

programme.title: Live Motorsport: DTM
programme.desc: Race two from the fourth round of the Deutsche Tourenwagen Masters at the Norisring. Drivers who have competed in this series include Mika Hakkinen and David Coulthard.(n)

programme.title: BT Sport Reload
programme.desc: The best bits from BT Sport over the last week, including Victoria Azarenka's return to tennis, Valentino Rossi's stunning ride at Assen and Kevin Lee's controversial UFC stoppage.(n)

programme.title: NBA
programme.desc: A look at the NBA stars who are available as free agents.(n)

programme.title: Live MLB
programme.desc: Major League Baseball action as American League East and Western conference leaders, the New York Yankees and the Houston Astros clash at Minute Maid Park.(n)

programme.title: Indy Lights Highlights
programme.desc: Highlights from the Grand Prix of Road America, rounds eight and nine of the Indy Lights season, the development series for the Verizon IndyCar Series.(n)

programme.title: Live Baseball Tonight
programme.desc: Your one-stop shop for MLB news. Expert analysts look at the best plays, highlights and biggest stories surrounding Major League Baseball.(n)

programme.title: Fencing
programme.desc: NCAA men's and women's championships in Indianapolis(n)

programme.title: Bowling
programme.desc: NCAA women's championship in Baton Rouge, La(n)

programme.title: Gymnastics
programme.desc: NCAA women's Super Six team finals in St. Louis(n)

programme.title: Women's Lacrosse
programme.desc: Boston College vs. Maryland in the NCAA Division I championship game in Foxborough, Mass(n)

programme.title: College Lacrosse
programme.desc: Ohio State vs. Maryland in the NCAA Division I championship game in Foxborough, Mass(n)

programme.title: Women's College World Series
programme.desc: Finals Game 2: Florida vs. Oklahoma. Florida vs. Oklahoma in Game 2 of the best-of-3 championship series in Oklahoma City(n)

programme.title: Track and Field
programme.desc: NCAA outdoor championships Day 3 at Hayward Field in Eugene, Ore. Included: men's track finals, plus high jump, triple jump and discus. Also: Day 1 of the women's heptathlon(n)

programme.title: High-School Lacrosse All-Star Game
programme.desc: Under Armour All-America Girls Game in Towson, Md. Top high-school seniors include Kyla Sears (attending Princeton); Kelsey Huff (USC); Emily Vengilio (Penn State); Andie Aldave (Notre Dame); Eddy Shoop (Florida); and Brooke Robbins (Maryland)(n)

programme.title: All Access: UNC Lacrosse
programme.desc: Episode 1. An inside look at North Carolina Tar Heels men's lacrosse, with game footage and player profiles(n)

programme.title: High-School Lacrosse All-Star Game
programme.desc: Under Armour All-America Boys Game in Towson, Md. Top high-school seniors include Aidan Olmstead (attending Loyola-Md.); Lucas Quinn (Syracuse); Chris Fake (Yale); Alex Trippi (UNC); Justin Shockey (Navy); Bryn Evans (Harvard); and Alex Rode (Virginia)(n)

programme.title: Track and Field
programme.desc: NCAA outdoor championships Day 4 at Hayward Field in Eugene, Ore. Included: women's track finals, plus high jump, triple jump, discus and Day 2 of the heptathlon(n)

programme.title: ESPN Programming
programme.desc: No additional information is available(n)

programme.title: College World Series
programme.desc: Finals Game 3: Florida vs. LSU. Florida vs. LSU in Game 3 (if necessary) of the championship series in Omaha(n)

programme.title: SEC Storied
programme.desc: The Book of Manning. The story of football's Manning family, focusing not only on the careers of Ole Miss star Archie and his NFL sons Peyton and Eli, but on the sudden death of Archie's father and its impact on his approach to fatherhood. Olivia and oldest son Cooper also appear, along with numerous friends and relatives. John Goodman narrates(n)

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: Rand University. Wide receiver Randy Moss is profiled by filmmaker Marquis Daisy in a journey back to the small town of Rand, W.Va., where troubles with the law nealry derailed Moss's career before he landed at Marshall and began making national headlines on the field(n)

programme.title: SEC Storied
programme.desc: Shaq & Dale. A look at the on-going relationship between LSU basketball icons Shaquille O'Neal and Dale Brown, who spent 1989-92 together in Baton Rouge after first meeting in Germany when Shaq was 13. Narrated by Louisiana native Tim McGraw(n)

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: Brian and The Boz. Chronicling Oklahoma Sooners star Brian Bosworth's days as "The Boz" under football coach Barry Switzer. Both men reflect on their father-son relationship in three memorable seasons (1984-86) in Norman, while also discussing how their lives have changed. Directed by Thaddeus D. Matula(n)

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: Sole Man. The rise of sports-marketing pioneer Sonny Vaccaro, who was instrumental in launching Nike's "Air Jordan" empire in the '80s and ushered in a new era of high-school hoops in the '90s. Interviews include Larry Brown, Brandon Jennings and Tracy McGrady. Directed by Jon Weinbach and Dan Marks(n)

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: I Hate Christian Laettner. An in-depth profile of basketball great Christian Laettner, the only player to start in four consecutive Final Fours. Rory Karpf directs a "gloves-off" examination of the man who has been seen by many as the "Blue Devil Himself."(n)

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: The Gospel According to Mac. Polarizing football coach Bill McCartney and his revitalization of the Colorado Buffaloes is chronicled, examining off-the-field lows as well as the high of a 1990 national title. McCartney was founder of the Promise Keepers, a Christian men's ministry. Directed by Jim Podhoretz(n)

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: Trojan War. Chronicling the rise and fall of Pete Carroll's reign as USC Trojans football coach, featuring three Heisman winners (later cut to two), a 34-game win streak and the pivotal 2006 Rose Bowl against Texas. Directed by Aaron Rahsaan Thomas(n)

programme.title: SEC Storied
programme.desc: The Walk Off. Chronicling LSU's dramatic 1996 College World Series win on a championship-game walk-off home run by diminutive infielder Warren Morris. Director Kenan K. Holley revisits one of college baseball's signature moments, 20 years later(n)

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: Fantastic Lies. A 10-year retrospective on the 2006 Duke lacrosse case in which three players were charged with rape, only to have all charges dropped a year later. Director Marina Zenovich explores the case's hot-button issues of sex, race, class and violence, and the turbulent period's lasting impact on the players and the program(n)

programme.title: SEC Storied
programme.desc: Before They Were Cowboys. Chronicling Jerry Jones and Jimmy Johnson in their days as Arkansas football teammates--part of an undefeated national champion squad in 1964--long before joining forces to win two Super Bowls with the Dallas Cowboys. Directed by Corey Frost(n)

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: Phi Slama Jama. The high-flying Houston Cougars basketball squad of the early '80s is chronicled, featuring Hakeem Olajuwon, Clyde Drexler and others from Guy Lewis's three straight Final Four teams(n)

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: One and Not Done. Chronicling the career of Hall of Fame basketball coach John Calipari, an accomplished yet controversial figure who has embraced the era of one-year stays by top college players. Marcus Camby, Derrick Rose and Anthony Davis are among those interviewed by director Jonathan Hock(n)

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: Catholics vs. Convicts. The epic 1988 Miami-Notre Dame football matchup is chronicled by director Patrick Creadon, a Notre Dame senior that year with unique insight into the game's controversial t-shirt. Players and coaches reflect on the emotionally-charged day in South Bend(n)

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: The U. Filmmaker Billy Corben tells the story of how the ''Bad Boys'' of football changed the the game they played, and how Miami's serene campus was transformed into ''The U''(n)

programme.desc: What Lies Beneath: The Mick Fanning Story. programme.title: Home Shopping
programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Yellowstone
programme.desc: Following the wildlife that inhabits the famous American national park, a lost world of deep forests, vast plains and bubbling geysers. The first episode focuses on a variety of species as they struggle to survive the rigours of a freezing six-month winter, revealing that although the herds of elk and bison are weakened by the cold, one animal gets stronger - the wolf.(n)

programme.title: Yellowstone
programme.desc: Summer returns, transforming the landscape of the famous national park from a frozen wilderness into the ideal environment for newborn animals. As temperatures rise, grizzly bears teach their young the secrets of survival - but even at this time of year, snow can sweep down from the mountains without warning.(n)

programme.title: Yellowstone
programme.desc: An early dusting of snow signals the end of autumn, a time when the forests are a blaze of red and gold and the animals prepare for the coming cold. The elk face hungry wolves as they move down from the mountains to feed in the valleys, while beavers rush to defend their habitat against the destructive ice, repairing dams and stocking underwater larders before the waters freeze over.(n)

programme.title: Polar Bear Town
programme.desc: Following the yearly migration of 1,000 polar bears through a small town in Canada, and the visitors that they bring. A new season begins in Manitoba.(n)

programme.title: Polar Bear Town
programme.desc: The bear guides face some difficult clients that could put people at risk.(n)

programme.title: Polar Bear Town
programme.desc: It is peak migration season and one hungry bear has its sights set on a passing polar bear cub.(n)

programme.desc: It is peak migration season and one hungry bear has its sights set on a passing polar bear cub.(n)

programme.title: Yellowstone
programme.desc: Following the wildlife that inhabits the famous American national park, a lost world of deep forests, vast plains and bubbling geysers. The first episode focuses on a variety of species as they struggle to survive the rigours of a freezing six-month winter, revealing that although the herds of elk and bison are weakened by the cold, one animal gets stronger - the wolf.(n)

programme.title: Yellowstone
programme.desc: Summer returns, transforming the landscape of the famous national park from a frozen wilderness into the ideal environment for newborn animals. As temperatures rise, grizzly bears teach their young the secrets of survival - but even at this time of year, snow can sweep down from the mountains without warning.(n)

programme.title: Yellowstone
programme.desc: An early dusting of snow signals the end of autumn, a time when the forests are a blaze of red and gold and the animals prepare for the coming cold. The elk face hungry wolves as they move down from the mountains to feed in the valleys, while beavers rush to defend their habitat against the destructive ice, repairing dams and stocking underwater larders before the waters freeze over.(n)

programme.title: Wild Ones
programme.desc: A look at venomous creatures, such as snakes, lizards and the octopus. Plus, the tiny toxin-wielding red-backed spider and the ferocious Sydney funnel web.(n)

programme.title: Home Shopping
programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: The Snow Wolf Family and Me
programme.desc: Part one of two. Wildlife cameraman Gordon Buchanan hopes to get closer to wild wolves than anyone before to discover the true nature of this feared predator and heads to the north of Canada in search of a pack that has never seen people and so has no fear of humans. He begins to gain the trust of an Arctic wolf family and as time passes becomes accepted by the pack, including a female and its three newborn pups, and has some close encounters that reveal a softer side to the animals.(n)

programme.title: The Snow Wolf Family and Me
programme.desc: Part two of two. Gordon Buchanan returns to Canada in the autumn to reunite with the Arctic wolves he has been following as they try to raise their pups and prepare for winter. The cameraman also walks with members of the pack as they hunt lemmings, musk oxen and hares and encounter a rival pack.(n)

programme.title: Natural World
programme.sub-title: Lobo: The Wolf That Changed America.
programme.desc: Revealing why Ernest Thompson Seton's book about his experiences in 1893, when he set out to kill a wolf that was slaughtering cattle, became the first to portray the animals in a positive light. His account inspired naturalists and changed the way many Americans saw their wilderness. David Attenborough narrates.(n)

programme.desc: The bears are set to be released from their holding facility as winter sets in.(n)

programme.desc: The Polar bear season in Manitoba, Canada is now over, and the bear females head south to give birth.(n)

programme.title: Nine Months
programme.desc: Hugh Grant plays child psychiatrist Samuel Faulkner who, ironically, can't stand children. So when long-standing girlfriend Rebecca Taylor announces she's pregnant, he's less than thrilled and eventually, fed-up with his moaning, she moves out to stay with friends Marty and Gail Dwyer. This being a Chris Columbus film, it all ends happily but not without a lot of fun along the way, particularly from Robin Williams as Russian obstetrician Dr Kosevich who is not just prone to malapropisms, but hasn't actually delivered a baby before(n)

programme.desc: Cole Trickle, a young stock-car driver, has talent but no idea how to hone his skills. Veteran racer Harry Hodge is hired to build a car for Trickle and to instill in the hot-shot driver a winning philosophy so he can compete at the top level(n)

programme.title: For Love of the Game
programme.desc: Based on the novel by Michael Shaara, For Love of the Game brought Kevin Costner back to the world of baseball after his successes with Bull Durham (1988) and Field of Dreams (1989). Billy Chapel (Kevin Costner) is a star pitcher with the Detroit Tigers, standing on the mound at Yankee Stadium and throwing what is shaping up to be a perfect game with the help of his best friend and catcher, Gus Osinski (John C. Reilly). However, Billy is having a hard time keeping his mind on the game; he's come to a crossroads in both his personal and professional lives, and he isn't sure what to do or where to go. He's learned that the Tigers are about to be sold, and the new owners intend to trade him at the end of the season, and that his girlfriend Jane (Kelly Preston) is planning to leave him. For Love of the Game represents a change of pace for director Sam Raimi, best-known for the Evil Dead trilogy and the acclaimed suspense drama A Simple Plan (1998) (although Raimi, a baseball fan born in Michigan, doubtless enjoyed making a film featuring the Detroit Tigers)(n)

programme.title: Navy SEALs
programme.desc: While rescuing a US air crew captured by terrorists, a team of Navy SEALs discover that the terrorists possess powerful missiles(n)

programme.title: Jay and Silent Bob Strike Back
programme.desc: The frequently recurring title characters, employed by writer and director Kevin Smith as supporting players in several of his films, are put to rest with this comedy that focuses on them exclusively. Jay (Jason Mews) and Silent Bob (Smith) are a pair of stoned New Jersey slackers who have long been used as the templates for a pair of popular comic book heroes, Bluntman and Chronic. When they learn that their alter egos are to be turned into a major motion picture without their consent or compensation, the pair sets off for Hollywood to sabotage the production. Along the way, they encounter an ape, a nun (Carrie Fisher), the cast of Scooby-Doo, a Charlie's Angels-style band of sexy women who use them as stool pigeons in a diamond heist, and an unhinged wildlife ranger (Will Ferrell). They also meet up with some regulars from the Smith canon, including Alyssa Jones (Joey Lauren Adams), Brian O'Halloran as Dante Hicks, Jason Lee as Banky Edwards, Alanis Morissette as God, and actors Ben Affleck and Matt Damon in dual roles as themselves and two other familiar characters. Jay and Silent Bob Strike Back co-stars numerous other recognizable performers in roles of various sizes, including Shannen Doherty, Jason Biggs, James Van Der Beek, Shannon Elizabeth, Tracy Morgan, Judd Nelson, Chris Rock, and George Carlin, among others(n)

programme.desc: Classic western remake of The Seven Samurai. A Mexican village is at the mercy of Calvera, the leader of a band of outlaws. The townspeople, too afraid to fight for themselves, hire seven American gunslingers to free them from the bandits' raids. The professional gunmen train the villagers to defend themselves then plan a trap for the evil Calvera(n)

programme.desc: After air traffic controller Jack Chester loses a plane (it's covered on his screen by a fly), he's told to take a break. Jack books his family into a plush resort, but it turns out that their lodgings are in a hut by the beach. And that's as good as the vacation gets... 80s comedy(n)

programme.desc: Streetwise Detroit detective Axel Foley travels to Beverly Hills to track down the killers of an old friend(n)

programme.title: Beverly Hills Cop II
programme.desc: Eddie Murphy returns as Axel Foley, the loud-mouthed cop from Detroit who's back to shake up Beverly Hills after chief Andrew Bogomil is nearly killed. Teaming up again with Det Billy Rosewood, who's developed an unhealthy liking for firepower under Foley's influence, and Det Sgt John Taggart, they set out to crack the 'Alphabet Crimes' - robberies from heavily guarded premises. Chief suspect is Maxwell Dent, who's protected by heavy Charlie 'Chips' Cain and assassin Karla Fry. And it's not long before the quiet of Beverly Hills is shattered by car chases and shoot-outs in Tony Scott's comedy cop-thriller(n)

programme.title: Beverly Hills Cop III
programme.desc: A wiseacre cop from Detroit finds himself in L.A. trailing killers and counterfeiters at an amusement park(n)

programme.title: Superstar

programme.title: Ninja III: The Domination
programme.desc: In this slick exploitation, martial arts fantasy from schlockmeisters Menahem Golan and Yoram Globus, an evil ninja is killed off in a sandtrap on a golf course in Phoenix -- the police riddle him with bullets, foolishly thinking that is the end of it. But as he is dying, the ninja throws a smoke bomb and, hidden by the dark cloud, he crawls into a phone-company van driven by the acrobatic Christie (Lucinda Dickey of Breakin'). As he dies there, his soul possesses her body, much to the consternation of her boyfriend, Secord (Jordan Bennett). Christie periodically uses exotic Eastern skills to slaughter the evil ninja's foes until good ninja Yamada (Sho Kosugi) comes to her rescue(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Gibbs and the team are called in when a Navy reservist returns home to find her husband missing and her living room covered in blood, and make a grim discovery when they find a finger in the bin. Meanwhile, Ziva ruffles a few feathers by insisting on continuing her investigation into the murder of her father, asking for permission to go to Rome on the trail of the chief suspect. Mark Harmon stars.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: New Mossad director Orli Elbaz asks for the team's help in finding Ilan Bodnar when one of her agents is shot dead in Virginia, telling Gibbs he was investigating several operatives who had gone rogue after Eli David's death. Ziva travels with Tony to Berlin in her pursuit of Bodnar, the man she believes was responsible for the death of her father. Guest starring Marina Sirtis (Star Trek: The Next Generation).(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team tracks Bodnar's SUV to a remote house in the countryside, but inside find only his dead accomplice - identified as a South African mercenary who helped Bodnar procure diamonds. Ziva and Tony, meanwhile, discharge themselves from hospital and wheedle information out of Abby to continue investigating on the quiet, having been warned by Homeland Security to stay off the case.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A cook from a US Navy destroyer tells McGee and Gibbs he believes someone is stalking him with the intention of trying to make him poison the crew, and a picture on a stolen phone leads the team to a group testing the psychological effects of surveillance. Meanwhile, Richard Parsons from the Inspector General's office closes in on Ziva as he investigates the death of Ilan Bodnar, the man who killed her father. Guest starring Colin Hanks (Gus Grimly in the Fargo TV series).(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team investigates when Navy Seal Chad McBride's wife receives a package from Riyadh in Saudi Arabia containing her husband's severed head, which Palmer discovers contains very high levels of radiation. McBride's commanding officer reveals the soldier was on a top-secret reconnaissance mission and asks Vance not to disclose the details to anyone. Meanwhile, Richard Parsons tries to get Gibbs to take responsibility for the many unnecessary deaths for which he holds the NCIS team accountable.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The American naval crime drama returns, joined by a new recruit played by Jennifer Esposito. The team investigates a deadly car explosion in DC that seems to be connected to Special Agent Nick Torres's disappearance six months earlier, while on a deep-cover operation in Argentina.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A bomb plot is uncovered following a death at a Quantico reunion, and tensions in the squad room cause trouble for Torres and Quinn as they settle into their new jobs.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: Agent LaRoche suspects Hightower of the murder of a police killer, who was burned to death in custody, after she reveals that she was sleeping with one of his victims. Jane also discovers that the head of CBI is linked to the death of an archaeology professor, prompting him to jeopardise his own career to help clear her name. Crime drama, starring Pruitt Taylor Vince and Aunjanue Ellis.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: Jane believes a doctor's murderer was a fellow physician, and discovers the victim was the head of a transplant unit. He is convinced wealthy people are being given preferential treatment at the hospital where the medic worked, but his sleuthing lands him in trouble with a patient's gun-wielding bodyguard. Elsewhere, Lisbon is demoted following a slip of the tongue. Crime drama, starring Simon Baker.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: The agents track down the killer of a man who believed he was abducted by aliens, and the case becomes more complicated when his body is stolen from the coroner's van. Van Pelt takes time off from the investigation to shop for a wedding dress. Crime drama, starring Simon Baker and Amanda Righetti.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: The owner of an exclusive dating website is murdered, and although Jane is certain the victim's wife is to blame, she is released due to a lack of evidence. When holes begin to appear in her alibi, the consultant discovers a way to convict her of the crime, while the rest of the team learns that some of the women at the agency are filming their encounters with wealthy men so they can blackmail them. Crime drama, starring Simon Baker.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: Jane deals with two failed robberies, one resulting in the murder of a repair shop owner, and the other involving a former suspect the consultant hired to break into LaRoche's home. Crime drama, starring Simon Baker.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.sub-title: Criss-Cross Applesauce: The Ballard of Billy Jesusworth.
programme.desc: When Roger breaks his ankle, Francine convinces Stan to let him play in his basketball league.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Stan discovers a valuable salt deposit beneath the Smiths' back garden, but when he tries to sell the mining rights, he discovers he signed them over to Steve years ago.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Jeff and Hayley announce they would like to have a baby, and Stan takes the prospect of becoming a grandfather badly. Meanwhile, Steve plans to become a responsible uncle.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Peter and Carter go to Africa to get their money back after they are swindled in an e-mail scam, while Brian pursues Meg's friend Patty.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Halloween arrives, and Peter joins forces with Joe to play a series of painful pranks on his friends and neighbours. Meanwhile, Brian teaches Stewie the basics of trick-or-treating, and Meg has high hopes for her first festively themed high-school party.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Peter receives tickets to a boxing match as a birthday gift, and ends up volunteering Lois to compete. To everyone's surprise, she proves to be a natural pugilist, prompting her hapless husband to become her fight promoter - little suspecting that she is using her marital frustrations as motivation in the ring.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Stan resurrects President Garfield to teach Hayley about history, and Steve starts writing for his school's newspaper. Animated comedy, with the voice of Seth MacFarlane.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Bullock is disappointed when someone neglects to bring a present to the CIA Secret Santa Party, and Stan resolves to find out which of his colleagues has turned Scrooge.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Lois becomes a theatre director and decides to stage The King and I as her first production. However, Peter ends up taking over the show and replaces Loretta with Diane Simmons in the lead role.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.sub-title: I Am Peter, Hear Me Roar.
programme.desc: Peter is sent to a women's sensitivity retreat as punishment for telling a sexist joke, and gets in touch with his feminine side - much to the dismay of Lois, who enlists the help of Quagmire to return him to his old self. Animated comedy, with the voice of Seth MacFarlane.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Roger becomes a bounty hunter and embarks on a cross-country manhunt with the help of Stan, determined to capture Hayley's boyfriend Jeff, who is wanted for smuggling drugs into Florida.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Francine is furious when she discovers that Stan has used government resources to artificially insert memories of happy vacations into the family's minds.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Peter's favourite police drama is cancelled, so he tries to persuade a publicity-hungry TV executive to put it back on the air by claiming that Chris is dying. As news spreads of the youngster's `illness', well-wishers mount a candlelit vigil outside the house.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Lois runs for the position of school board president but refuses to overturn a decision to sack a teacher, prompting Peter to compete in the election and launch a smear campaign against her. Animated comedy, featuring the voices of Alex Borstein and Seth MacFarlane.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Stan becomes a traffic warden in a bid to be taken more seriously, and suddenly finds himself caught up in allegations of corruption and favouritism. Hayley poses nude for a college art class and is surprised to see Roger is one of the students.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Stan prays for a friend and is delighted to have his request fulfilled - until he learns his new pal is an atheist, at which point he sets out to prove that God exists by making his acquaintance's life extremely hard. Meanwhile, Roger convinces Steve that he has been accepted into Hogwarts.(n)

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Buying goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The American crime drama returns with the team still reeling from the Department of Defence investigation, with Ziva, McGee and Tony having handed in their badges. Parsons continues his inquiries into Gibbs and his agents, but events take a turn when an explosion kills the Secretary of the US Navy and seriously injures the director of Homeland Security. When attempts are made on the lives of Gibbs and Tony, it appears that all of the NCIS agents are in mortal danger. Starring Mark Harmon and Colin Hanks.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Sarah Porter, the new Secretary of the Navy, charges Gibbs and the team with finding terrorist group the Brotherhood of Doubt, which was responsible for killing her predecessor. She expects the group's next target to be billionaire Tomas Mendez, who spends his money trying to defeat terrorism, but whose motives may not be entirely altruistic. Meanwhile, Tony flies to Tel Aviv, where new Mossad director Orli Elbaz reveals they have a report of a possible sighting of Ziva at a kibbutz she went to as a child. Crime drama, guest starring Marina Sirtis.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: An explosion at an apartment building brings navy officer Terence Keith to the team's attention and it transpires he had been on medication for anxiety, a condition that had led to him being ejected from a pilot's training course. Ducky's profile of Keith suggests that he may be unstable and about to exact revenge for having his dream of becoming a fighter ace taken away from him, and evidence points to him intending to carry out a suicide attack.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A woman is found murdered and Gibbs and McGee are called in when she is discovered to be carrying ID bearing the name Sgt Patricia Moreno, a US marine known to have died several years earlier. The victim is discovered to have come to America from Afghanistan and a necklace reveals a fingerprint that leads the team to a known assassin. Guest starring Lolita Davidovich.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Gibbs and the team investigate when naval cryptanalyst Andrew Wells is shot dead in a park outside Baltimore. At the scene, Tony spots a man who was one of his informants from 15 years earlier when he was a police officer, but who went into hiding after a bid to bring down the Russian mobsters he worked for went wrong. Drama, starring Mark Harmon.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: Jane suspects that a state prison inmate is to blame for the murder of a guard who was stabbed to death outside a jewellery shop, and Rigsby decides to find out what his criminal father knows about the killing. Crime drama, starring Simon Baker and Owain Yeoman.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: Members of the Northern California Symphony Orchestra come under suspicion when a violinist is murdered, and Cho encounters a young pickpocket. Crime drama, starring Tim Kang and Simon Baker.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: In the first of a two-part series finale, a bank robber's suicide bombing outside a petrol station convenience shop leaves Jane suspecting there is more to the case than meets the eye. The incident is linked to the discovery of the body of a torture victim, and it transpires he was related to Hightower - who appears to be the target of serial killer Red John. Crime drama, starring Simon Baker and Robin Tunney.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: In the conclusion of the two-part series finale, Hightower wants to hand herself in, knowing she will be found innocent of Todd Johnson's murder, but Jane dissuades her, not wanting to risk scaring Red John underground. The consultant manages to inform all four suspects of her location and awaits the arrival of the accomplice, who he will use to track down the serial killer - only for Lisbon to get injured in the ploy. Crime drama, starring Simon Baker and Aunjanue Ellis.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: Jane is taken into custody for fatally shooting the man he believed to be serial killer Red John, but bluffs his way out of jail and tries to exonerate himself. He begins by visiting his victim's widow - and learns her house contains not only a secret room, but also a reluctant guest. Starring Simon Baker.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Springfield Up. Eric Idle provides the voice of a documentary filmmaker who interviewed a group of Springfield schoolchildren 32 years ago and has followed up at eight-year intervals to film how their lives have unfolded(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: To Surveil With Love. Springfield is plunged into an Orwellian nightmare when surveillance cameras are installed everywhere to beef up security after a supposed terrorist attack. Meanwhile, Lisa faces hair-colour prejudice(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Treehouse of Horror XXI. Three spine-tingling tales feature in the animation's traditional Halloween special.
