Homer and Marge set sail on a romantic second honeymoon, but things go awry when they rescue sinister castaway Roger. Lisa is smitten with mysterious new student Edmund, who happens to be a vampire(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Pay Pal. When Homer ruins yet another possible friendship, this time with a new neighbour, Marge starts to worry about Lisa's lack of pals(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Lisa the Veterinarian. Lisa wants to be a veterinarian after she performs CPR on a raccoon, but learns a tough lesson when the neglected class hamster dies. Elsewhere, Marge moonlights as a crime scene cleaner to make extra money, but the gory scenes impact her too much(n)

programme.title: Ted
programme.desc: In this quirky comedy, a child successfully wishes that his teddy bear could come to life, but he gets more than he bargained for when the stuffed animal follows him into adulthood and complicates his relationship with a beautiful woman(n)

programme.title: Ted
programme.desc: In this quirky comedy, a child successfully wishes that his teddy bear could come to life, but he gets more than he bargained for when the stuffed animal follows him into adulthood and complicates his relationship with a beautiful woman(n)

programme.title: Stuart Little
programme.desc: An American couple decide their son needs a brother, and plan to adopt another child - but when they get to the orphanage they are greeted by a charming talking mouse named Stuart, who fits the bill perfectly. However, their jealous cat hatches a plot to get rid of the new arrival. Comedy adventure, starring Geena Davis and Hugh Laurie, with the voice of Michael J Fox.(n)

programme.title: Cannes Film Festival Special 2017
programme.desc: Film4 looks at some of the new films at this year's Cannes Film Festival and interviews some of the stars including Julianne Moore, Elle Fanning and Colin Farrell.(n)

programme.title: Martin Scorsese on Hugo
programme.desc: The director discusses his family adventure based on Brian Selznick's novel.(n)

programme.title: Hugo
programme.desc: An orphan lives in the walls of a 1930s railway station, hiding from the inspector who would send him to an orphanage. He scours the station for parts to complete a clockwork robot belonging to his father, a quest which leads him to uncover a lonely shopkeeper's mysterious past. Martin Scorsese's family adventure, starring Asa Butterfield, Chloe Grace Moretz and Ben Kingsley.(n)

programme.title: Dunston Checks In
programme.desc: A gentleman jewel thief's pet orang-utan runs amok in a swanky hotel, causing endless problems for the put-upon manager who has enough on his plate trying to ensure the establishment successfully attains a six-star rating. Family comedy, starring Jason Alexander, Rupert Everett, Faye Dunaway, Eric Lloyd and Paul Reubens.(n)

programme.title: The Rewrite
programme.desc: A washed-up Hollywood screenwriter takes a job at a small university, planning to exploit his position as a local celebrity and do as little work as possible. His cynical outlook begins to change when he falls for a single mother working toward her degree, while a talented pupil makes him consider what he wants from his life. Romantic comedy, with Hugh Grant, Marisa Tomei, Allison Janney and JK Simmons.(n)

programme.title: Chronicle
programme.desc: Three teenagers develop superhuman abilities after exploring a mysterious cave. They delight in experimenting with what they are able to do, documenting their actions on video. However, one of them lets his new-found power go to his head, and as he begins using it to evil ends, the others realise only they can stop him. Sci-fi thriller, starring Dane DeHaan, Alex Russell and Michael B Jordan.(n)

programme.title: Bad Neighbours
programme.desc: A couple living in suburbia and adjusting to new parenthood are determined to prove they can still be cool when a household of students moves in next door. However, when their raucous neighbours' wild parties disrupt their lives, they decide to fight back, leading to a vicious cycle of one-upmanship. Comedy, starring Seth Rogen, Zac Efron and Rose Byrne.(n)

programme.title: Extraterrestrial
programme.desc: Five college friends spending a weekend in a remote cabin fear for their lives when they accidentally blunder onto a conspiracy theorist's land. The situation grows far more terrifying when a UFO crash lands nearby, and the surviving occupant comes looking for human prey. Sci-fi horror, starring Brittany Allen and Freddie Stroma.(n)

programme.title: Five Deadly Venoms
programme.desc: The dying master of a powerful clan dispatches his last student Yang Tieh on a mission to check on the activities of five former pupils he fears may be using their abilities for evil purposes. However, they are all masters of a specific martial arts style, while Yang Tieh barely has a grounding in each, and they are living under assumed identities in locations unknown. Martial arts adventure, starring Chiang Sheng. In Mandarin.(n)

programme.title: The Ladykillers
programme.desc: A criminal mastermind and his gang come up with a cunning scheme to steal a fortune, but their plan is threatened by the unsuspecting elderly landlady of the boarding house they are staying in. They decide to dispose of her, which proves easier said than done. Classic Ealing comedy, with Alec Guinness, Peter Sellers, Herbert Lom, Katie Johnson, Cecil Parker, Danny Green and Jack Warner.(n)

programme.title: Cannes Film Festival Special 2017
programme.desc: Film4 looks at some of the new films at this year's Cannes Film Festival and interviews some of the stars including Julianne Moore, Elle Fanning and Colin Farrell.(n)

programme.title: The Parent Trap

Disney comedy, starring Hayley Mills in a dual role as both sisters, alongside Maureen O'Hara, Brian Keith and Leo G Carroll.(n)

programme.title: Moomins on the Riviera

Children's animation, with the voices of Russell Tovey and Tracy-Ann Oberman.(n)

Fact-based drama, directed by and starring George Clooney. With Matt Damon, Bill Murray and Cate Blanchett.(n)

Sci-fi drama, with Whitney Able and Scoot McNairy.(n)

programme.title: Home Shopping
programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: The Two Ronnies
programme.desc: Randy Crawford performs Secret Combination in the studio, while Messrs Corbett and Barker each perform a monologue - the latter on behalf of sufferers of `pismonunciation'.(n)

programme.title: The Two Ronnies
programme.desc: Vintage comedy from Messrs Barker and Corbett, including sketches News Item, Hush Hush, The Chars, Band of Slaves and Teeny Todd. Marti Webb provides the musical interlude.(n)

programme.title: The Interviews
programme.desc: Dawn French narrates this series finding out more about some of the nation's favourite performers, beginning with Kenneth Williams. In interviews with the most celebrated interrogators such as David Frost, Michael Parkinson, Terry Wogan and Russell Harty, the raconteur talks openly about his frustrations, phobias and darkest moments.(n)

programme.title: One Foot in the Grave
programme.desc: Victor and Margaret set off for a break by the seaside - but the discovery of a dead gull in their boarding-house bathroom sets the scene for what turns out to be a weekend of sheer hell. Richard Wilson and Annette Crosbie star.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: The Miraculous Curing of Old Goff Helliwell.
programme.desc: When Clegg, Billy and Truly hear an old school friend is about to die, the trio search for something - or someone - to put the spark back into his life. Comedy, guest starring Henry McGee, with Peter Sallis, Frank Thornton and Keith Clifford.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: As Barry tires of golf and looks for a new hobby, Billy's latest idea of an archery course is right on target. Long-running comedy series, starring Mike Grady, Keith Clifford and Peter Sallis.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: The Man Who Invented Yorkshire Funny Stuff.
programme.desc: Howard is dismayed when Marina unwittingly buys him a life-like gorilla which attracts the attention of the local police. Meanwhile, a newspaper article prompts Truly, Clegg and Billy to try to track down Cyril Cooper - a man renowned for his green fingers and womanising ways. Comedy, starring Robert Fyfe.(n)

programme.title: We're Doomed! The Dad's Army Story
programme.desc: Comedy drama based on the story of how Jimmy Perry and David Croft brought the sitcom Dad's Army to life. Running from Perry's initial idea in 1967 until the transmission of the first episode in 1968, the film shows the beginnings of their writing partnership and the casting woes, personal clashes and production difficulties that put the show's existence in jeopardy. Starring Paul Ritter and Richard Dormer.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.sub-title: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire?.
programme.desc: An old friend returns from Australia flushed with success and offers Del a share in his business empire Down Under. Although the prospect is tempting, it would mean leaving Nelson Mandela House and little brother Rodney behind. David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst star.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del encounters an old flame from almost 20 years previously, and Rodney experiences the joys of dating - but the brothers soon face awkward questions from the past. David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst star, with Diane Langton (The Rag Trade).(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: A weeping statue in the local church gives Del an idea for a money-making scheme to help a hospice under threat of closure. However, his efforts are thwarted by the weather. Comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Buster Merryfield.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Rodney dates an artist who turns out to be the daughter of the Duke of Maylebury. Del sees the chance for the Trotter family to marry into the aristocracy, and disastrously gatecrashes a party at the Duke's country estate. Christmas special from 1986, starring David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: The Trotter brothers are guests at a wedding, where they are intrigued to hear their dear departed mother inherited the ill-gotten gains of an East End bank robber - but nobody has ever found the loot. Christmas special of the long-running comedy, originally shown in 1987, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Buster Merryfield, with a guest appearance by Joan Sims.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.sub-title: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire?.
programme.desc: An old friend returns from Australia flushed with success and offers Del a share in his business empire Down Under. Although the prospect is tempting, it would mean leaving Nelson Mandela House and little brother Rodney behind. David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst star.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del encounters an old flame from almost 20 years previously, and Rodney experiences the joys of dating - but the brothers soon face awkward questions from the past. David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst star, with Diane Langton (The Rag Trade).(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Rodney leaves home after a fight with Cassandra, and arranges a date with receptionist Tanya in an effort to make his wife jealous - but Del's interference ensures the plan fails to go as smoothly as it should. Christmas special first shown in 1990, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Buster Merryfield.(n)

programme.title: Mrs Brown's Boys
programme.desc: A hypnotist is booked to provide the entertainment at the triplets' baptism - and Agnes soon finds herself under his spell. Meanwhile, the matriarch's kitchen is falling apart - but that turns out to be the least of her problems when son Mark delivers some heartbreaking news. Hit comedy, starring Brendan O'Carroll as the foul-mouthed mother-of-six.(n)

programme.title: Mrs Brown's Boys
programme.desc: Cathy goes to extreme lengths to impress her psychologist boyfriend, much to Agnes's disgust, while Rory locates the perfect apartment for him and Dino - the problem is, it's in Kilbride, meaning he'll have to learn to drive. Mark prepares to emigrate to Australia. Hit comedy, starring Brendan O'Carroll as the foul-mouthed mother-of-six.(n)

programme.title: Mrs Brown's Boys
programme.desc: Agnes needs someone to look after Grandad so she can treat herself to a much-needed holiday - but with private nursing homes being so expensive, it seems her only option is to convince the health visitor he has lost his marbles. Rory and Dino move in for a couple of weeks, and the matriarch is soon spitting feathers when the latter begins taking over the house, and her late husband gets in touch from beyond the grave with some ominous news. Hit comedy, starring Brendan O'Carroll.(n)

programme.title: The Young Ones
programme.desc: Squalid students Vyvyan, Rick, Neil and Mike try to liven up a boring day with a trip to the pub, and have to contend with their landlord's insane nephew. Anarchic comedy, with special guests Madness starring alongside Rik Mayall and Adrian Edmondson.(n)

programme.title: The Young Ones
programme.desc: The squalid students get their hands on an atom bomb. Mike decides to try flogging it to Libya, while Rick intends to blackmail the government. Unfortunately, Vyvyan has bigger ideas - like blowing up the world. Guest starring Dexys Midnight Runners.(n)

programme.title: Black Books
programme.desc: Bernard and Manny feel uncomfortable around their new, oddly sensual cleaner and decide to accept a house-sitting job to get away from him. Meanwhile, Fran goes on date with an available, attractive, charming man. Comedy, starring Dylan Moran, Bill Bailey and Tamsin Greig, with Kevin Eldon.(n)

programme.title: Black Books
programme.desc: Bernard gets snubbed by the people who invited him to a dinner party the night before, making him wonder just how badly he behaved, and Manny turns crimefighter after he chases a bag-snatcher and is mistaken for a police officer. Comedy, starring Dylan Moran, Bill Bailey and Tamsin Greig.(n)

programme.title: Bill Hicks - It's Just a Ride
programme.desc: A tribute to the stand-up comedian, who died of pancreatic cancer in 1994 at the age of 32, featuring the best of the comic's renowned confrontational performances. With contributions by Jay Leno, David Letterman, Sean Hughes, Eric Bogosian and Eddie Izzard.(n)

programme.title: Garth Marenghi's Darkplace
programme.desc: The hospital chef is attacked with a ladle and everyone assumes there is an unknown assailant on the loose, but their theories leave no room for the strange occurrences elsewhere in the building. Tongue-in-cheek drama, starring Matthew Holness.(n)

programme.title: Garth Marenghi's Darkplace
programme.desc: Dagless's paternal instincts are aroused when a man gives birth to a giant eye - but the rest of the staff see it as a malevolent threat to the wellbeing of the hospital. Tongue-in-cheek supernatural drama, starring Matthew Holness and Richard Ayoade.(n)

programme.title: House of Fools
programme.desc: When his probation officer calls round to the house, Bosh asks Vic, Bob, Julie and Beef to help him convince her he has finally become an upstanding member of society. To show that Bosh is fully rehabilitated, the gang opens a pop-up restaurant to wine and dine her and ensure his parole continues. Guest starring Nikki Amuka-Bird (Luther).(n)

programme.title: Home Shopping
programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Home Shopping
programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: One Foot in the Grave
programme.desc: Victor endures a sleepless night - and naturally ensures the eternally put-upon Margaret and their neighbours share in his suffering. Comedy, starring Richard Wilson and Annette Crosbie.(n)

programme.title: The Interviews
programme.desc: Profile of Les Dawson, who was famed for his deadpan, world-weary comedy style and plentiful jokes about his wife and mother-in-law, illustrated by his numerous appearances on TV chat shows. Narrated by Dawn French.(n)

programme.title: We're Doomed! The Dad's Army Story
programme.desc: Comedy drama based on the story of how Jimmy Perry and David Croft brought the sitcom Dad's Army to life. Running from Perry's initial idea in 1967 until the transmission of the first episode in 1968, the film shows the beginnings of their writing partnership and the casting woes, personal clashes and production difficulties that put the show's existence in jeopardy. Starring Paul Ritter and Richard Dormer.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: A weeping statue in the local church gives Del an idea for a money-making scheme to help a hospice under threat of closure. However, his efforts are thwarted by the weather. Comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Buster Merryfield.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Uncle Albert has a nasty fall into the cellar at the Nag's Head, but turns his injury into a profit-making opportunity - eagerly egged on by wheeler-dealer Del-Boy. Vintage comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Buster Merryfield.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Rodney aspires to be a pop star, taking on the role of the drumless drummer in Mental Mickey's band but, not surprisingly, Del-Boy manages to ruin his chances. With a guest appearance by DJ Mike Read, alongside David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Dodgy dealer Del gets his hands on a consignment of self-inflating rubber dolls, which turn out to be filled with explosive gas. Comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Buster Merryfield.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: The Trotter brothers are guests at a wedding, where they are intrigued to hear their dear departed mother inherited the ill-gotten gains of an East End bank robber - but nobody has ever found the loot. Christmas special of the long-running comedy, originally shown in 1987, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Buster Merryfield, with a guest appearance by Joan Sims.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del enters one of Rodney's old paintings in a competition and is over the moon when he wins a holiday for three at a five-star hotel in Majorca. Soon after, the Trotter brothers and Cassandra arrive at Palma Airport - but Del-Boy reveals there is a slight snag. Comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Gwyneth Strong.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Rodney leaves home after a fight with Cassandra, and arranges a date with receptionist Tanya in an effort to make his wife jealous - but Del's interference ensures the plan fails to go as smoothly as it should. Christmas special first shown in 1990, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Buster Merryfield.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Uncle Albert has a nasty fall into the cellar at the Nag's Head, but turns his injury into a profit-making opportunity - eagerly egged on by wheeler-dealer Del-Boy. Vintage comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Buster Merryfield.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Rodney aspires to be a pop star, taking on the role of the drumless drummer in Mental Mickey's band but, not surprisingly, Del-Boy manages to ruin his chances. With a guest appearance by DJ Mike Read, alongside David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Dodgy dealer Del gets his hands on a consignment of self-inflating rubber dolls, which turn out to be filled with explosive gas. Comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Buster Merryfield.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del enters one of Rodney's old paintings in a competition and is over the moon when he wins a holiday for three at a five-star hotel in Majorca. Soon after, the Trotter brothers and Cassandra arrive at Palma Airport - but Del-Boy reveals there is a slight snag. Comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Gwyneth Strong.(n)

programme.title: Mrs Brown's Boys
programme.desc: It seems that everyone in the Brown family has a date for Valentine's Day except Agnes, so she turns to the internet to find herself a man. Dermot tries to come up with a loving gesture to prove to Maria he can still be romantic - but he makes the mistake of taking advice from Buster - while Agnes and Winnie are fascinated by Betty's sex manual and Grandad ends up addicted to Viagra. Hit comedy, starring Brendan O'Carroll.(n)

programme.title: Mrs Brown's Boys
programme.desc: A secretive phone call from a solicitor to Mrs Brown leaves her children suspecting one of them may be adopted, while Father Quinn returns from rehab and asks Agnes to help out at his annual garden party - although as she proceeds to drive him crazy with a smartphone, his recovery may be short-lived. Meanwhile, Cathy receives a blast from the past, Rory and Dino have a bust-up, and Mark and Betty deliver bad news - they are leaving for Australia right away. Domestic comedy, starring Brendan O'Carroll.(n)

programme.title: Mrs Brown's Boys
programme.desc: The Browns are excited as preparations for Rory and Dino's big day are in full swing - although Agnes's mood is dampened when she meets flamboyant celebrity wedding planner La La Doggy. The foul-mouthed matriarch also clashes with Father Damien when he raises religious concerns about the ceremony - and to top it all off, she gets more than she bargained for when she invites Cathy's boyfriend's parents over for the evening. Hit comedy, starring Brendan O'Carroll, with Jennifer Gibney, Rory Cowan and Conor Moloney.(n)

programme.title: Men Behaving Badly
programme.desc: Gary and Tony are horrified to learn Deborah is planning to sell up and travel around Asia, but their attempts to change her mind seem doomed to failure - until a smooth-talking estate agent arrives to value the flat. Comedy, starring Martin Clunes, Neil Morrissey, Leslie Ash and Caroline Quentin.(n)

programme.title: Men Behaving Badly
programme.desc: Gary and Dorothy take a weekend break at a country hotel to spice up their love life, but receive a nasty surprise when they confess wild fantasies to each other. Meanwhile, Tony busies himself devising schemes to prevent estate agent Ray sleeping with Deborah.(n)

programme.title: Home Shopping
programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: James Martin: Yorkshire's Finest
programme.desc: The chef visits the Saturday farmers' market in Richmond, North Yorkshire, and prepares beef stew with mashed potato, followed by raspberry and white chocolate sherry trifle.(n)

programme.title: James Martin: Yorkshire's Finest
programme.desc: After a visit to the Whitby fish market, the chef prepares cod with mango chutney, bean sprout salad and Thai crab risotto.(n)

programme.title: Jamie's Money Saving Meals
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver demonstrates how to prepare nutritious meals on a budget, offering tips on keeping costs down and wasting less food. Beginning with recipes that work out at less than £1.80 a portion, he cooks up a roast brisket of beef with all the trimmings, Korean stir-fried rice, and sweet pea fish pie, before showing a takeaway lover how to make his favourite treat for a fraction of the price of ordering it in.(n)

programme.title: Jamie's Money Saving Meals
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver demonstrates how to prepare nutritious meals for an average of £1.30 a portion. He cooks a roast half shoulder of pork with all the trimmings before turning the leftovers into dim sum buns, and rustles up meatloaf with spaghetti and a tomato and chilli sauce. The chef also shows a takeaway lover how to make a vegetable korma with cauliflower pilau for a fraction of the price of ordering it in, and helps a woman put all the meat in her freezer to good use instead of wasting it.(n)

programme.title: Jamie's Money Saving Meals
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver demonstrates how to prepare nutritious meals for around £1.55 a portion. He cooks up a roast side of salmon with all the trimmings and uses the leftovers in a filo pie, before showing a takeaway lover how to make a lamb burger for a fraction of the price of his usual Friday night fast-food treat. Plus, a woman receives tips on putting unwanted bread to good use.(n)

programme.title: Jamie's Money Saving Meals
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver prepares roast chicken with all the trimmings, before turning the leftovers into a stew with dumplings, and rustles up cauliflower and broccoli cheese using frozen vegetables. The chef also demonstrates a recipe for making lamb koftas on a budget and shows a woman how to use up the fruit she normally throws away.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein's Far Eastern Odyssey
programme.desc: The chef embarks on a culinary journey by sea and land to explore the Far East's most diverse food cultures. He begins in Cambodia, where tourists are beginning to return after the fall of the Khmer Rouge regime. As well as discovering the joys of freshly caught swimmer crabs with green peppercorns, he learns how to cook the country's most famous dish - fish amok - and samples lok lak, made with marinated beef. He also visits the Angkor Wat temple and joins a rice barge to travel down the Mekong River.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein's Far Eastern Odyssey
programme.desc: The chef continues his exploration of the Far East's most diverse food cultures, travelling down the Mekong River to Vietnam, where the local diet features an abundance of herbs, freshwater fish and flavoursome soups. As well as following in the footsteps of his hero Graham Greene in Saigon, he is reunited with a former employee in Hanoi to try out the capital city's street food, and samples the produce on offer at the night-time stalls in Bangkok, Thailand.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein's Far Eastern Odyssey
programme.desc: The chef continues his exploration of the Far East's most diverse food cultures, travelling to Thailand where he meets one of his heroes, David Thompson, who has devoted himself to understanding Thai cuisine. He also takes a train to Phuket to learn the art of hot and sour tom yum goong, and visits Melaka to explore the Nyonya-style cooking.(n)

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.desc: As the hot weather arrives, wasps create problems for Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall and the animals also give him cause for concern - Marge's calf Psycho refuses to let him anywhere near and is in need of treatment from the local animal healer.(n)

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall decides to enter the Vegetable Challenge Cup at the local horticultural show and seizes the opportunity to do a spot of spying on main rivals Derek Purchase and Roy Gunning, reigning champion in the Longest Bean category. He also meets mushroom expert John Wright in an attempt to unearth a summer truffle.(n)

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall decides to plant an orchard and sets off for a day's work picking apples at Charlton in Somerset before getting some expert advice from Robin Small. Meanwhile, two of the pigs are sent off to the abattoir and a panel of tasters arrive to help him rate his chickens.(n)

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall teams up with old rival Michael Michaud to capitalise on the huge profits to be made at the Borough Farmers' Market in London, before joining in the ancient Dorset game of pumpkin-fettling at a Hallowe'en party.(n)

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall's adventures in Dorset, as he moves on from River Cottage and buys a farm. With 44 acres to play with, he hatches an ambitious plan to sell his home-grown produce to the public - but the ramshackle state of the barns he has acquired makes him fear he has taken on more than he can handle.(n)

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall's problems multiply as he tries to get his restaurant up and running in just two weeks - despite it being filled with mud and dirt. With both a kitchen and dining room to be created out of the mess, he starts planning theme nights, starting with a Valentine's Day Special.(n)

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall builds a maternity room for sow Maggie, who is due to give birth. He also turns his hand to installing plumbing and lavatories, using a system of willow and reed beds for filtration, and tries to restore the popularity of purple broccoli with the help of locally produced cheese.(n)

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.desc: May Day crowds gather to watch the Wessex Morris Men dance on hillside figure the Cerne Abbas Giant, presenting Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall with an opportunity to make money selling chocolate waffles. Hugh also sets out to catch a giant lobster reportedly living on a wreck off the Dorset coast, hoping to serve it on the opening night of his restaurant.(n)

programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall builds a maternity room for sow Maggie, who is due to give birth. He also turns his hand to installing plumbing and lavatories, using a system of willow and reed beds for filtration, and tries to restore the popularity of purple broccoli with the help of locally produced cheese.(n)

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.desc: May Day crowds gather to watch the Wessex Morris Men dance on hillside figure the Cerne Abbas Giant, presenting Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall with an opportunity to make money selling chocolate waffles. Hugh also sets out to catch a giant lobster reportedly living on a wreck off the Dorset coast, hoping to serve it on the opening night of his restaurant.(n)

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.desc: As the hot weather arrives, wasps create problems for Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall and the animals also give him cause for concern - Marge's calf Psycho refuses to let him anywhere near and is in need of treatment from the local animal healer.(n)

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall decides to enter the Vegetable Challenge Cup at the local horticultural show and seizes the opportunity to do a spot of spying on main rivals Derek Purchase and Roy Gunning, reigning champion in the Longest Bean category. He also meets mushroom expert John Wright in an attempt to unearth a summer truffle.(n)

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall decides to plant an orchard and sets off for a day's work picking apples at Charlton in Somerset before getting some expert advice from Robin Small. programme.title: River Cottage
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall teams up with old rival Michael Michaud to capitalise on the huge profits to be made at the Borough Farmers' Market in London, before joining in the ancient Dorset game of pumpkin-fettling at a Hallowe'en party.(n)

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall's adventures in Dorset, as he moves on from River Cottage and buys a farm. programme.title: Over Her Dead Body
programme.desc: Eva Longoria Parker, Paul Rudd, and Lake Bell star in first-time feature filmmaker Jeff Lowell's heavenly romantic comedy concerning a female psychic and a doubtful skeptic who find their fledgling love affair thwarted by the latter's recently deceased fiancée. Henry (Rudd) and Kate (Longoria Parker) were all prepared to live out their "happily ever after" when tragedy struck from out of nowhere and Kate was killed on their wedding day. In the aftermath of the accident, a devastated Paul reluctantly takes his sister's advice and pays a visit to local psychic Ashley (Bell). Now, despite the fact that he openly questions her ability to communicate with the dearly departed, Paul can't help but fall head over heels in love with Ashley. Despite the fact that the feelings are most certainly mutual, however, their growing relationship is threatened when Kate makes it her supernatural mission to sabotage the happy couple's fledgling relationship before it starts to get serious(n)

programme.title: Jason Bourne
programme.desc: Jason Bourne emerges from seclusion to reenter the world of high-stakes espionage(n)

programme.title: Vice
programme.sub-title: Last Line of Defense & El Rostro
programme.desc: Last Line of Defense & El Rostro. No additional information is available(n)

programme.title: Loving
programme.desc: Jeff Nichols (Midnight Special, Mud) wrote and directed this biopic about Virginian interracial couple Richard and Mildred Loving (played by Joel Edgerton and Ruth Negga), who were sentenced to prison in 1958 for violating the state's laws against miscegenation. The Lovings decided to fight back, and their case led to a landmark Supreme Court decision that struck down laws prohibiting interracial marriage(n)

programme.title: Shoot 'Em Up
programme.desc: A mysterious man saves a pregnant woman from a gunman and helps to deliver her baby. However, when the relentless gang kill the mother and continue to pursue the newborn, he resolves to protect the child and find out why he is being targeted(n)

programme.title: Nights in Rodanthe
programme.desc: An unhappily married woman retreats to an inn on the North Carolina coast, where she meets a doctor who's struggling with his own crisis of conscience(n)

programme.title: The Women
programme.desc: Biting social satire exposing the machinations that drive the war between women and men. Joan Crawford, Norma Shearer and Rosalind Russell star(n)

programme.title: Victor Frankenstein
programme.desc: This re-imagining of the Frankenstein mythos focuses on Igor, the assistant of Victor Frankenstein. When the mad scientist builds an undead creature that soon becomes a grave danger, it's up to Igor to save Frankenstein from both the monster and himself(n)

programme.title: Over Her Dead Body
programme.desc: Eva Longoria Parker, Paul Rudd, and Lake Bell star in first-time feature filmmaker Jeff Lowell's heavenly romantic comedy concerning a female psychic and a doubtful skeptic who find their fledgling love affair thwarted by the latter's recently deceased fiancée. Henry (Rudd) and Kate (Longoria Parker) were all prepared to live out their "happily ever after" when tragedy struck from out of nowhere and Kate was killed on their wedding day. In the aftermath of the accident, a devastated Paul reluctantly takes his sister's advice and pays a visit to local psychic Ashley (Bell). Now, despite the fact that he openly questions her ability to communicate with the dearly departed, Paul can't help but fall head over heels in love with Ashley. Despite the fact that the feelings are most certainly mutual, however, their growing relationship is threatened when Kate makes it her supernatural mission to sabotage the happy couple's fledgling relationship before it starts to get serious(n)

programme.title: Real Time With Bill Maher
programme.sub-title: Dan Savage; Richard A. Clarke; Dan Abrams; Katty Kay; Michael Steele
programme.desc: Dan Savage; Richard A. Clarke; Dan Abrams; Katty Kay; Michael Steele. Advice columnist Dan Savage; counter-terrorism expert Richard A. Clarke. The roundtable guests are legal analyst Dan Abrams, news anchor Katty Kay and political analyst Michael Steele(n)

programme.title: Vice
programme.sub-title: Last Line of Defense & El Rostro
programme.desc: Last Line of Defense & El Rostro. No additional information is available(n)

programme.title: Marley & Me
programme.desc: A Philadelphia newspaper columnist and his wife move to Florida and adopt a precocious Labrador puppy that quickly turns their lives upside down. Jennifer Aniston and Owen Wilson star in this heartwarming adaptation of John Grogan's bestseller. Alan Arkin, Eric Dane, Kathleen Turner. Directed by David Frankel(n)

programme.title: Making of 'The Boss'
programme.desc: A look at "The Boss," a 2016 comedy about a successful businesswoman jailed for insider trading who seeks redemption upon her release. The film stars Melissa McCarthy, Kristen Bell and Peter Dinklage, and is directed by Ben Falcone(n)

programme.title: The Boss
programme.desc: A hugely successful businesswoman is convicted of insider trading and sentenced to prison. After being released, she tries to earn redemption by helping a group of young girls in their quest to sell brownies(n)

programme.title: Loving
programme.desc: Jeff Nichols (Midnight Special, Mud) wrote and directed this biopic about Virginian interracial couple Richard and Mildred Loving (played by Joel Edgerton and Ruth Negga), who were sentenced to prison in 1958 for violating the state's laws against miscegenation. The Lovings decided to fight back, and their case led to a landmark Supreme Court decision that struck down laws prohibiting interracial marriage(n)

programme.title: X-Men: Apocalypse
programme.desc: In this action-packed comic-book adventure set in the 1980s, the X-Men are forced to confront an ancient mutant called Apocalypse. After the resurrected villain recruits four superpowered followers, Professor X and his charges attempt to stop them(n)

programme.title: T.J. Miller Meticulously Ridiculous
programme.desc: Comedian T.J. Miller performs in Denver at the Paramount Theatre. Topics include nightmares; the differences between alcohol and marijuana; his favorite figure from history; and the challenges of talking about death(n)

programme.title: The Last Witch Hunter
programme.desc: An immortal witch hunter faces off against the Queen Witch who has returned from the dead in a battle where the fate of humanity hangs in the balance(n)

programme.title: Every Brilliant Thing
programme.desc: Jonny Donahoe performs in a one-person play about a man who came of age with a suicidal mother but, at various stages of his life, set about compiling a long list of reasons to live. Filmed at the Barrow Street Theatre in New York City in 2015(n)

programme.title: Little Nicky
programme.desc: Adam Sandler plays Satan's bumbling, slack-jawed spawn in this devilish, effects-laden comedy. Nicky (Sandler) rises from the fiery depths of hell and enters New York City, where he tries to save the world and his father's life by battling his two supremely evil brothers, who are scheming to upset the balance of good and evil. Patricia Arquette, Harvey Keitel, Rodney Dangerfield(n)

programme.title: Men in Black II
programme.desc: Slinky space queen Serleena plots extra-terrestrial destruction and Agent J is going to need help. The only one who knows Serleena's secret is K, who's now a postal official with no knowledge of his former life. Can J persuade a reluctant K to put on the black suit for more alien-busting? Sci-fi comedy(n)

programme.title: Real Time With Bill Maher
programme.sub-title: Dan Savage; Richard A. Clarke; Dan Abrams; Katty Kay; Michael Steele
programme.desc: Dan Savage; Richard A. Clarke; Dan Abrams; Katty Kay; Michael Steele. Advice columnist Dan Savage; counter-terrorism expert Richard A. Clarke. The roundtable guests are legal analyst Dan Abrams, news anchor Katty Kay and political analyst Michael Steele(n)

programme.title: Speed
programme.desc: If a bus goes under 50mph, the bomb on board explodes. Sandra Bullock made her break-through in this blockbusting thriller with Keanu Reeves and Dennis Hopper(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: Winter Is Coming. Set on the mythical continent of Westeros, the series follows several noble families as they vie to rule the land. While the heroes and villains in such tales are usually clearly delineated, the morality underpinning Game of Thrones is infinitely more complex(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: The Kingsroad. Accompanied by his daughters, Ned rides south to take his place in King Robert's court, but Catelyn remains at Winterfell, praying that Bran will recover. Meanwhile, Tyrion tags along when Jon Snow leaves for the Night's Watch with his uncle; and Daenerys gets advice on how to please her husband(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: Lord Snow. Ned finally arrives at King's Landing, but he's aghast to find out from Robert's advisers that the Crown is deep in debt. Meanwhile, Jon Snow gets off to a rough start with the other recruits at Castle Black, but his commitment impresses Tyrion, who clashes with Benjen over the purpose of the Night's Watch; and Catelyn secretly follows Ned to King's Landing, where she airs her suspicions about the Lannisters to her old friend Petyr Baelish(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: Cripples, Bastards and Broken Things. Based on a series of bestselling novels by revered author George RR Martin, this expansive fantasy saga looks set to completely redefine the genre. Set on the mythical continent of Westeros, the series follows several noble families as they vie to rule the land. Brought to the screen by acclaimed author DB Weiss (Lucky Wander Boy) and screenwriter David Benioff (25th Hour), Game of Thrones will have a truly epic sweep with Ireland, Scotland and Malta providing locations for the many environments of Westeros(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: The Wolf and the Lion. ANed and Robert clash over the King's order of a preemptive strike against the Targaryens, a defiant stand that leaves the Hand in a precarious position. Meanwhile, Tyrion receives a rude welcome at the Eyrie from Catelyn's sister, Lysa. Sansa catches the eye of a handsome knight and Arya learns of a threat against her father(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: A Golden Crown. As Tyrion employs a risky scheme to escape the Eyrie, Ned Stark makes a shocking discovery about the Lannisters(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: You Win or You Die. As House Lannister prepares for battle, Ned Stark confronts Cersei about Jon Arryn's death. Strong language and adult scenes(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: The Pointy End. Syrio comes to the rescue of his pupil Arya during a confrontation with the Lannister guards after Ned is captured. Meanwhile, Robb assembles the Stark allies to prepare for war in the south against Tywin Lannister; Jon clashes with drill instructor Thorne at the Night's Watch; and Daenerys has second thoughts about her quest for power after a Dothraki attack on a peaceful village(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: Baelor. Catelyn makes a deal with the untrustworthy Walder Frey; Robb has his first success on the battlefield; Tyrion finds himself in an unfamiliar environment; Jon discovers Maester Aemon's secret; Daenerys goes to extremes to help Drogo(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: Fire and Blood. The first season ends with tragic news reaching all corners of the Seven Kingdoms, which coincides with a shared vision by Bran and Rickon Stark. Meanwhile, Catelyn presses Jaime about her son's fall; Tyrion heads south following his father's surprising decision; Arya tries to escape from King's Landing; Jon faces a difficult choice at the Night's Watch; and Daenerys suffers a terrible setback(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: The North Remembers. The war for the Iron Throne rages on. Tyrant Joffrey makes life hell for Sansa, while in Dragonstone, a new pretender enters the fray(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: The Night Lands. On a mission for Robb Stark, Theon returns home for the first time in nine years, but time has not dulled his father's bitterness at losing his only surviving son to Winterfell. Meanwhile, Tyrion makes his presence felt as the Hand of the King, though not necessarily to the satisfaction of others in the royal court; and Davos seeks naval power from an old acquaintance, the pirate Salladhor Saan(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.sub-title: What Is Dead May Never Die
programme.desc: What Is Dead May Never Die. Tyrion finds Shae a job, and devises a clever ruse to ferret out a snitch at the Red Keep. Meanwhile, Jon Snow's compassion gets him and Mormont's crew in hot water at Craster's Keep, but Sam Tarly has a parting gift for Gilly; Catelyn pitches an alliance to Renly Baratheon in the Stormlands; Theon takes a bold stance to get back in his father's good graces; and Arya must think quickly when there's trouble on the road north(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: Garden of Bones. Tyrion steps in when Joffrey holds Sansa accountable for Robb Stark's recent decisive victory on the battlefield, though the ill-tempered king finds another target for his cruelty. Meanwhile, Arya and Gendry are imprisoned at Harrenhal, where they witness unspeakable acts of torture; Daenerys and the khalasar seek salvation at the prosperous city of Qarth; and Stannis calls on Davos' past as a smuggler to carry out a secret mission(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: The Ghost of Harrenhal. Arya receives a promise from a prisoner she saved, Theon prepares to prove himself as a true Ironborn and The Night's Watch makes a stand at the Fist of the First Men(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.sub-title: The Old Gods and the New
programme.desc: The Old Gods and the New. Arya gets a surprise visitor; Daenerys takes a stand for what she believes is rightfully hers; Joffrey meets his subjects; Jon must prove his mettle to Qhorin(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: A Man Without Honor. The Emmy Award winning fantasy drama continues. Theon tries to prove himself as a true Ironborn and Daenerys receives an intriguing invitation(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: The Prince of Winterfell. Robb Stark learns of betrayal, while Arya calls in a debt that will be hard to honour(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: Blackwater. The Lannisters' grip on the throne hangs in the balance as Stannis launches an attack on King's Landing. Contains very strong scenes of violence and strong language(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: Valar Morghulis. The second season of the epic fantasy drama concludes as the Starks, Baratheons and Lannisters clash. Contains strong language and adult themes(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: Valar Dohaeris. In the opening episode of series 3, Jon meets Mance Rayder, the King Beyond the Wall, as the rest of the Night's Watch survivors move south. Meanwhile, in King's Landing, Tyrion wants his reward, Cersei hosts a royal dinner and Littlefinger makes Sansa an offer she may not be able to refuse; and across the Narrow Sea, Daenerys travels to Slaver's Bay in search of a ship and new alliances(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: Dark Wings, Dark Words. Shae asks Tyrion for a favour; Sansa tries not to crack under pressure; Jaime finds a way to while away the hours; Arya has an encounter with the Brotherhood Without Banners(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: Walk of Punishment. Daenerys meets with Kraznys to make a deal for an army, and tempts the slaver with an offer he may not be able to refuse. Meanwhile, Tyrion is given new responsibilities to which he is decidedly unsuited; the Night's Watch Rangers retreat to a familiar place; Jon and Mance Rayder examine the carnage at the Fist of the First Men; and Catelyn says good-bye to her father(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.sub-title: And Now His Watch Has Ended
programme.desc: And Now His Watch Has Ended. Frayed nerves and empty stomachs test the mettle of a depleted Night's Watch at Craster's. Meanwhile, Margaery takes Joffrey out of his comfort zone, and gives Sansa a glimpse of the future; Arya meets the leader of the Brotherhood; Varys plots revenge on an old foe; Theon mournfully recalls his missteps; and Daenerys deftly orchestrates her exit from Astapor(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: Kissed by Fire. The gods judge the Hound, but men pass their judgment on Jaime. Meanwhile, Jon passes a crucial test; Robb is betrayed; and Tyrion learns the cost of weddings(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: The Climb. Writers David Benioff and Dan Weiss have based much of the third season on George RR Martin's novel A Storm of Swords, the third in the A Song of Fire and Ice series(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.sub-title: The Bear and the Maiden Fair
programme.desc: The Bear and the Maiden Fair. Tywin counsels Joffrey; Melisandre shares a secret with Gendry; Daenerys exchanges gifts with a slave lord near Yunkai; Brienne battles a formidable adversary in Harrenhal; Shae isn't happy with Tyrion's new situation; Sansa worries about her future(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: Second Sons. A wedding at King's Landing starts a new life for an unlikely couple; Davos wants proof from Melisandre; Sam and Gilly have an encounter with an older man; Daenerys meets the Titan's Bastard(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: The Rains of Castamere. Edmure meets his bride as House Tully prepares to ally itself with House Frey. Meanwhile, Jon faces the toughest test of his life; Bran finds he has a new gift; and Daario and Jorah discuss strategies for taking Yunkai(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: Mhysa. Joffrey stands up to Tywin, and Dany discovers whether she's seen as conqueror or liberator. Violence, strong language & adult themes(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: Two Swords. In the Season 4 premiere, Tyrion welcomes a surprise guest to King's Landing for the royal wedding, but fears he's come to the Red Keep for something else. Meanwhile, Jon warns his skeptical Night's Watch superiors about an impending attack; Jaime struggles to regain his status at home; Arya encounters a face from her past; and Daario Naharis discusses strategy with Daenerys on the journey to the slave city Meereen(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: The Lion and the Rose. While Joffrey and Margaery host a breakfast, Stannis lose his patience with Davos(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: Breaker of Chains. In the frenzied aftermath of the royal wedding, Tyrion gets a visit from a loyal subject, but wonders if anyone in his family will help him out of his current predicament. Meanwhile, Tywin offers to work for the common good with a presumed enemy; Sam takes stock of the personnel at Castle Black; the Hound gives another life lesson to Arya; and Daenerys makes a decision outside the walls of Meereen(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: Oathkeeper. Jon welcomes volunteers; Bran, Jojen, Meera and Hodor seek shelter; Jaime and Brienne discuss his honour; Daenerys balances justice and mercy(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: First of His Name. Jon starts a new mission; Cersei and Tywin consider the next move for the Crown; Daenerys makes plans for the future after hearing the latest news from King's Landing; Baelish and Sansa reach their destination(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.sub-title: The Laws of Gods and Men
programme.desc: The Laws of Gods and Men. Tyrion faces his father in the throne room; Stannis and Davos put their faith in a new strategy; Daenerys' sphere of influence expands(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: Mockingbird. Brienne follows a new lead on the road with Podrick; Tyrion finds a surprising ally; Jon's warnings about the Wall's weaknesses are ignored; Daenerys mulls giving Daario a longer leash(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: The Mountain and the Viper. A verdict is reached on Tyrion's fate after a battle between Oberyn Martell and Sandor "The Mountain" Clegane. Meanwhile, Daenerys learns unsettling news about Jorah's past; unexpected visitors arrive in Mole's Town; and Reek assumes his former identity(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: The Watchers on the Wall. The Night's Watch are confronted with the most dangerous challenge to Castle Black ever seen, as Wildlings attack the ancient fortress from both sides of the Wall(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: The Children. In the Season 4 finale, Daenerys must face harsh realities; Bran learns more about his destiny; Tyrion sees the truth of his situation; and circumstances north of the Wall are altered by an unexpected arrival(n)

programme.title: X-Men: Apocalypse

Meanwhile, Tyrion is given new responsibilities to which he is decidedly unsuited; the Night's Watch Rangers retreat to a familiar place; Jon and Mance Rayder examine the carnage at the Fist of the First Men; and Catelyn says good-bye to her father(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.sub-title: And Now His Watch Has Ended
programme.desc: And Now His Watch Has Ended. Frayed nerves and empty stomachs test the mettle of a depleted Night's Watch at Craster's. Meanwhile, Margaery takes Joffrey out of his comfort zone, and gives Sansa a glimpse of the future; Arya meets the leader of the Brotherhood; Varys plots revenge on an old foe; Theon mournfully recalls his missteps; and Daenerys deftly orchestrates her exit from Astapor(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: Kissed by Fire. The gods judge the Hound, but men pass their judgment on Jaime. Meanwhile, Jon passes a crucial test; Robb is betrayed; and Tyrion learns the cost of weddings(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: The Climb. Writers David Benioff and Dan Weiss have based much of the third season on George RR Martin's novel A Storm of Swords, the third in the A Song of Fire and Ice series(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.sub-title: The Bear and the Maiden Fair
programme.desc: The Bear and the Maiden Fair. Tywin counsels Joffrey; Melisandre shares a secret with Gendry; Daenerys exchanges gifts with a slave lord near Yunkai; Brienne battles a formidable adversary in Harrenhal; Shae isn't happy with Tyrion's new situation; Sansa worries about her future(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: Second Sons. A wedding at King's Landing starts a new life for an unlikely couple; Davos wants proof from Melisandre; Sam and Gilly have an encounter with an older man; Daenerys meets the Titan's Bastard(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: The Rains of Castamere. Edmure meets his bride as House Tully prepares to ally itself with House Frey. Meanwhile, Jon faces the toughest test of his life; Bran finds he has a new gift; and Daario and Jorah discuss strategies for taking Yunkai(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: Mhysa. Joffrey stands up to Tywin, and Dany discovers whether she's seen as conqueror or liberator. Violence, strong language & adult themes(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: Two Swords. In the Season 4 premiere, Tyrion welcomes a surprise guest to King's Landing for the royal wedding, but fears he's come to the Red Keep for something else. Meanwhile, Jon warns his skeptical Night's Watch superiors about an impending attack; Jaime struggles to regain his status at home; Arya encounters a face from her past; and Daario Naharis discusses strategy with Daenerys on the journey to the slave city Meereen(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: The Lion and the Rose. While Joffrey and Margaery host a breakfast, Stannis lose his patience with Davos(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: Breaker of Chains. In the frenzied aftermath of the royal wedding, Tyrion gets a visit from a loyal subject, but wonders if anyone in his family will help him out of his current predicament. Meanwhile, Tywin offers to work for the common good with a presumed enemy; Sam takes stock of the personnel at Castle Black; the Hound gives another life lesson to Arya; and Daenerys makes a decision outside the walls of Meereen(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: Oathkeeper. Jon welcomes volunteers; Bran, Jojen, Meera and Hodor seek shelter; Jaime and Brienne discuss his honour; Daenerys balances justice and mercy(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: First of His Name. Jon starts a new mission; Cersei and Tywin consider the next move for the Crown; Daenerys makes plans for the future after hearing the latest news from King's Landing; Baelish and Sansa reach their destination(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.sub-title: The Laws of Gods and Men
programme.desc: The Laws of Gods and Men. Tyrion faces his father in the throne room; Stannis and Davos put their faith in a new strategy; Daenerys' sphere of influence expands(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: Mockingbird. Brienne follows a new lead on the road with Podrick; Tyrion finds a surprising ally; Jon's warnings about the Wall's weaknesses are ignored; Daenerys mulls giving Daario a longer leash(n)

programme.title: Welcome Home Roscoe Jenkins
programme.desc: A successful talk show host leaves Los Angeles to reunite with his family in the Deep South(n)

programme.title: Jim Jefferies: I Swear to God
programme.desc: Aussie stand-up comedian Jim Jefferies offers audiences his trademark confrontational persona in his first solo television event(n)

programme.title: Immigration Tango
programme.desc: In this clever comedy, romantic complications ensue when an immigrant couple (Elika Portnoy, Carlos Leon) get quickie marriages with their two best friends (Ashley Wolfe, McCaleb Burnett) in order to obtain permanent residency in the United States(n)

programme.title: Ernest Scared Stupid
programme.desc: Ernest gets into deep trouble when he decides to build a treehouse for the neighborhood kid and accidentally digs up an ugly, evil-tempered troll who hates all children and shows it by promptly turning the five kids helping Ernest into wooden sculptures(n)

programme.title: Grumpier Old Men
programme.desc: Things don't seem to change much in Wabasha County: Max and John are still fighting after 35 years, Grandpa still drinks, smokes, and chases women, and nobody's been able to catch the fabled "Catfish Hunter", a gigantic catfish that actually smiles at fishermen who try to snare it. Six months ago John married the new girl in town (Ariel), and people begin to suspect that Max might be missing something similar in his life. The only joy Max claims is left in his life is fishing, but that might change with the new owner of the bait shop(n)

programme.title: Michael
programme.desc: Two journalists, along with a self-proclaimed 'angel expert' are sent to Iowa to investigate a claim that an angel is living in a motel. They arrive to find the claim is true, but angel Michael is nothing like they expected. He smokes, drinks and loves the ladies. He agrees to travel to Chicago with the journalists, a decision that changes all their lives(n)

programme.title: Rush Hour 3
programme.desc: Brett Ratner's martial-arts action-comedy sequel starring Chris Tucker and Jackie Chan. When the Chinese Ambassador to the US is shot while in the act of divulging the whereabouts of a major Triad leader, the American authorities once more send Chief Inspector Lee and Detective James Carter into the fray. Lee quickly corners the would-be assassin, Kenji, but the shock of coming face-to-face with an old friend gives the baddie just enough time to escape. Kenji's trail leads the mismatched cops to Paris, where car chases and a sequence among the under-dressed dancers of the Folies Bergère await them, plus rather a lot of dodgy French stereotypes and a finale atop the Eiffel Tower(n)

programme.title: Bridget Jones: The Edge of Reason
programme.desc: Bridget worries about her relationship with Darcy and is upset when work reunites her with the womanising Daniel, in this sequel to "Bridget Jones's Diary"(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons Movie
programme.desc: Big-screen animated adventures of the cartoon characters from the TV series. Homer triggers an environmental calamity in Springfield that has far-reaching effects for the town and the planet(n)

programme.title: Mamma Mia!
programme.desc: Donna, an independent, single mother who owns a small hotel on an idyllic Greek island, is about to let go of Sophie, the spirited daughter she's raised alone. For Sophie's wedding, Donna has invited her two lifelong best girlfriends--practical and no-nonsense Rosie and wealthy, multi-divorcee Tonya--from her one-time backing band, Donna and the Dynamos. But Sophie has secretly invited three guests of her own(n)

programme.title: Hollywood Ending
programme.desc: A witty script and a great ensemble cast add up to one of Woody Allen's most hilarious farces. Allen wrote, directed and stars as a washed-up filmmaker who is suddenly stricken with psychosomatic blindness on the eve of his big comeback(n)

programme.title: Rush Hour 3
programme.desc: Brett Ratner's martial-arts action-comedy sequel starring Chris Tucker and Jackie Chan. When the Chinese Ambassador to the US is shot while in the act of divulging the whereabouts of a major Triad leader, the American authorities once more send Chief Inspector Lee and Detective James Carter into the fray. Lee quickly corners the would-be assassin, Kenji, but the shock of coming face-to-face with an old friend gives the baddie just enough time to escape. Kenji's trail leads the mismatched cops to Paris, where car chases and a sequence among the under-dressed dancers of the Folies Bergère await them, plus rather a lot of dodgy French stereotypes and a finale atop the Eiffel Tower(n)

programme.title: Keanu
programme.desc: Two straight-laced friends pose as drug dealers and try their best -- and sometimes fail -- to fit in with the thug circle in order to retrieve a stolen kitten(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons Movie
programme.desc: Big-screen animated adventures of the cartoon characters from the TV series. Homer triggers an environmental calamity in Springfield that has far-reaching effects for the town and the planet(n)

programme.title: Mafia!
programme.desc: Jay Mohr and Lloyd Bridges (in his last role) star in this parody of the "Godfather" trilogy. The story centers on a powerful Mafia family, targeted by rivals who can't wait to see the aging Don (Bridges) and his potential successor out of the way of their glorious plans for the future of organized crime. Christina Applegate, Olympia Dukakis, Billy Burke, Pamela Gidley(n)

programme.title: The Good Guy
programme.desc: This fun-loving romantic comedy follows a young New Yorker (Alexis Bledel) as she searches for the perfect man. A Wall Street big shot (Scott Porter) seems like the real deal, until she meets his handsome coworker (Bryan Greenberg) and comes to realize love is as big of a gamble as the stock market(n)

programme.title: Legal Eagles
programme.desc: A District Attorney and a lawyer become romantically involved as they team up to defend a spaced-out art theft suspect turned murder suspect(n)

programme.title: I-Spy
programme.desc: CIA agent Alex Scott is teamed with an unlikely partner for a secret mission in Budapest to recover a superplane: loud-mouthed boxing champ Kelly Robinson. Spy comedy(n)

programme.title: Wildcats
programme.desc: Inspiration 80s style as teacher Molly McGrath's incessant requests to coach finally force the authorities to give her a chance. Molly becomes the only woman in the mens' locker room, but her new squad of rebels are the worst team in the league..(n)

programme.title: Sister Act
programme.desc: Whoopi Goldberg stars in Emile Ardolino's comedy thriller as Deloris Van Cartier, a lounge singer at a casino managed by her lover Vince LaRocca. He's also a drugs baron and when she accidentally interrupts him in the process of rubbing out a stool pigeon, she has to run for her life. To keep her safe until LaRocca can be charged, the police arrange for her to become Sister Mary Clarence at a nunnery overseen by stern Mother Superior. But you can't keep a good singer down and Sister Mary has soon so successfully invigorated the choir with her musical talent that the church is packed - and there is even a call from Rome for a Papal performance. Unfortunately, thanks to an inside man in the police department, LaRocca learns of her whereabouts and sets out to prevent her testifying; can her new found friends, the nuns, protect her?(n)

programme.title: Be Kind Rewind
programme.desc: Two bumbling store clerks inadvertently erase the footage from all of the tapes in their video rental store. In order to keep the business running, they re-shoot every film in the store with their own camera, with a budget of zero dollars(n)

programme.title: Just Married
programme.desc: Ashton Kutcher and Brittany Murphy are a chalk-and-cheese couple who fall in love and marry. Now, all they need for the union to work is to survive both families who disapprove of the match, deal with the well-meaning friends who meddle too much and, on their honeymoon, suffer a selection of Europe's worst accommodation. Shawn Levy's romantic comedy, although occasionally succumbing to America's view of Europe, is held together by the two leads, particularly Murphy's unexpected gift for comedy(n)

programme.title: Serendipity
programme.desc: John Cusack and Kate Beckinsale decide to let fate be their guide in this charming comedy about a man and woman who share an undeniable attraction when they meet, but concoct a series of experiments to determine if they are truly meant for each other. Jeremy Piven, Molly Shannon, John Corbett, Bridget Moynahan, Eugene Levy(n)

programme.title: War Dogs
programme.desc: In this comedy-drama based on true events, a down-on-his-luck massage therapist living in Miami (Miles Teller) teams up with a mercurial former classmate (Jonah Hill) to try to make it in the arms-dealing business. After starting small, the pals eventually get in over their heads when they land a 300-million-dollar contract with the U.S. government to supply weaponry for forces in Afghanistan. Directed by Todd Phillips(n)

programme.desc: A CIA assassin asks a former high-school classmate, now an accountant, for his help in saving the world(n)

Now the neighbors will have to save her if they are to save themselves from whatever is after her. M. Night Shyamalan works his Academy Award-nominated, spellbinding craftsmanship into an unexpected story that features mesmerizing images, not to mention a breathtaking cast: Bryce Dallas Howard, Paul Giamatti, Jeffrey Wright and Sarita Choudhury(n)

He gently rests it on a clover flower, and searches for a place where it will be safe from the perils of the larger world. Establishing contact with Whoville's befuddled mayor, Horton faces disbelief from his animal friends..(n)

programme.desc: Two years after saving the world with the Autobots, Sam Witwicky is heading off to college when an ancient Decepticon named The Fallen returns to Earth seeking revenge. Their home planet of Cybertron rendered uninhabitable, the Autobots begin working with the military to hunt down any remaining Decepticons. programme.title: Robin Hood: Men in Tights
programme.desc: A parody of the much-done medieval English tale of Robin Hood and his Merry Men, ROBIN HOOD: MEN IN TIGHTS also directly lampoons the politically correct ROBIN HOOD: PRINCE OF THIEVES, which starred the hearthrob of the time, the very un-British Kevin Costner. English hearthrob Cary Elwes gets a turn in the role of the hero of Sherwood Forest who robs from the rich to give to the poor when he returns from the Crusades to find his beloved King Richard usurped by the evil Prince John..(n)

programme.title: Next Friday
programme.desc: Hilarious follow up to Friday. Now it's Next Friday and Craig is still living with his parents in South Central Los Angeles while looking for a job and remembering his moment of glory four years earlier, when he finally beat local bully, Debo . But now Debo has escaped from prison and is looking to exact revenge on Craig. Craig's dad takes him to Rancho Cucamonga to hide out with his Uncle Elroy and cousin Day-Day, who have moved to the suburbs after winning the lottery. But once he gets there, Craig and his cousin have a string of suburban adventures that make his South Central experiences look tame(n)

programme.title: Now You See Me 2
programme.desc: In this sequel, the illusionists known as the Four Horsemen (Jesse Eisenberg, Woody Harrelson, Lizzy Caplan, and Dave Franco) return to perform a spectacular stunt in the hopes of clearing their names and exposing the unscrupulous behavior of a tech mogul named Walter Mabry (Daniel Radcliffe). However, Mabry soon turns the tables, and forces the group to steal a revolutionary decrypting device for him. Directed by Jon M. Chu (G.I. Joe: Retaliation)(n)

programme.title: Clockers
programme.desc: A small-time pusher drags his clean-living brother into his world of cops and crime. Strike commits murder to impress his dealer boss, convincing his sibling to take the rap. But cop Rocco Klein smells a rat. New York drama(n)

programme.title: Batman: The Killing Joke
programme.desc: After The Joker escapes Batman tries to track him down, but The Joker is also after the Gordons in an effort to prove a point(n)

programme.title: Batman Forever
programme.desc: The Caped Crusader and his new partner Robin do battle with DA Harvey Dent and vengeful scientist The Riddler(n)

programme.title: The Bodyguard
programme.desc: 1992 blockbuster starring Whitney Houston and Kevin Costner - as a singer superstar and her bodyguard who fall in love. Houston hires Costner when she starts receiving death threats from a stalker. The ex-presidential bodyguard has a past, however. He is wracked by guilt over his inability to protect Reagan from John Hinckley's assassination attempt. He's certainly not going to let a bullet slip past himagain and the draconian security measures he sets up are a shock to Houston. But Costner proves his worth when, in the face of death threats, the singer gives the performance of her life at the Oscar ceremony. Houston brings the house down with her performance of the Dolly Parton song 'I Will Always Love You'(n)

programme.title: Crimson Peak
programme.desc: In this terrifying gothic romance, a mysterious stranger woos a young woman and brings her to his mansion atop a clay mountain. There, she learns that her new home holds many disturbing secrets as she fights for her sanity and her very life(n)

programme.title: The Birth of a Nation

programme.title: The Order
programme.desc: Brian Helgeland's religious thriller stars Heath Ledger as Alex Bernier, a young Catholic priest who adheres to a rare form of the faith. When he learns of the strange death of his mentor, he travels to Rome with his fellow priest Thomas Garrett and savant Mara Sinclair - a woman who once tried to kill him during an exorcism - to investigate the mystery. Brian Helgeland's religious thriller stars Heath Ledger as Alex Bernier, a young Catholic priest who adheres to a rare form of the faith. When he learns of the strange death of his mentor, he travels to Rome with his fellow priest Thomas Garrett and savant Mara Sinclair - a woman who once tried to kill him during an exorcism - to investigate the mystery. What he finds is the truth behind the myth of the Sin Eater, an immortal figure who takes on the sins of the damned to ensure their passage into Heaven. But with immortality comes both spiritual and temporal corruption, as Bernier battles both the church and demons to uncover the secrets of the Sin Eater. The film reunited the director with the stars of his film A Knight's Tale and also stars Benno Fürmann and Peter Weller(n)

programme.title: Phone Booth
programme.desc: Selfish publicist Stu Shepherd answers a ringing phone in the street. Not only does the man on the line know his name, but he's also got a sniper's rifle pointed directly at Stu. Thriller(n)

programme.title: The League of Extraordinary Gentlemen
programme.desc: Sean Connery is the adventurer who joins Captain Nemo, the Invisible Man, Dorian Gray and other fictional heroes to save the world. FX-packed comic book action(n)

programme.title: The Assassination of Jesse James by the Coward Robert Ford
programme.desc: Writer-director Andrew Dominik's thoughtful, elegiac saga is a dead-on throwback to classic Westerns of yore. Brad Pitt gives a bang-up performance as the notorious outlaw living out his final days in 1882 before being gunned down by a member of his gang (Casey Affleck). Features a cameo by political pundit James Carville as Governor Crittenden and rocker Nick Cave as a saloon singer. Cave also co-wrote the score. Actor-playwright Sam Shepard costars as Jesse's brother Frank(n)

Jennifer Lopez, Anthony's real-life wife, costars as his spouse, and the cinematic sparks fly when the two are onscreen. Lopez also served as producer. Directed by Leon Ichaso, who co-wrote the script with David Darmstaedter and Todd Anthony Bello. John Ortiz, Manny Perez, Federico Castelluccio, Vincent Laresca, Romi Diaz(n)

programme.title: The Sweetest Thing
programme.desc: To ease their roommate through a relationship-induced depression, Christina Walters and Courtney Rockcliffe take her out on the town. Missing her opportunity with him that night, Christina Walters is talked into pursuing him to his brother's wedding. programme.desc: Style Battle in St. Petersburg, Florida. A St. Petersburg, Fla., couple who are trading in their townhouse for a new home can't seem to agree on style or location. While he's hoping to find a Colonial near the downtown area, she's looking for something more contemporary in the surrounding area(n)

programme.title: House Hunters
programme.sub-title: Brooklynites Seek Lakeside Weekend Home Near NYC
programme.desc: Brooklynites Seek Lakeside Weekend Home Near NYC. A Brooklyn couple look for a weekend home in Greenwood Lake, which is an hour north of New York City. Among the challenges they face in their house hunt is coming to an agreement about whether to find a log cabin or a contemporary ranch(n)

programme.title: House Hunters
programme.sub-title: Victorian vs. Ranch Style Homes in Davis, California
programme.desc: Victorian vs. Ranch Style Homes in Davis, California. A new job brings a young couple to Davis, Cal., where they favor different house styles and consider living close to downtown in order to take advantage of a bike-friendly ride to work(n)

programme.title: Lakefront Bargain Hunt
programme.sub-title: Kicking Back on Indiana's Koontz Lake
programme.desc: Kicking Back on Indiana's Koontz Lake. A couple hopes to find the perfect vacation home in Indiana for under $399,000 with the help of a real-estate agent. Chris and Jim from Palos Heights, Illinois, both grew up spending time on the water. They've brought their three daughters to Paw Paw Lake, Michigan, every summer, hoping to provide them with similar childhood memories and now want a home in nearby Koontz Lake(n)

programme.title: Lakefront Bargain Hunt
programme.sub-title: Taking a Look at Innsbrook, Missouri
programme.desc: Taking a Look at Innsbrook, Missouri. Greg and Lisa are siblings from Godfrey, Illinois, and are looking to purchase a lakefront home with their families in the gated community of Innsbrook, Missouri. While their spouses and Lisa are on board, Greg is still a little hesitant that this would be a practical purchase for their families, so they go to Innsbrook to convince Greg that this will be the perfect place for a vacation home. With a real estate agent's help, they hope to find the perfect lakeside property for under $250,000(n)

programme.title: Beach Hunters
programme.desc: Florida Gulf Coast Dream Home. After many years of renting vacation houses in Perdido Key, Florida, a Georgia couple can finally afford their dream home in this relaxing haven on the Gulf of Mexico. With their kids grown and out of the house, these two are prepared to spend a lot to get a house that is directly on the water and large enough to accommodate their constantly growing family(n)

programme.title: Columbo
programme.desc: Playback. Playback is a 2-hour Columbo episode, guest-starring Oskar Werner in his American TV series debut. Werner plays an electronics expert who installs TV cameras in every room of his mansion. Even so, he manages to bump off his mother-in-law without leaving a clue. That's the cue for Lt. Columbo (Peter Falk) to lurch into the scene. Playback was first broadcast on March 2, 1975(n)
