programme.sub-title: Mr. Monk and the Garbage Strike
programme.desc: Mr. Monk and the Garbage Strike. A city-wide garbage strike throws Monk completely off his game as he tries to solve the murder of a union boss(n)

programme.title: Monk
programme.sub-title: Mr. Monk and the Big Game
programme.desc: Mr. Monk and the Big Game. Adrian Monk is a highly gifted detective whose career is jeopardised by his overwhelming fear of germs, crowds, small places, and almost everything else..(n)

programme.title: Monk
programme.sub-title: Mr. Monk Can't See a Thing
programme.desc: Mr. Monk Can't See a Thing. While visiting his elderly friend Rusty (Art Evans) at his neighborhood firehouse, Monk (Tony Shalhoub) is blinded by the same intruder who kills Rusty. Despite facing the probability of permanent sightlessness, Monk insists upon solving the old man's murder, using his previously unexploited "sixth sense" to harvest clues. It turns out that there is a connection between Rusty's missing coat and helmet, and another fire that occurred at the same time as the murder. In a fit of hubris (he actually seems to thrive on being blind), Monk not only captures the killer, but also figures out that the culprit didn't act alone...and that there's a lot more to the story than a mere murder(n)

programme.title: Monk
programme.desc: Mr. Monk, Private Eye. Natalie persuades Adrian to become a full-time private eye, but his first case seems disappointingly trivial - until it leads him into a far more dangerous investigation culminating in a high-speed boat chase at sea(n)

programme.title: Monk
programme.sub-title: Mr. Monk and the Class Reunion
programme.desc: Mr. Monk and the Class Reunion. Monk attends his 25-year college reunion, where he has fond memories of meeting Trudy, but he also has other business to attend to: keeping a former classmate from being murdered. Cynthia Stevenson guest stars(n)

programme.title: Monk
programme.sub-title: Mr. Monk Gets a New Shrink
programme.desc: Mr. Monk Gets a New Shrink. Monk's overworked therapist retires after the murder of his cleaning lady, which puts the defective detective in a tight spot. When he can't bear to find a replacement shrink, he works hard to solve the crime(n)

programme.title: Monk
programme.sub-title: Mr. Monk Goes to a Rock Concert
programme.desc: Mr. Monk Goes to a Rock Concert. Adrian Monk is a highly gifted detective whose career is jeopardised by his overwhelming fear of germs, crowds, small places, and almost everything else..(n)

programme.title: Monk
programme.desc: Mr. Monk Meets His Dad. At Christmastime, Monk (Tony Shalhoub) is reunited with his long-lost father Jack (Dan Hedaya), an itinerant truck driver--and as if this wasn't enough of a jolt to his senses, our hero discovers that he has a half-brother named Junior. In the spirit of bonding, Monk accompanies Jack, who has been hired to deliver free toys on behalf of his otherwise Scrooge-like boss, on a road trip throughout the American Southwest. It soon develops that Jack is palming off some very shoddy merchandise to a lot of extremely disappointed youngsters--and a subsequent murder proves beyond doubt that there are even more unsavory aspects to his current assignment(n)

programme.title: Monk
programme.desc: Mr. Monk and the Leper. Monk becomes embroiled in a complex case after he agrees to meet with a mysterious millionaire who was presumed dead. The man, who has leprosy, offers Monk a lot of money to retrieve some incriminating love letters. Derek Bronson: Stephen Bogardus. Mandy Bronson: Sarah Brown(n)

programme.title: Monk
programme.desc: Mr. Monk Makes a Friend. Monk is positively giddy when he makes a new friend, but Natalie and the others are convinced that the overly amiable guy isn't what he seems(n)

programme.title: Monk
programme.sub-title: Mr. Monk Is at Your Service
programme.desc: Mr. Monk Is at Your Service. An arrogant killer makes the mistake of hiring Monk to be his new butler, unaware he is working undercover at Natalie's request in a bid to solve the murder of a wealthy couple(n)

programme.title: Monk
programme.sub-title: Mr. Monk Is on the Air
programme.desc: Mr. Monk Is on the Air. A shock jock's wife is killed while the man is on the air, but that doesn't stop Monk from suspecting the radio personality of murder. Steven Weber and Heather Tom guest star(n)

programme.title: Monk
programme.desc: Mr. Monk Visits a Farm. Lt. Disher (Jason Gray-Stanford) retires from the force when he inherits a farm from his late uncle Harvey. It isn't long before Disher begins to suspect that his uncle was murdered--along with his prize pig Harvey. Though he recoils at the notion of being stranded on a dusty, dirty farm with dozens of unsanitary animals, Monk swallows hard and agrees to investigate Harvey's death, disguising himself as a migrant worker for the purpose. Aided and abetted by the local constabulary and a friendly farmhand named Oates (James Gammon), Monk is soon harvesting clues left and right--especially the fact that the farm's principal "crop" is of an extremely high value indeed(n)

programme.title: Love's Everlasting Courage
programme.desc: Two sisters labor to keep up their family farm following the death of their father, and find their lives transformed by a kindly stranger they hire as a farmhand. When Ellen (Julie Mond) and Cassie Barlow lost their father, it seemed as if their world might simply fall apart. Then, one day, Clark Davis (Wes Brown) was passing through town on his way to California when a sudden spot of trouble left him drowning in debt. Sympathetic, Ellen hires Clark to work on the farm until he gets back on his feet. But the longer Clark labors on the farm, the closer that he and Ellen become. In time, their relationship blossoms into romance, offering both a chance to start a fulfilling new life together(n)

programme.title: Love's Long Journey
programme.desc: Embarking on their new life together, Missie and Willie follow wagons west stopping to set up a homestead on the land he purchased four years earlier. Willie assembles a group of misfit ranch hands to help him, while the pregnant Missie befriends their Shoshoni neighbors. But for all their perseverance and prayer, forging a new life in a new world becomes a test of faith and fortitude that pushes their endurance, as violent unrest in the outlying foothills threatens the peace of Tettsford Junction and Missie and Willie's future(n)

programme.title: The Three Stooges
programme.desc: Mummy's Dummies. This time we're in ancient Egypt, where the Three Stooges own a used-chariot dealership ("I'm Honest Moe, he's Honest Shemp, and that's...that's Larry"). When they bamboozle the Captain of the Royal Guard (Ralph Dunn) out of 400 shekels for a defective chariot, the Stooges are arrested and brought before the mighty King Rootentooten (Vernon Dent). Sentenced to be thrown to the crocodiles, the boys save themselves by curing the King's toothache, whereupon they are appointed Royal Chamberlains--and in this capacity, our heroes expose a crooked tax collector (Philip Van Zandt). Highlights include Shemp's disguise as the mummy of the late, great King Put-n-take-it(n)

programme.title: Predator
programme.desc: John McTiernan's cult sci-fi actioner stars Arnold Schwarzennegger as Major Dutch Schaefer, leader of an elite commando unit sent into the jungles of South America to rescue government officials who have been kidnapped by terrorists. But as the group make their way into the jungle they realise they have been misled on the mission as they discover the mutilated bodies of the terrorists. But, as they endeavour to return home, somebody, or something, pursues them. As his group starts being wiped out one by one, Dutch realises he is up against a warrior not of this world - one equipped with superior weapons and strength and invisibility. In the end, the battle comes down to mano a mano as the two face off, as the invisible Predator finally reveals his true self(n)

programme.title: Predator 2
programme.desc: The predator is back, now hunting the streets of Los Angeles for his prey. This time the alien has decided to take the feuding drug-dealing gangsters who are threatening to overrun the city as trophies, but when he starts taking out the police as well, tough cop Danny Glover and partners Ruben Blades and Maria Conchita Alonso set on its trail. But they must also contend with special agent Gary Busey, who seems to know what happened to a mercenary patrol in the South American jungle..(n)

programme.title: RoboCop

programme.title: Planet of the Apes

programme.desc: Ted Post's sequel to the first in the successful series continues the story of Earth in a future where apes have traded places with humans. Charlton Heston and James Franciscus star as Taylor and Brent, the time-travelling astronauts caught up in the action, which sees militant apes pitted against renegade humans in the underground ruins of New York City(n)

programme.title: Escape From the Planet of the Apes
programme.desc: Talking simians travel through time and land in 1970s L.A., where they are treated as celebrities, then as threats to humanity(n)

programme.desc: When cats and dogs are wiped out by a mysterious disease, apes take their place as pets. But when their human masters become increasingly oppressive, rebellion stirs. Fourth in the 'Ape' series, followed by 'Battle for the Planet of the Apes'(n)

programme.title: Battle for the Planet of the Apes

programme.desc: James Woods takes viewers behind the scenes at the Family Guy studios to offer a peek at a production week of the series to see what goes into the making of the show.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Stewie sets off for England to take refuge in his favourite TV show, but ends up taking a detour to Saudi Arabia. Meanwhile, Lois embarrasses Peter at a concert. With the guest voices of rock band Kiss.(n)

programme.title: Judge Judy
programme.desc: Real-life small-claims cases on issues affecting family life, presided over by outspoken former New York judge Judy Sheindlin.(n)

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: The discovery of a body in Jessica's garage leads to all manner of accusations, prompting her to embark on a determined quest to unmask the killer. Angela Lansbury stars alongside Ron Masak.(n)

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: Jessica hits the road to promote a new book club, but promptly finds herself plunged into a messy case involving plagiarism, blackmail and murder. Angela Lansbury stars, with a guest appearance by Ian Ogilvy.(n)

programme.title: The Darling Buds of May
programme.sub-title: A Breath of French Air - Part One.
programme.desc: Part one of two. Dispirited by a wet English summer, the Larkins cross the Channel in the hope that the French way of life will have a beneficial effect on the family. David Jason, Pam Ferris and Catherine Zeta-Jones star.(n)

programme.title: The Sign of Four
programme.desc: A governess engages Sherlock Holmes to uncover the identity of a mysterious stranger who has been sending her priceless gifts over a number of years - and his investigations eventually lead him to a sinister plot. Adaptation of Conan Doyle's mystery, starring Matt Frewer, Kenneth Welsh and Sophie Lorain.(n)

programme.title: Inspector Morse
programme.desc: The father of a missing schoolgirl demands action, angry that a six-month investigation has failed to uncover any leads. Morse ends up being assigned the case - and discovers some unpleasant truths about her family and teachers during the course of his inquiries. John Thaw stars as the Oxford detective, with Kevin Whately, Peter Woodthorpe, Peter McEnery, Elizabeth Hurley and Frances Tomelty.(n)

programme.title: Hans Christian Andersen: My Life as a Fairy Tale
programme.desc: Part one of two. The rags-to-riches tale of the storyteller's life, giving an insight into the people who inspired his fantasy world. Drama, starring Kieran Bew, James Fox, Simon Callow, Emily Hamilton, Geraldine James and Alison Steadman.(n)

programme.title: Wycliffe
programme.desc: A comatose surfer is washed ashore in what seems to have been a freak accident, until sinister facts emerge and Wycliffe is called in. It is not long before the team uncovers a conspiracy - but the case is hindered by a leak to the Press that threatens not only the investigation but also DI Lane's career. Jack Shepherd, Helen Masters and Jimmy Yuill star.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Marple
programme.desc: Ever since a beautiful American woman arrived in the peaceful village of Wychwood-under-Ashe, people have begun to die in a series of apparent accidents. Nobody suspects a killer is at work but, as the body count rises, Miss Marple digs a little deeper with the help of a former policeman - and they gradually unearth a secret that will rock the village to its core. Murder mystery, starring Julia McKenzie, Benedict Cumberbatch, David Haig, Sylvia Syms, Margo Stilley and Hugo Speer.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Marple
programme.desc: A gathering at the Devon estate of Miss Marple's old school friend Lady Tressilian leads to murder when the eccentric Mr Treves tells the story of an unconvicted child killer. Miss Marple is on hand to assist Supt Mallard of the local constabulary, but not before a second victim is claimed. Mystery, starring Geraldine McEwan, with guest appearances by Eileen Atkins, Tom Baker, Paul Nicholls, Alan Davies and Greg Wise, with a cameo by former British number-one tennis player Greg Rusedski.(n)

programme.title: Foyle's War
programme.desc: A crackdown on an organised crime racket leads Foyle and Milner to a shipyard owned by the Talbot brothers, a duo with dubious links to a communist agitator who has recently moved to the area. When an engineer is murdered just hours after working at the shipyard, the detectives desperately try to track down the killer and discover the truth surrounding the Talbots' shady business dealings. Peter Capaldi guest stars in the wartime drama, with Michael Kitchen, Anthony Howell and Honeysuckle Weeks.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: UK
programme.desc: Part two of two. Sam is suspended from duty and decides to spend some time with his son, while Brooks and Leyton make a breakthrough when they discover who was responsible for the train crash and put the culprit under surveillance. Jake and Kate argue over whether it was right to prosecute Finn Tyler in his fragile mental state. Drama, starring Paul Nicholls and Bradley Walsh.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: UK
programme.desc: A man is found shot dead in a hotel room and the cash he was carrying has gone missing. Ronnie and Sam discover the victim owed his ex-wife thousands of pounds in child support for their terminally ill son and had been lying to his girlfriend about his line of work. As the investigation progresses, the detectives focus their inquiries on the child's grandfather. Did he commit murder to recoup the unpaid money or is there more to this family set-up than first appears? Meanwhile, at the Crown Prosecution Service, Kate and Jake work out their differences. Guest starring Ian Bleasdale (Casualty).(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: UK
programme.desc: Ronnie and Sam lead the investigation into the death of a wealthy woman whose body was dumped in the Thames. The team initially focuses inquiries on the victim's abusive ex-husband, with whom she had been involved in a bitter struggle over custody of their daughter Holly, but the case heads in a different direction when the detectives discover the teenager was infatuated with her mother's new partner. With Patrick Baladi and an appearance by Bradley Walsh's son Barney.(n)

programme.title: ITV3 Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.(n)

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Buying goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: George and Mildred
programme.desc: The Ropers suffer a domestic crisis when Mildred discovers George has been writing to another woman. Comedy, starring Brian Murphy and Yootha Joyce.(n)

programme.title: Hans Christian Andersen: My Life as a Fairy Tale
programme.desc: Part one of two. The rags-to-riches tale of the storyteller's life, giving an insight into the people who inspired his fantasy world. Drama, starring Kieran Bew, James Fox, Simon Callow, Emily Hamilton, Geraldine James and Alison Steadman.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Sgt Merton finds himself under pressure when teenagers commit serious offences in the area and must race to stop a planned `chicken run' with stolen cars. The youngsters are also suspected of drug dealing after Liz Merrick hands in amphetamines found in a local boy's bedroom, and Merton's investigative techniques lead Jenny to call off the wedding. Starring Duncan Bell, Sarah Tansey and Aislin McGuckin.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: PC Steve Crane takes an urgent phone call, and is shocked to discover Peter Pyke's warehouse has gone up in smoke. It soon emerges that the owner's wife had spent time behind bars for fraud, and her husband is reluctant to answer questions - leading Merton to suspect the blaze was deliberate. Meanwhile, Vernon moves into his new mansion, but has trouble keeping up with his well-to-do neighbours. Rural drama, starring James Carlton, Duncan Bell and Geoffrey Hughes.(n)

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: Jessica joins forces with a Russian detective to solve a case of art theft and murder at a book fair in Miami. Whodunit, guest starring David Ogden Stiers and Andrew Robinson.(n)

programme.title: The Darling Buds of May
programme.sub-title: A Breath of French Air - Part Two.
programme.desc: Part two of two. The family warms to the French way of life, but Charley is unhappy with Mariette's flirting - and after a little Dutch courage, decides to take matters into his own hands. Drama, starring Philip Franks and Catherine Zeta-Jones.(n)

programme.title: Bertie and Elizabeth
programme.desc: Docu-drama chronicling the marriage of Queen Elizabeth and George VI, from their first meeting in 1920 to the King's death in 1952, set against a backdrop of national events, from the abdication of George's elder brother to the Second World War. Starring Juliet Aubrey, James Wilby, Alan Bates, Eileen Atkins, Robert Hardy and Corin Redgrave.(n)

programme.title: Wycliffe
programme.desc: The Cornish detective's silver wedding celebrations are interrupted by a fresh outbreak of crime on his patch. Five dead bodies have been found on board an abandoned lorry at the ferry terminal and a fugitive is on the run. Jack Shepherd, Helen Masters and Jimmy Yuill star.(n)

programme.title: Foyle's War
programme.desc: A crackdown on an organised crime racket leads Foyle and Milner to a shipyard owned by the Talbot brothers, a duo with dubious links to a communist agitator who has recently moved to the area. When an engineer is murdered just hours after working at the shipyard, the detectives desperately try to track down the killer and discover the truth surrounding the Talbots' shady business dealings. Peter Capaldi guest stars in the wartime drama, with Michael Kitchen, Anthony Howell and Honeysuckle Weeks.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Marple
programme.desc: As the sole witness to a dying man's last words, Bobby Attfield is determined to solve the riddle they present, and forms an unlikely alliance with socialite Frankie Derwent and visiting family friend Miss Marple to help him on his quest. A trail of clues leads them to Castle Savage, where they uncover a hotbed of stifled emotion, treachery and deceit among its strange inhabitants. Murder mystery, starring Julia McKenzie, with a supporting cast that includes Sean Biggerstaff, Samantha Bond, Richard Briers, Rafe Spall, Warren Clarke, Mark Williams, Georgia Moffett, Helen Lederer and Rik Mayall.(n)

programme.title: The Booze Cruise
programme.desc: Five men set off on a shopping trip to a French hypermarket, determined to stock up on cheap champagne for a wedding, but a succession of disasters turns the journey into a nightmare. To make matters worse, cantankerous fellow traveller Maurice drives the Channel-hopping adventurers up the wall with his constant moaning, and the wives back home take full advantage of their husbands' absence. One-off comedy drama, starring Martin Clunes, Neil Pearson, Brian Murphy and Mark Benton.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: UK
programme.desc: An elderly woman is found dead in her flat after a break-in, leading Ronnie and Sam to suspect a burglary gone wrong. However, following a tip-off from the victim's grand-daughter Connie, the detectives' attention turns to live-in carer Cecile, who is promptly arrested. But the accused points the finger back at Connie, claiming she had been deliberately starving her grandmother. Who will the team believe? With Jan Francis, Daniel Casey and Ramon Tikaram.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: UK
programme.desc: Following the brutal murder of a gay man, Sam and Ronnie embark on a desperate mission to track down the victim's adoptive son, who has gone missing. The prime suspect soon emerges as the child's biological father - an alleged violent homophobe unable to stomach the idea of the youngster being brought up in a same-sex household - but was he acting alone? Guest starring Glynis Barber, with Bradley Walsh and Paul Nicholls.(n)

Plus, Chris Routledge wades through a collection of very dusty British post-war cars to find an extremely rare Crayford Capri and Alex Riley explains why now is a good time to buy a second-hand BMW E24 635.(n)

Paul Verhoeven's sci-fi thriller, starring Arnold Schwarzenegger, Rachel Ticotin and Michael Ironside.(n)

programme.title: Fierce
programme.desc: Steve Backshall travels to Guyana, home to gigantic anaconda, piranha, jaguar and other lethal predators. His adventure begins by flying 340-miles south-west from the capital Georgetown to the remote Central Rupununi rainforest. He also visits a remote stretch of the rainforest on the Mapari River, and searches for an electric eel. Aside from tracking down the bullet ant, so named because one sting feels like being shot, Steve also holds a bird-eating tarantula, and gets a rare sighting of the endangered giant river otter.(n)

However, they must work as a team to build their prize pot and stay one step ahead of the Chaser. Bradley Walsh asks the questions.(n)

programme.title: The Deer Hunter
programme.desc: The lives of three American steelworkers and their families are torn apart in the wake of the Vietnam War. After enduring horrific treatment in a prison camp during the conflict, the three friends return to their homes but struggle to readjust to normal life. Oscar-winning drama, starring Robert De Niro, Christopher Walken, Meryl Streep, John Savage and John Cazale in his last film role.(n)

programme.title: The Deer Hunter

programme.title: Peak Practice
programme.desc: Erica fears Andrew is getting too romantically involved with a doctor from a neighbouring surgery, and makes a surprise decision over his marriage proposal. However, while she's looking to the future, a dangerous legacy from the past is threatening public safety elsewhere in Cardale. Rural drama, starring Saskia Wickham and Gary Mavers.(n)

programme.title: Always and Everyone
programme.desc: The team plan a farewell party for Robert on his final day at St Vic's, but Christine is in the doldrums at the prospect of him leaving and can't bring herself to share Jack's enthusiasm for their wedding. Sam is mortified to learn James has paid off the drug dealers and their relationship is left dead in the water when his pregnant wife turns up unannounced at Robert's party. Martin Shaw, Niamh Cusack and Michael Kitchen star. Last in the series.(n)

programme.sub-title: A Case of Coincidence - Part One.
programme.desc: Part one of two. A girl's body is found in the fens and the investigation takes a complicated turn for Inspector Masters as more fatalities are reported. Keith Barron, Ronald Pickup, Caroline Bliss and Don Henderson star.(n)

programme.title: Kavanagh QC
programme.desc: A policewoman is murdered, and when a blood-soaked shoe is found in a suspect's wardrobe, it seems to be an open-and-shut case - but Kavanagh is not convinced the right man is in the dock. John Thaw stars.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Kate is confronted by a young pregnant village girl while practising as a partner with the elderly local GP. Nick takes a call saying that a flasher has been sighted on the moors. Nick Berry stars.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Greengrass attempts to turn events to his advantage when a remote farm is raided, and a visitor from London evokes bad memories. Rural police drama, starring Nick Berry and Bill Maynard.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Nick interrupts an armed robbery at the Aidensfield Arms and ends up being held hostage in the cellar with Greengrass. Meanwhile, the local newsagent is found to be selling Swedish pornography. Rural police drama, starring Nick Berry and Bill Maynard.(n)

programme.title: Upstairs, Downstairs
programme.desc: Lady Southwold, Lady Marjorie's widowed mother, and her companion Miss Hodges arrive, throwing the household into turmoil. Later, the staff below stairs are dismayed to hear that a brooch has apparently been stolen.(n)

programme.title: Robin of Sherwood
programme.desc: Prince John arrives at Sherwood with a mysterious prisoner in tow, and the outlaws hatch a plan to rescue him - little suspecting the effect he will have on Marion. Fantasy drama, starring Michael Praed.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: Captain Hastings is staying with friends when wealthy heiress Mrs Inglethorp is murdered. He calls in Hercule Poirot to help him solve the baffling crime, which has the whole household under suspicion. Whodunit, starring David Suchet as the Belgian sleuth, with Hugh Fraser, Pauline Moran, Anthony Calf and Philip Jackson.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The dapper Belgian sleuth receives several anonymous letters outlining a killer's intention to murder a succession of people in alphabetical order, prompting him to try to unmask the culprit before the body-count mounts. Crime drama based on the Agatha Christie novel, starring David Suchet, with Pippa Guard, Donald Sumpter and Miranda Forbes.(n)

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: The crime drama returns with an episode based on Ann Cleeves' recently published novel Harbour Street. Vera investigates the death of a pensioner found stabbed on a train at the height of rush hour. The case has a huge impact on Joe's home life when his daughter is named as a key witness, and he struggles to maintain a professional distance. The trail leads the team to a quiet Northumberland coastal town where clues appear to lead to one particular street - but why are the residents so reluctant to talk? Starring Brenda Blethyn, with David Leon, Sonya Cassidy, Jon Morrison and Eva Birthistle.(n)

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: The detective is called in when David Kenworthy, the son of a prominent local family, is found murdered on the beach at Whitley Bay. A witness spotted arcade owner Larry Crowe arguing with David on the night of the killing, and a search of the suspect's property uncovers a bloodied baseball bat. However, Larry has a cast-iron alibi and it's clear he wasn't the only person the victim met that night. A second death then leaves Vera facing mounting pressure to crack the case, and struggling to answer the question of why David was drawn to the seafront on the evening of his father's retirement. Brenda Blethyn stars in the murder mystery, with David Leon as her trusty sidekick Joe.(n)

programme.title: DCI Banks
programme.desc: Part one of two. Frustrated that a number of cases have been knocked back by the Crown Prosecution Service, Banks and the team are called on to investigate the murder of teenager Ellie Clayton, daughter of a high-profile internet entrepreneur. The victim's background, together with the suggestion she may have been raped, means the incident is soon the subject of much media speculation, and strong evidence implicates a theatre director who ran a drama workshop the girl attended on the night she died. The detective believes he has found his man, but Morton fears her colleague isn't seeing the bigger picture.(n)

programme.title: DCI Banks
programme.desc: Part two of two. The collapse of Owen Pierce's trial has left the case wide open and there's still a killer on the loose, but Banks remains determined to build a watertight legal case against his prime suspect. As the investigation continues, Morton and Jackman uncover promising new leads focusing on Ellie's ex-boyfriend Tyler, but just as they seem to be getting close to the truth, another schoolgirl is murdered, putting Pierce in the spotlight once again.(n)

programme.title: The Level
programme.desc: Nancy's personal and professional lives collide when she sees a connection between her mother and the missing truck, as the full extent of Frank's monstrous crimes becomes clear, and she is forced to operate outside the law to prove her case against Nash. Hayley is let down by her ex-husband, leading Quinn to offer some much-needed comfort that provides food for thought, while Cherie doesn't seem to want to face the truth when Hayley asks her some probing questions. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Mr Selfridge
programme.desc: While Harry pursues a new charitable project, Crabb is faced with a professional dilemma. The biggest fashion event in store since the end of the war proves a challenge for the staff, and an exclusive contract with the famous Parisian brand of Lanvin hangs in the balance. As Rosalie begins married life, a bored and frustrated Violette looks for something to keep herself occupied. Miss Mardle decides to make a fresh start, Agnes faces an unexpected obstacle close to home and Loxley makes trouble for Mr Selfridge.(n)

programme.title: The Ruth Rendell Mysteries

programme.desc: Part two of two. Eddie Brannel's protests of innocence urge Masters to go against orders, and as a consequence he learns the true identity of the killer. Drama, with Keith Barron and Ronald Pickup.(n)

programme.title: Kavanagh QC
programme.desc: A single mother from Sunderland asks Kavanagh to prosecute the neighbourhood vigilante she suspects of attempting to murder her teenage tearaway son in a hit-and-run incident. At first he has misgivings about accepting a case so far from home, but finally agrees, only to find his already strained family life suffering as a result. Tense legal drama, starring John Thaw and Lisa Harrow, with a guest appearance by Robert Glenister.(n)

programme.title: Peak Practice
programme.desc: A deranged woman holds a wounded Andrew and a heavily pregnant Clare at gunpoint, triggering a tense siege as armed police surround the Beeches. Gary Mavers and Fiona Gillies star.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: The slaughtermen arrive at an Aidensfield farm where a suspected case of foot-and-mouth disease has been reported, but receive a hostile reception. Nick is enlisted to help restore the peace - and gets drawn into a tragedy. Rural drama, starring Nick Berry and Bill Maynard.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: An Army deserter arrives in the village following a bust-up with his sadistic sergeant and causes problems for the Rowans when he starts stealing food to survive. programme.title: Upstairs, Downstairs
programme.desc: Elizabeth joins the suffragette movement and plans a raid on a local MP's house, but it is Rose who is arrested during the ensuing scuffle and sent to Holloway Prison.(n)

programme.title: Outside Edge

programme.title: Outside Edge
programme.desc: The team turns out for another Saturday game. Comedy, starring Josie Lawrence, Timothy Spall, Robert Daws and Brenda Blethyn.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The sleuth falls asleep during a flight from Paris to London, while a female passenger is murdered by a poisoned dart, leaving few clues to the killer's identity. Poirot soon discovers she was a money-lender, which may provide a motive for the killing. The investigation is turned on its head, however, when the victim's illegitimate daughter comes forward to claim the inheritance. Whodunit, starring David Suchet, with David Firth, Jenny Downham and John Bleasdale.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: When the sleuth's dentist is found dead just minutes after he leaves his surgery, Chief Inspector Japp believes it to be suicide - but Poirot has reason to think otherwise and embarks on his own investigation. Drama, starring David Suchet.(n)

programme.title: The Durrells
programme.desc: The family faces the unwanted arrival of a domineering aunt, while Larry's girlfriend also pays a visit - giving the unwelcome relative an opportunity to voice her disapproval of the whole family. Sven makes an offer that helps Louisa cope with adversity and Margo falls in love - but Gerry is more concerned with his newly acquired owlets.(n)

programme.title: Home Fires
programme.desc: The village prepares for Nick and Teresa's wedding as the Battle of Britain draws to an end. Pat faces a big decision as Marek prepares to leave, but Bob intends to ruin her plans. Frances fights to clear her name following the closure of the factory, Alison wrestles with her conscience, and a chance encounter leaves Joyce with some unanswered questions. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: The Americans

programme.title: Tutankhamun
programme.desc: Carter returns to the Valley of the Kings as the First World War draws to a close, hoping to complete his search for the lost tomb. Maggie also arrives in Egypt hoping to resume their relationship, but Carter finds himself smitten with Lord Carnarvon's daughter Evelyn. The excavation is threatened by a tide of Anti-British sentiment sweeping across Egypt, and Carter and Evelyn get caught up in a bombing. Meanwhile, Carnarvon is in financial difficulties, and cannot afford to fund Carter's seemingly hopeless search.(n)

programme.title: Food Unwrapped

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin and Jasmine Harman help a man who wants a home in Devon, where he can stay close to his family, friends and football team. However, his partner wants a property in southern Spain with a garden she can tend.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Sara Damergi and Laura Hamilton help three generations of the same family who are on the move together. Father John is considering buying a property for their unusual requirements in the Colchester area of Essex, but his daughter Lucy has her heart set on the Algarve in Portugal where her partner comes from. Whatever they finally decide, there must be room for grandad as well.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Sara Damergi and Laura Hamilton try to help a married couple decide where to buy their dream holiday home. While husband Graham is keen to find a property in north Cornwall, his wife Pat would prefer to spend her winters in the mild climate of Madeira, Portugal. The property experts show them some homes to help them make up their minds.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Sara Damergi and Laura Hamilton come to the aid of a woman who was inspired to consider moving to Madeira in Portugal after a holiday, but whose retired husband prefers the prospect of North Yorkshire.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Vicki Fairbrother hosts the first party in East Lancashire, hoping her steak main and banoffee pie dessert will be enough to win her the £1,000 prize. However, she must contend with self-confessed snob Chelsea Symcox, perfectionist Chris Slater, entrepreneur Jenna Tattersall and hairdresser Nigel Womack if she is to walk away with the cash at the end of the week.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Businesswoman Jenna Tattersall hosts the second dinner party in East Lancashire, but an unimpressed Chelsea Symcox suspects the stuffed courgette starter is intended to send a message to the guests. Jenna's decision to hire a bouncy castle as post-meal entertainment also causes concern.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Chris Slater tries to add some class to proceedings as he hosts the third dinner party in East Lancashire, but his habit of chewing with his mouth open disgusts his guests. The spicy main course gives Jenna Tattersall acid reflux, and Nigel Womack has an embarrassing incident with a shortbread biscuit.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Chelsea Symcox hosts the fourth party in East Lancashire. While the boys fight over a punch-bag in the garage, the girls discover a secret about their host when they find her credit card. Chelsea hopes her Mediterranean menu is enough to win her the £1,000 prize at the end of the week.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Hairdresser Nigel Womack hosts the final dinner party in East Lancashire, hoping his romantic evening will impress his guests. With a menu featuring aphrodisiacs, he aims to create an amorous mood among his diners, and also sings a song before the winner of the £1,000 prize is announced.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Another selection of B&B owners take it in turns as hosts to decide which of their establishments provides the best value for money. The contest begins at Dunsandles Guest House in New Brighton, Merseyside, where owner Alan Johnson and his professional sidekick Dave Owen hope to win the title - but a scandal with some unwanted hair on the bed sheets is not a good start, and two guests feel they are making an exhibition of themselves with a tea-trolley in full view of the neighbours.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: On the second day of the competition, the contestants visit the Lady Teal Hotel Boat on the waterways near Burnley in Lancashire, and owners Nick and Gina Mead hope to impress them with an afternoon of entertainment out on the locks. At breakfast, one of the guests admits to not enjoying his stay.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: From York House in Tetbury, Gloucestershire, where Brock Bergius hopes that his cheeky sense of humour and perfectionist nature will help him win the competition. He is in his element making saucy jokes during an afternoon of sausage making, but his reluctance to stray from the menu at breakfast leaves some of his guests disappointed.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition heads to Heyford House in Oxfordshire, where Leo and Sonya Brooke-Little hope to impress the contestants with their hospitality. The afternoon event is boxing, which Brock Burgius sees as the perfect opportunity to settle some scores with his fellow competitors.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The week's winner is announced as the B&B owners meet for the last time to thrash out their differences. Feedback includes criticism of a badly positioned tea tray, controversy over a hot chocolate and accusations of overenthusiastic hosting.(n)

programme.title: Great Canal Journeys
programme.desc: Part two of two. Timothy West and Prunella Scales leave India's canals behind to explore the Brahmaputra river, a rarely navigated stretch of water with a remarkable history. They follow an old tea trading route, meet a community of monks and take a ride on an elephant.(n)

programme.title: Rivers with Jeremy Paxman
programme.desc: The presenter travels along the Thames from its source in Gloucestershire to the Kent and Essex marshes, and delves into its history as a working river going back to the time of the Domesday Book. He meets people who maintain the river's locks and bridges, and work to manage flooding and deal with sewage.(n)

programme.title: It Was Alright In
programme.desc: Matt Lucas narrates another look back at TV shows from past decades, with clips and reactions to programmes from people not around to watch them at the time. This edition focuses on the time of revolution on the small screen in the 80s, including men co-habiting with sea lions, gay men and women coming out on TV, and monkeys playing tennis on ice.(n)

programme.title: It Was Alright In
programme.desc: Matt Lucas narrates another look back at TV shows from past decades, with this edition focusing on the time of Cool Britannia and programmes such as The Word, TFI Friday and The Girlie Show. With contributions by Chris Tarrant, Matt Forde, Jenny Eclair, Samira Ahmed and Philippa Perry.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats
programme.desc: Comedians Sarah Millican and Micky Flanagan, TV presenter Georgie Thompson and choreographer Louie Spence join host Jimmy Carr and team captains Sean Lock and Jon Richardson for the irreverent panel show, in which teams answer questions based on opinion polls carried out around the country to see who best understands what is going on in Britain today.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp comes to the aid of two friends who want to move to East London, and are pooling their resources in the hope of getting a shared house together. Phil Spencer helps a local woman aiming to make an investment that will help her with her long-term goal of quitting her job and making a living as a yoga teacher.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer are in Kent as they help two more couples on their property search. Kirstie is with Savannah and John, who are desperate to find their first home to buy in Maidstone, while Phil is with Londoners Matt and Tricia, who are looking for a home in the Kent countryside on a budget of £1.5million.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: The East Midlands is the focus of this week's house-hunting, as Kirstie Allsopp joins Sam and Becky, who have a £100,000 budget and are looking for a house in Nottingham with a sizeable plot of land. Phil Spencer is with Nigel and Jane, who sold their home in Australia and moved back to the UK when Nigel was diagnosed with early onset dementia. But despite being back for months, they have struggled to find a property that lives up to expectations.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Theatre-lover Claire Flatt hosts the first party in Ipswich, where one guest makes a big impression by arriving in a limousine. Claire prepares Thai fishcakes and Princess Jasmine rice, as well as her signature dish `chaos cake', in the hope of winning the £1,000 prize at the end of the week.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Millwall fan Kerrie Pankhurst hosts the second dinner party in Ipswich, which she decides to give a football theme - but the mood turns sour when one of the guests insults her team. Kerrie's decision to serve scallops and chorizo as her starter also does not go down well with DJ Dave James.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Magician David J Marks hosts the third dinner party in Ipswich, and hopes to win over Kerrie Pankhurst after offending her the previous night. His salmon starter impresses all the diners except Dave James, who explains all the gruesome things he would rather do than eat the fish, so the host lightens the mood by showing off his ventriloquist dummies and laying on a magic show.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: DJ Dave James hosts the fourth dinner party from Ipswich and asks his guests to attend dressed as pop stars. Claire Flatt and Nicki Yucel are suspicious about his celebrity connections, and there is trouble when the diners discover Dave obtained help with the cooking.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Speed-dating expert Nikki Yucel hosts the final dinner party in Ipswich, and is determined to cultivate a romantic atmosphere. As the evening progresses, Kerrie Pankhurst reveals her feelings for another diner, before the winner of the £1,000 prize is announced.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition gets underway at Springbank Guest House in Whaley Bridge, Derbyshire, where Susan Torkington offers her guests the chance to learn the art of cheerleading. However, the jovial atmosphere is ruined when three stray hairs leave her fuming by leaving time.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The Old Dairy in Bishops Barton, Somerset, run by former IT consultant Liz Cannon, is the venue for the second day of the competition. The guests encounter a digging session, a big argument and a close encounter with a hot teapot.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit is to the Toll House B&B in Saffron Walden, Essex, which is owned by Laurie and Carole Poole, featuring a competitive art session and a disturbed night's sleep for some of the guests. However, the plentiful breakfast proves to be a winner.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Maria Ettridge hosts the final visit at the Roebuck in Marchwood, Hampshire, where she hopes to entertain her guests with an afternoon lesson in woodland survival skills. However, things go downhill when they are unimpressed with their rooms and two of the contestants clash over dinner.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners meet for the final time to discover what their guests chose to pay. Tempers flare as the payments are revealed, and the contestants take the chance to settle some scores.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Carpenter Wes Leaver hosts the first party in east Kent, hoping his science theme will be enough to win him the £1,000 prize at the end of the week. However, the 34-year-old faces competition from estate agent Alexandra Austin, beautician Emma Phillips, dog-lover Sally Parry and fancy-dress enthusiast Stephen Drew.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Estate agent Alexandra Austen hosts the second party of the week in east Kent, hoping to impress her guests with pan-European cuisine. However, the meal gets off to a shaky start when Sally Parry is forced to confront her fear of beans, while Stephen Drew struggles with a goat's cheese parcel. Alexandra's decision to serve veal also proves controversial, and it soon becomes clear two of the guests are not enjoying each other's company.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Beautician Emma Phillips hosts the third dinner party in east Kent. Her main course is described by one diner as a pet on a plate, and Alexandra Austin declares the menu to be rather odd. Meanwhile, Stephen Drew and Wes Leaver enjoy an impromptu beauty treatment together.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Dog-lover Sally Parry hosts the fourth dinner party in east Kent, hoping to impress her guests with a pink-themed night, including posh pink food and table decorations. However, Sally and Emma have a heated argument, Alex misbehaves and Wes falls asleep.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Flamboyant Stephen Drew hosts the final dinner party in east Kent, and has designed a menu that will allow him to spend time entertaining his guests. programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo

programme.title: Super Bowl XXXIV
programme.desc: This video details the unlikely meeting of the St. Louis Rams and the Tennessee Titans in Super Bowl XXXIV. The Rams, 1999's Cinderella story, overcame their last place finish in 1998 to meet up with the young and ambitious Titans in the closest and most exciting Super Bowl in over a decade. The video pays special attention to Rams quarterback Kurt Warner and his climb from grocery stock boy in Iowa to Arena Football League lackey to Super Bowl MVP. The game footage and the comments from players and sports writers demonstrate the intensity and excitement generated as the game wore down to the last seconds, the outcome not determined until the final play. Super Bowl XXXIV also pays special tribute to long-time NFL coach Dick Vermeil and his last season as a head coach(n)

programme.title: Life and Death Row
programme.desc: Truth. In January 2014, in smalltown America, 18-year-old Justin Back is brutally murdered in his own home. Nineteen-year-old friends Austin Myers and Tim Mosley are arrested and charged with his murder. Both give very different stories, but which one is telling the truth? What will each one do to save themselves from the ultimate punishment - the death penalty?(n)

programme.title: Life and Death Row
programme.desc: Forgiveness. A police lieutenant is killed while chasing a reckless driver(n)

programme.title: Life and Death Row
programme.desc: Judgement. Series telling the story of capital punishment through the eyes of young people whose lives have been shaped by it. With unprecedented access inside prison walls, it discovers what it's like to live with the threat of the death chamber, as well as hearing from victims and their families, and the family of those on death row - some praying for execution, some hoping for a reprieve. Each episode focuses on a key aspect of the system - execution, trial and appeal. This film follows the trial of 26-year-old Guy Heinze Jr, with remarkable access to the jury members charged with reaching a verdict on allegations that Heinze beat his father and seven members of his family to death. As the trial progresses, there is legal manoeuvring while evidence about the brutal killings unfolds(n)

programme.title: Life and Death Row
programme.desc: Execution. Series telling the story of capital punishment through the eyes of young people whose lives have been shaped by it. In episode 1 for two of the youngest men on death row in Texas, execution day has arrived.(Followed By Weather and iWitness)(n)

programme.title: Life and Death Row
programme.desc: Crisis Stage. The final episode follows the work of young law students at the Death Penalty Clinic at the University of Houston Law Centre - the last line of defence - as they take on cases that have been discounted by state and federal appeals, known as 'crisis cases'(n)

programme.title: Inside the Green Berets
programme.desc: The troops at the heart of the harrowing special National Geographic: Inside the Green Berets are far from standard issue military men. As the U.S. soldiers assigned to a outpost in southern Afghanistan christened Firebase Cobra, and required to protect Afghani domestics from the brutal minions of the Taliban, these Berets walk a hair-thin line of risk between life and death, between sanctity and martyrdom. Following 9/11, the U.S. Pentagon restricted this region to the general press for reasons of security and safety, but made a brief, 48-hour exception for members of the National Geographic crew. During that precious span of time, the Taliban indeed struck; two American berets were killed, five others wounded, and members of the camera crew were severely injured as well. Inside the Green Berets presents the footage shot during that two day span, and thus creates an intense and uncompromising glimpse at the lives of the soldiers - the day-to-day risks they traverse, and the heroism they wield - in the said region(n)

programme.title: Drain the Ocean
programme.desc: Below the surface of the Earth's oceans lies a mysterious and relatively unknown world. With a diversity of life that rivals the rainforest, the ocean is one of the world's largest ecosystems, but relatively little is known about what lives in its great depths. Drain the Ocean draws on the latest scientific knowledge and uses CGI animation to remove the water, revealing a landscape of unimaginable scale - with underwater mountain ranges long enough to stretch round the world one and a half times - and with tens of thousands of mud volcanoes and other features that are more dynamic than anything found on land(n)

The programme also features footage of bald eagles stalking snow geese, hot rod ants who rely on the sun to kill their food, and headlight beetles that lure termites to their death with an eerie glow.(n)

General manager Thomas Kochs takes any change very seriously and oversees every decision necessary - from new alarm clocks to a £10million renovation plan.(n)

programme.desc: Fry falls in love with a virtual robot modelled on actress Lucy Liu that he downloads from the internet. programme.title: Futurama
programme.desc: Fry is shocked to realise he has become his own descendant after the Planet Express ship travels through time to Roswell in 1947, while Dr Zoidberg is captured by the military.(n)

programme.title: Futurama
programme.desc: The gang accidentally freezes the evil robot Santa, giving Fry the opportunity to revive the traditional jolly image of a bearer of good tidings and gifts. Featuring the guest voice of rapper Coolio.(n)

programme.title: David Attenborough's Conquest of the Skies
programme.desc: The veteran naturalist examines the world of flight, travelling across the globe to chart the evolutionary story of those creatures who seemingly defy the rules of gravity by taking to the air. Initially focusing on insects, Attenborough meets a descendant of the dragonfly, before examining the Atlas beetle, which tends to restrict flight to times when it needs a mate or a fresh supply of food. More aesthetically pleasing is a group of beautiful tropical butterflies, followed by an in-depth study into the blow fly - the jet fighter of insects.(n)

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Mitch reluctantly lets his distressed colleague Brenda stay the night, Phil and Claire think Alex has let her imagination run wild after she tells them she has a boyfriend, and Jay hits a Manny-shaped obstacle while trying to get out of accompanying Gloria to a party. Kirsten Johnston (3rd Rock from the Sun) guest stars, with Jesse Tyler Ferguson, Ty Burrell, Ed O'Neill and Julie Bowen.(n)

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Haley turns 21, so the adults hit a bar, where Claire is desperate to appear more of a pal than a nagging, uptight mum, and Cameron and Mitchell are distressed when their `cool' credentials come up short. Phil and Jay's quick pitstop to buy a present takes a disastrous turn, too, while back at home, Alex, Manny and Luke are left to babysit Lily.(n)

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: The Dunphys and Manny are on their way back from breakfast at the pancake house when Phil is forced to swerve out of the way of an oncoming truck, a brush with death that prompts them all to re-evaulate their lives. Comedy, starring Ty Burrell.(n)

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Claire confronts neighbours from hell Ronnie and Amber about the eyesore of a boat on their front lawn - and when they refuse to move it, Phil has no alternative but to call in the big guns - dad Frank and a few of his retired pals. Meanwhile, Cam takes Lily to clown school.(n)

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Phil takes it hard when Luke gives him the `teenage cold shoulder' - a day he always knew was coming - so he goes in search of a stand-in son. A dilemma presents itself for Jay when Gloria suspects Joe is allergic to Stella, while Mitchell does some freelance legal work for Claire, an experience he finds rather enlightening.(n)

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Valentine's Day arrives, which for the Dunphys means their chance to dress up and romance each other as their once-a-year role-play characters Clive and Juliana - although Claire begins to worry that Phil prefers her like this. Meanwhile, Jay's romantic plans hit a snag in the sassy form of Gloria's sister Sonia, who ends up trying to seduce him, and wires are crossed when Mitch and Cam find themselves in a sticky situation with pal Anders.(n)

programme.desc: Karl Pilkington travels the world in search of answers to some of life's most important questions. He begins with marriage, wondering whether he is wrong about not wanting to tie the knot with his long-term girlfriend. In Delhi, he gains an insight into arranged marriages by going on a date with a prospective wife - and her parents - and in Bangalore, he is asked to help a pair of elite wedding planners. He also sniffs out a scientific approach to finding the perfect partner in LA, before searching for an alternative way of getting hitched in Las Vegas.(n)

programme.title: Micro Monsters with David Attenborough
programme.desc: The broadcaster continues his bug-eyed view of the world of creepy-crawlies, revealing how predators defuse the defences of their prey. Highlights include the cockroach wasp, busy preparing a tasty - and very live - treat for its young, the whirligig beetle, which employs a water-based radar system, and the jumping portia spider, which feeds on other arachnids.(n)

programme.title: Micro Monsters with David Attenborough
programme.desc: A further selection of creepy-crawly close-ups, focusing on courtship in the bug world. Highlights include scorpions shaking their booty, the perfume-wearing nasonia wasp and the tropical cricket, for whom romance goes out of the window as it uses bribery to seal the deal with would-be partners. One potential partner to steer well clear of, however, is the praying mantis, the female of which is notorious for eating the male just after - or even during - mating. Narrated by David Attenborough.(n)

programme.title: Micro Monsters with David Attenborough
programme.desc: A close-up view of sex, bug-style, as David Attenborough talks viewers through the different ways in which creepy-crawlies reproduce. Size matters for the minuscule male orb spider, creepily sneaking up on its intended and trying to mate without her noticing, while there's no rest for the lothario-like butterfly, which has plenty of notches on its proverbial bedpost. However, the harvestman spider has no use for sex at all, and reproduces by cloning itself.(n)

programme.title: Micro Monsters with David Attenborough
programme.desc: David Attenborough shifts the focus to bugs that prefer cooperation rather than conflict. They include burrowing cockroaches, the suitably named social spiders - which share a 30-metre web - the queen bee and her happy hive of workers, and green ants pulling together to build a nest.(n)

programme.title: Zoo
programme.desc: With Jackson missing, Mitch and Abraham race to locate him before General Davies can. Sci-fi thriller, starring Billy Burke, Nonso Anozie and James Wolk.(n)

programme.title: Fish Town
programme.desc: Teenager Logan starts work as an apprentice deck-hand, while landlady Pat recalls fond memories from her life in Brixham.(n)

programme.title: Fish Town
programme.desc: Fish merchant Robert and his wife Kelly decide to open a seafood restaurant in Brixham - but their determinedly contemporary approach to cuisine leaves some locals unimpressed. The programme also follows the journey of a turbot over 36 hours, as it is caught and auctioned off before being served in an exclusive London restaurant.(n)

programme.title: Fish Town
programme.desc: The cameras follow three teams of fishermen participating in Brixham's annual Trawler Race, including a father and son who have been pitted against each other. Landlady Pat Seddon is not looking forward to the raucous celebrations, however, and decides to reminisce about past race days instead. The programme also meets Matt Kimble, a graduate who gave up on his plan to become a PE teacher and decided to follow his ancestors into the fishing trade instead.(n)

programme.title: The British
programme.desc: How Britain changed during the reign of the Tudor and Stuart monarchs. The programme explores the battles that established England as one of the world's leading naval powers and delves into Henry VIII's feud with the Catholic Church, revealing how he tried to silence dissenting voices. Contributors including Helen Mirren and Ben Kingsley also discover how literature from the period sowed the seeds of revolution, and learn why a riot organised from a prison cell laid the foundations for civil war.(n)

programme.title: The British
programme.desc: How money drove the making of modern Britain, exploring its role in the rebuilding of London following the Great Fire of 1666. The programme investigates how underhanded deals brokered in coffee houses fuelled British prosperity, and exposes how the country profited from dubious practices, including the slave trade, the sex industry and global colonisation. It also explores those who rebelled against the status quo during the period, and discovers how the armed forces countered the threat posed by Napoleon Bonaparte. With contributions by Jeremy Irons, Frank Lampard and Terry Wogan.(n)

programme.title: Open Your Eyes
programme.desc: Filmed over three days, the documentary follows an ageing couple from Nepal as they embark on a transformative journey to reclaim their sight.(n)

programme.title: House

programme.desc: Jack and the team investigate a girl's disappearance from a psychiatric hospital, and discover the key to the case may lie in her mother's death some years previously - which was officially ruled as suicide, but may actually have been a murder.(n)

programme.title: The British
programme.desc: How the Norman Conquest in 1066 transformed Britain, as William the Conqueror sought to assert his power over the whole of England by dismantling the Anglo-Saxon aristocracy and crushing regional diversity. The programme explores the human cost of his campaign and the lasting legacy of the social structures established by the Normans, and explains how a spirit of resistance began to foment among the population. Dramatic reconstructions also reveal how the longbow was instrumental in Henry V's famous victory at the battle of Agincourt in 1415. With contributions by Tim Roth, Jeremy Irons, Micky Flanagan and Tracey Emin.(n)

programme.title: The British
programme.desc: How Britain changed during the reign of the Tudor and Stuart monarchs. The programme explores the battles that established England as one of the world's leading naval powers and delves into Henry VIII's feud with the Catholic Church, revealing how he tried to silence dissenting voices. Contributors including Helen Mirren and Ben Kingsley also discover how literature from the period sowed the seeds of revolution, and learn why a riot organised from a prison cell laid the foundations for civil war.(n)

programme.title: The British
programme.desc: The expansion of Britain's empire through exploration and invention as the Industrial Revolution transformed society and the economy - though the rise of mechanised factories was not welcomed by all. programme.title: The British
programme.desc: The development of London during the Victorian era, as the city at the heart of the British empire rapidly expanded - and social divisions became increasingly pronounced. The programme explores the grandeur of the period, including the building of the Crystal Palace, as well as sharp rises in vice and crime that prompted outrage among reformers including Charles Dickens and Josephine Butler. There is also a look at how football became increasingly popular.(n)

programme.title: The Benchwarmers
programme.desc: Three losers who have been pushed around all their lives decide to finally stand up for themselves and rebuild their self-esteem. With the backing of a millionaire, they form their own baseball team and take part in a tournament - in which all the other competitors are children. Sporting comedy, starring Rob Schneider, Jon Heder, David Spade and Jon Lovitz.(n)

programme.title: Walk Hard: The Dewey Cox Story
programme.desc: A singer is transformed from naive country boy to the greatest rock 'n' roll legend of all time - with the traditional stand-bys of sex, drugs, failed marriages, falls from grace, spectacular comebacks and the love of a good woman along the way. Comedy spoof of music biopics, starring John C Reilly, Jenna Fischer and Raymond J Barry, and featuring appearances from Jack Black and Jack White.(n)

programme.title: Talladega Nights: The Ballad of Ricky Bobby
programme.desc: A Nascar racing champion has everything he could want - until an arrogant French rival seizes the title from him, and his wife runs off with his best friend. Forced to move back in with his mother, the downhearted driver turns to his estranged father for help rebuilding his shattered self-confidence. Comedy, starring Will Ferrell, John C Reilly and Sacha Baron Cohen.(n)

programme.title: My Big Fat Greek Wedding 2
programme.desc: A woman struggling to cope with a rebellious daughter and a marriage that has strayed into a rocky patch discovers a shocking family secret - her parents marriage is not legal. She decides to try and resolve the situation by getting the family to rally round and organise the most elaborate wedding imaginable. Romantic comedy sequel, starring Nia Vardalos and John Corbett.(n)

programme.title: Keanu
programme.desc: When thugs steal Keanu the cat, two mild-mannered cousins pose as deadly assassins to get the beloved feline back. Action comedy, starring Jordan Peele, Keegan-Michael Key and Tiffany Haddish.(n)

programme.title: Sausage Party
programme.desc: When he hears life after the supermarket isn't much fun for groceries, Frank the sausage investigates. Animated comedy, featuring the voices of Seth Rogen and Kristen Wiig.(n)

programme.title: How to Lose a Guy in 10 Days
programme.desc: A female journalist sets out to demonstrate how women manage to put off prospective partners, and spies the perfect man on whom to test her theories. However, the experiment takes an unexpected turn thanks to her guinea pig, who has a hidden agenda of his own. Romantic comedy, starring Kate Hudson, Matthew McConaughey, Adam Goldberg and Michael Michele.(n)

programme.title: My Big Fat Greek Wedding 2
programme.desc: A woman struggling to cope with a rebellious daughter and a marriage that has strayed into a rocky patch discovers a shocking family secret - her parents marriage is not legal. She decides to try and resolve the situation by getting the family to rally round and organise the most elaborate wedding imaginable. Romantic comedy sequel, starring Nia Vardalos and John Corbett.(n)

programme.title: Sausage Party
programme.desc: When he hears life after the supermarket isn't much fun for groceries, Frank the sausage investigates. Animated comedy, featuring the voices of Seth Rogen and Kristen Wiig.(n)

programme.title: Keanu
programme.desc: When thugs steal Keanu the cat, two mild-mannered cousins pose as deadly assassins to get the beloved feline back. Action comedy, starring Jordan Peele, Keegan-Michael Key and Tiffany Haddish.(n)

programme.title: Coming to America
programme.desc: A bored African prince defies his father's plans for an arranged marriage and escapes to the USA to find a bride on his own terms. Comedy, starring Eddie Murphy and Arsenio Hall in several roles, with James Earl Jones, Allison Dean, Eriq La Salle and Madge Sinclair.(n)

programme.title: Bruno
programme.desc: A gay Austrian fashion journalist becomes a figure of hate in his own country, and heads to America in search of celebrity with his adoring assistant in tow. He embarks on a campaign of publicity stunts to make himself famous, encountering prejudice and meeting people similarly desperate for stardom. Spoof documentary, starring Sacha Baron Cohen and Gustaf Hammarsten.(n)

programme.title: Awkward Sexy People
programme.desc: Two close friends who have always been unlucky in love resort to a drastic plan to turn their lives around. They decide to spend a summer indulging in as much hard drinking and casual sex as they can, in the hope that the experience will transform them into the confident people they have always longed to be. Romantic comedy, starring Adam Pally and Sarah Burns.(n)

programme.title: Son of the Pink Panther
programme.desc: Comedy sequel which sees Inspector Clouseau's over-enthusiastic son on the trail of a kidnapped princess, proving to be just as inept as his father every step of the way. Starring Roberto Benigni, Herbert Lom, Claudia Cardinale, Burt Kwouk, Debrah Farentino and Graham Stark.(n)

programme.title: Ghostbusters: Special
programme.desc: The making of the long-awaited horror comedy reboot, including interviews with Melissa McCarthy and the rest of the cast.(n)

programme.title: Big Daddy
programme.desc: An immature 32-year-old is heartbroken when his girlfriend walks out on him. In a plan to win her back, he volunteers to look after his flatmate's five-year-old son, thus demonstrating he is finally ready to grow up. However, his ideas of childcare prove unconventional and chaos quickly ensues. Comedy, with Adam Sandler, Joey Lauren Adams, Jon Stewart, Josh Mostel, Leslie Mann, Rob Schneider and Kristy Swanson, alongside Steve Buscemi in a cameo role.(n)

programme.title: Valentine's Day
programme.desc: Anthology of stories charting the romantic complications of various Los Angeles residents. A businessman and a soldier on leave share a flight home, a teacher is smitten with a doctor and an elderly couple comfort their lovesick grandson. Romantic comedy drama, with Ashton Kutcher, Jessica Alba, Jamie Foxx, Jennifer Garner and Julia Roberts.(n)

programme.title: 27 Dresses
programme.desc: Singleton Jane is literally always the bridesmaid and never the bride, a role she assumes for the 28th time when her sister announces she is getting married - to a man Jane is secretly in love with. As she wrestles with her feelings, Jane's predicament attracts the attention of a reporter fascinated by her story. Romantic comedy, starring Katherine Heigl, James Marsden and Malin Akerman.(n)

programme.title: Hot Tub Time Machine
programme.desc: A man suffering a midlife crisis tries to recapture his lost youth by going back to his old haunts with two equally unhappy friends and his teenage nephew. They end up being transported back to 1986 and are tempted to give themselves the lives they always wanted - despite warnings that they must not change anything. Sci-fi comedy, starring John Cusack, Clark Duke, Craig Robinson and Rob Corddry.(n)

programme.title: Sisters
programme.desc: Two estranged sisters are reunited when their parents decide to sell the house they grew up in. They return to the family home to clear out their childhood bedrooms, but with their parents away, seize the chance to relive their teenage years and throw one last wild house party. Comedy, starring Amy Poehler, Tina Fey and Dianne Wiest.(n)

programme.title: Hot Pursuit
programme.desc: An uptight, accident prone police officer desperate to prove herself has to protect a gangster's widow who has agreed to give evidence against a drug lord. They end up forced to go on the run together, and are pursued across Texas by hitmen and corrupt cops. Crime comedy, starring Reese Witherspoon and Sofia Vergara.(n)

programme.title: Brewster's Millions
programme.desc: A baseball player is stunned to learn he has come into a massive inheritance. Unfortunately, there is one condition - he must somehow find a way to spend $30million in just one month, or he will lose the lot. Meanwhile, two scheming lawyers, who stand to get the money if he fails, are determined to sabotage his efforts. Comedy, starring Richard Pryor, John Candy, Lonette McKee and Jerry Orbach.(n)

programme.title: Hot Tub Time Machine
programme.desc: A man suffering a midlife crisis tries to recapture his lost youth by going back to his old haunts with two equally unhappy friends and his teenage nephew. They end up being transported back to 1986 and are tempted to give themselves the lives they always wanted - despite warnings that they must not change anything. Sci-fi comedy, starring John Cusack, Clark Duke, Craig Robinson and Rob Corddry.(n)

programme.title: Sisters
programme.desc: Two estranged sisters are reunited when their parents decide to sell the house they grew up in. They return to the family home to clear out their childhood bedrooms, but with their parents away, seize the chance to relive their teenage years and throw one last wild house party. Comedy, starring Amy Poehler, Tina Fey and Dianne Wiest.(n)

programme.title: Grosse Pointe Blank
programme.desc: A hitman takes the chance to combine his latest assassination job with a trip back to his home town for a school reunion. The occasion starts to get complicated when an old flame turns up and rekindles their lost romance - while a rival killer harasses him to join an assassins' union. Black comedy drama, starring John Cusack, Minnie Driver, Dan Aykroyd, Joan Cusack and Alan Arkin.(n)

programme.title: Peter Pan
programme.desc: Three children are visited in the night by a magical flying boy and a fairy named Tinker Bell. The strange youngster takes them away to his home, the magical island of Neverland, where his band of runaway youngsters are engaged in an ongoing battle with a crew of pirates. Disney animated adventure based on JM Barrie's novel, with the voices of Bobby Driscoll and Hans Conried.(n)

programme.title: The Fox and the Hound
programme.desc: An orphaned fox cub is taken in by a kindly widow, and becomes firm friends with a puppy belonging to a hunter. However, as they grow to adulthood, the dog is trained to prey on foxes, and the two animals realise their friendship may not survive as they are expected to be natural enemies. Animated adventure, with the voices of Mickey Rooney and Kurt Russell.(n)

programme.title: Finding Nemo
programme.desc: Clownfish Nemo becomes separated from his friends on the Great Barrier Reef - but the thrill of being able to swim freely and away from his overprotective father turns to horror when he is netted by a diver. His distraught dad sets out on a mission to find him, while the youngster finds himself in a dentist's tropical tank. Pixar animated adventure, with the voices of Albert Brooks, Ellen DeGeneres, Alexander Gould, Willem Dafoe, Barry Humphries and Geoffrey Rush.(n)

programme.title: Frankenweenie
programme.desc: A lonely boy uses electricity to bring his dead dog back to life. However, the presence of the animal in the neighbourhood leads to panic over a monster, while the young scientist's classmates are soon also meddling with life and death to revive their own pets. Tim Burton's stop-motion animated fantasy, with the voices of Charlie Tahan and Winona Ryder.(n)

programme.title: The Jungle Book
programme.desc: A boy is raised by animals in the jungles of India, but his carefree life is threatened by the return of a fierce tiger with a grudge against humans. The youngster faces a difficult choice between remaining with his friends or returning to his own people. Live action remake of Disney's animated adventure based on Rudyard Kipling's stories, starring Neel Sethi, with the voices of Bill Murray, Ben Kingsley and Idris Elba.(n)

programme.title: Bambi
programme.desc: A young deer grows up in the forest, forming close friendships with other woodland creatures. When tragedy strikes, he is suddenly forced to fend for himself but ultimately becomes brave and resourceful enough to save his friends during a forest fire. Animated drama, with the voices of Bobby Stewart, Hardie Albright and Donnie Dunagan.(n)

programme.title: Aladdin
programme.desc: A street urchin is caught up in a scheming grand vizier's plot to get his clutches on a magical lamp. Retrieving the object from a wondrous cave, he releases a powerful genie trapped inside, whose ability to grant wishes helps the young hero thwart the villain's plans and woo a princess. Animated adventure, featuring the voices of Robin Williams, Scott Weinger and Linda Larkin.(n)

programme.title: Frankenweenie
programme.desc: A lonely boy uses electricity to bring his dead dog back to life. However, the presence of the animal in the neighbourhood leads to panic over a monster, while the young scientist's classmates are soon also meddling with life and death to revive their own pets. Tim Burton's stop-motion animated fantasy, with the voices of Charlie Tahan and Winona Ryder.(n)

programme.title: Finding Nemo
